loans.name: Susana Hilaria

texts.es:
Susana is a 61-year-old widow who lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. She has eight grown up children who are all independent.

Susana has been running a beauty salon for 17 years. She started out selling cosmetics in the oriental market, but then she sold her business space and set up a beauty salon. She will invest her loan in purchasing cosmetics and beauty supplies.

Her plans are to relocate her beauty salon to a more strategic place, and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es viuda, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 61 años de edad, y tiene ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad y que son independientes a ella.

Susana tiene un salón de belleza, que tiene 17 años de experiencia, comenzó a ser comerciante en el mercado oriental vendiendo cosméticos, luego vendió su tramo y puso el salón de belleza. El préstamo lo va a invertir en compras de cosmético y productos de belleza.

Sus planes son ubicar el salón de belleza en un punto estratégico y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Kweku E. is a carpenter. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Kweku and his three children. Demand for his product is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for $400 of additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim H. is a villager in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder and farmer. Since her pig breeding business is going well, Mrs. Kim H. would like to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Kim H. will use part of the loan to buy pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Aun Khin, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kim H. is a 49-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while the remaining three are attending school. Mrs. Kim H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen Baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in an area named Shalimar, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a mobile phone shop. Her husband is a loader by profession. Her younger son and two daughters are enrolled in a local school in the neighborhood. Shaheen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She successfully completed her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more handsets to expand her son's business.

loans.use: To buy more handsets

loans.name: Marleny Santos

texts.es:
La señora Marleny Santos, tiene 34 años, está casada, estudió corte y confección en el Instituto Perpetuo Socorro en la ciudad de Trujillo, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó a trabajar en  un taller de costura, donde confeccionaba mandiles, pedidos para colegios, servicios. Su tía la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque quería independizarse, tener un negocio propio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tela, ella dispone de una máquina recta.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de tela polar para hacer buzos, los cuales lleva su tío a la sierra para vender.
La empresaria sueña con tener un taller propio, comprar una máquina remalladora, disponer de personal que trabaje para ella y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marleny Santos is 34 years old, married, and studied design and production in the Socorro Perpetual Institute in Trujillo. She has 2 children, who are students, and they live in the El Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, of La Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically, she started working in a tailoring shop, where she made aprons, uniforms and other special orders. Her aunt referred her to the community Bank, "Successful Women II" and she decided to become a member because she wanted to become independent and have her own business. With her first loan of $100 she purchased material to use in a straight sewing machine. With this loan of $400, which she will repay over 4 months, she will purchase fleece materials to make coats, which her uncle with take into the mountains to sell. The businesswoman dreams of having her own shop, purchasing a weaving machine, and employing someone to work for her, and for her children to become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material in bulk.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah M. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a monument officer.

Since 2006, Hannah has operated a local restaurant, popularly known as chop bar hear, where she serves a variety of local dishes like fufu, which is made out of cassava and plantain pounded together. The restaurant is at kwabina Gyan square in Elmina. Hannah uses her income to feed her family and pay her utility bills.

Hannah will use this loan to purchase more ingredients, including spices and other food items, so she can prepare more food at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to help her husband start putting up a house for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for food preparation at her restaurant.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es: La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Cedros Mz. C Lt. 13, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como representantes de ventas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad confecciona zapatos para damas y niñas, negocio que le brinda una ganancia para pagar su préstamo puntualmente.  nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de mostacillas, una docena de lágrimas acrílicas, 3 docenas de hebillas plateadas y otros adornos. nnMónica manifiesta que desde muy joven se hizo independiente gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.n
texts.en:
Monica belongs to the Communal Bank, "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 26 years old and is the mother of 2 young children that still depend on her. She is married, and her husband is a sales representative. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling soda. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she makes shoes for women and girls, a business that provides her with the earnings to pay her loan on time. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen beads, 1 dozen acrylic teardrops, 3 dozen silver-plated buckles, and other decorations. Monica claims that since she was very young she has been independent, thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos offers to her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen beads, 1 dozen acrylic teardrops, 3 dozen silver-plated buckles, and other decorations

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de el Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, menestras y carne de aves en su puesto de venta que ella tiene en el mercado de su localidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará diversos productos como menestras de diferentes tipos papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar en sacos, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, gallinas y todo tipo de condimentos para ofertar a sus clientes.

Tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos, 2 de ellos ya son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún depende de ella y está estudiando, ambos la apoyan en su negocio. Desea en el futuro arreglar su casa y poner un negocio de abarrotes y pasamanería, para no estar madrugando todos los días sobretodo por la dificultad que tiene con su vista.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Amelia is a member of the community bank ‘Doradinas en Accion.’ She lives in the department of San Martin, in the province of el Dorado, in the district of San José de Sisa. She works selling groceries, vegetables, and poultry in the store that she has in the market in her neighbourhood. With this loan of S/.1,000, which she would repay in 4 months, she would buy various products like vegetables of different types, packets of toilet paper, preserved fish, litres of oil, rice, bags of sugar, bleach, detergent, different brands and sizes of milk, chickens and all types of condiments to offer to her clients. She is 55 years old; she has three children, two of whom are independent. Now she lives with her spouse and one of her children who still depends on her and is studying. Both of them help her with the business. In the future, she wants to fix her house and to have a business of groceries and decorative textiles, and to not have to get up at the crack of dawn every day because of the difficulty that she has with her eyesight.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her grocery store

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Shakeela Nazeer Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is 39 years old and lives in a famous historical place called Yadgar, in Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady, and she wants to get an education but her dream isn't being fulfilled. Her husband's name is N. A., who sells animal feed. He has been in this business for the past 13 years. She is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son helps his father in his business. The next one is a delivery man and delivers items in his donkey cart from one place to another. The last two sons have a plastic shopping bag sales business. Her daughter reads in 7th standard.

Shakeela baji makes plastic shopping bags and her sons go to the market to sell them. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy animal feed to expand her husband’s business.

She is a group leader of a few more member of her locality. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy CD’s to resell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell. Rizwana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Vien Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Srae Spey village in Kampong Cham Province. The members plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Vien N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase three more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Srorn, is employed in a government department. Mrs. Vien N. is 59 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while another is a motorbike repairer and the other is attending the local school.  

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase three more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Esther sells planks. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN ($350 US) to purchase more planks to sell. She says, "Thanks" to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man S. is 37 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has three children: one is married and lives separately, and the other two attend school.

Man has been a dried fish seller since 1998. She has already completed her first loan cycle, which helped her to earn a good income with the money she invested. She has therefore decided to request a second loan cycle. She is requesting $1200 to buy one hundred kilograms of fish. She will dry the fish under the sunshine and then sell them in the retail market at a high price.

With this loan, she believes that she can earn a greater profit. With her profit, she wants to buy another small plot of living land next to her house. She dreams that her children will finish school and they can all live in a big house. Man S. was not available when the photograph was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy one hundred kilograms of fish

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif F. is a family man who wants to expand his business so that he can better support his family and give them a better quality of life. Three years ago, Asif started selling spare parts for various types of cars. He started with $9000 of capital. His business has grown little by little, and now he offers a variety of products. During last two years he also learned how to repair cars and now he is not just seller but also a master.

Asif has been working with AqroInvest and had a Kiva loan, which he successfully completed. He feels very satisfied with the support he has received, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers, and support his family. Asif has applied to borrow 1200 USD to improve working conditions in his store. He wants to expand his business and increase his income to create a better life for his parents and future family.

loans.use: To expand his car parts store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is a 42-year-old owner of a boutique in Rongo and she sells ready-made clothes for men and women. She likes running her own business and she likes being able to manage it herself to her own capacity. She has five children; the oldest is 23 and the youngest is 8. She is asking for 20,000 KSH to purchase new stock. In addition to clothes, she would like to purchase shoes and bags. She says that with three kids in college and two in high school, she has a hard time maintaining all the school fees.

loans.use: adding to clothing stock, shoes, bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of twenty four members is located in RotE. village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Channa H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery product to sell to earn more profits to support her family’s living. Her husband, Mr. Chhith Chhum, is a fisherman.

Mrs. Channa H. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other stays at home because it is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery product for her store

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джуре 41 год. Он женат и отец 5-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Джура занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Джуры – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Джура экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Джура продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Jura is 41 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is not employed, but stays at home, does housework, and feeds the livestock. Jura raises and sells cattle. For him, the beginning of spring means the time to buy animals, as they are cheaper this time of year. He also doesn't spend much on feed for the cows. They eat the mountain pasture, so Jura doesn't need to buy feed. At the beginning of fall Jura sells some of the fattened cows. In the fall he doesn't buy livestock, only feed for the remaining animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 48 years old, is married and the father of three children, although he actually takes care of five children. They are all attending school. He is very hard-working and dedicated to his work.

Samuel has been a carpenter for 22 years. Carpentry has been his major occupation and provides the main source of his family's livelihood. He owns a carpentry shop, where he manufactures all kinds of furniture items. Samuel builds chairs, wardrobes, beds, and other such pieces.

He tells us that lack of adequate working capital has prevented him from being able to pre-finance most of the orders he receives from his customers. This, he says, slows down his work because he is obliged to wait for full funds from his customers before any work can begin, which usually results in substantial delays. He requests this loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and furnishing materials, such as polish, glue, sandpaper, and wooden boards to improve upon his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income and ensure a better living for himself and his family.

It has been Samuel's dream to be one of the best carpenters in his entire community. It is also his desire to support the children in his household.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, and sandpaper

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a mother of four and is married to Esmael, a Muslim. She is 32 years old and lives in a rented apartment house in Pasay City. Three of her children go to school. The youngest one is still a baby. She and her husband jointly manage a footwear sales business in Baclaran, the bargain center of South Manila.

By the grace of God, the business is doing well and is poised to expand. She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase additional shoes and sandals to sell. This is her fourth loan from CCT. She has been faithful in repaying her loans on time.

Ofelia and her husband earn P40,000 each month from their footwear business. They are also able to employ two helpers. From the earnings, they were able to provide for the needs of their family and save for the purchase of their own house and lot.

Ofelia joined CCT in October 2008 and, since then, has looked forward to the CCT fellowship meetings, because she considers the meetings to be bonding time with her fellow CCT members. The CCT weekly fellowship meetings are a venue for CCT community partners/clients to get together to study the word of God, participate in fellowship together, and to encourage one another, as well as to update their loans and savings data.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Nohemy Concepción

texts.es: Nohemy Concepción C. A. de 28 años de edad reside en San Luis La Herradura ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Nohemy vive con su esposo que trabaja como taxista y su promedio de ganancias mensuales es de 100$, tiene dos niños aun menores de edad Adriana de 7 años y Diego de 5 años de edad ambos niños son estudiantes. Nohemy posee un negocio donde producen queso, y se comercializa en diferentes lugares cercanos, Nohemy es fuente de ingresos para otras familias ya que ella posee un pequeño grupo de trabajadores que le ayudan en su negocio, el destino del crédito que solicita Nohemy  es para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus quesos.
texts.en:
28-year-old Nohemy Concepción C. A. resides in San Luis La Herradura in the district of La Paz. Nohemy lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and earns an average of $100 per month. She has two children who are still of a young age; Adriana is 7 years old, and Diego is 5 years old. Both children are students. Nohemy owns a cheese-making business, and sells her cheeses at several local locations. Nohemy functions as a source of income for other families as well, employing a small group of workers who help her run her business. The money that Nohemy requests will be put toward the purchase of raw materials for the making of her cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a widower and the father of five children. He has served as mother and father to his five children. He was having a hard time disciplining his children, because he is also responsible for providing for his family's daily needs and for the daily school necessities of his children. Fred is a very good model father. He is very responsible and is not an in-favor father. He is patient and works hard to fulfill his duties and responsibilities for his family's welfare. 

To earn an income each day, Fred runs a jeep transport service from the village of Sili, where they live, to the market. As much as possible, Fred wanted to double his work time to generate a higher daily income for his children. He is requesting the support of Kiva to maintain the used jeep that he uses in his transportation business. He hopes to borrow PHP 9,000 for vehicle maintenance.

loans.use: Jeep maintenance

loans.name: Mantou

texts.fr: mantou F. evolue dans le domaine du commerce et vend des produits cosmetiques depuis plus de sept ans.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1994.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour pour faire face a la forte demande et augmenter sa part du marche.ses benefices supplementaires lui permettront de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Mantou F. has been improving in the domain of selling cosmetic products for over seven years. She has been a recipient parent since 1994. She’s requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to cope with the strong demand and to increase her market share. Her additional profits will enable her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Lucrecia es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Lucrecia tiene una librería y Multiservicios llamado AyL, que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado, en donde vende artículos de escritorio, equipos de computo y otros servicios.
Lucrecia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles de escritorio.
El sueño de Lucrecia son ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: la compra de útiles de escritorio.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn S., 47, is married and lives with two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She works a farm with her husband and typically makes $3 USD each day. Besides farming, her husband also operates a horse cart taxi. This business earns him an additional $5 USD a day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Phorn S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, Phorn is asking for a loan of $700 USD, which she will use to purchase fertilizer for the farm and also make a new investment in a charcoal business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and invest in a charcoal business

loans.name: Blasa

texts.es: La señora Blasa I. vive solita en su casita ya que todos sus hijos ya están casados, pero  no deja de contar con el apoyo de ellos. Ella labora para un restaurante en el área de cocina desde hace 1 año, y los fines de semana elabora docenas de tamales desde hace 2 años, como su clientela ha crecido ella desea invertir en mas mercancía para la elaboración y venta de sus tamales y por tal motivo están solicitando este crédito.

loans.use: Inversion en mercancia para la elaboracion y venta de sus tamales

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark R. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 18 years old. Mark is single. To make a living, Mark owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the local community and local market. Mark is just starting this business.

In October 2009, Mark joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mark from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de una niña de 10 años y es por esta razón, que ella se esfuerza.Santos, se dedica a la venta de mercería, lleva 10 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Santos, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y darle a su pequeña hija, una buena educación y verla profesional, mas adelante.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mercería muy variada como juguetes de plástico para niños, elástico en rollos, blondas con diferentes diseños, hilos y botones en diferentes colores y tamaños, cosméticos como colonias, cremas, lápiz labiales, esmaltes de diferentes marcas, todo esto hará que su clientela aumente y este contenta y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mayores.Santos, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of a 10 year old daughter. Santos works in order to support her daughter.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a haberdashery in the central market of the district. Her store is well-equipped to accommodate her customers. She indicates that her business is doing well. Santos works hard every day so that she can fulfill her dreams and provide her young daughter with a good education so that she can become a successful professional. At the moment, she has loyal customers who come by her store every day to shop. She welcomes everyone individually with her charming personality.

With this loan of 3000 soles, Santos will buy a variety of merchandise for her haberdashery such as plastic toys for children, rolls of elastic, lace in different designs, threads, and buttons in different colors and sizes. She will also purchase cosmetics such as colognes, crèmes, lipsticks, and nail polishes of different brands. The additional inventory will enable her to attract more customers and keep them happy. As a results, her earnings should be higher.

Santos now feels that she is an accomplished woman who is eager to move forward and realize her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her haberdashery

loans.name: Mrs. Sothea Seim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sothea S. is the village bank president of a loan group that consists of 16 people in Chey Otdom village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sothea S. owns a shop to sell compact discs to the villagers. She now faces a small problem because most of her CDs do not work well. To improve the CDs, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment to make CDs more smoothly.  She is a widow with two children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy equipment to make CDs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth R. is from the village of Rizal. She is 29 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a general store in her local community, selling different products including cosmetics. Janeth earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Janeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bisoboka Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a business of selling matooke “green bananas” from Buwundo and Kizigo trading centres. She is a single mother with 2 children and she takes care of her other siblings, and she is grateful that the loans have helped her cope. She buys her matooke from the trucks and from the farmers in her surrounding villages and this helps her to have enough stock for her customers which is of good quality. She needs a loan to be able to stock more bunches of matooke to her stall since this will give her more profits after the sales to cater for other needs.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Mary Akumu

texts.en: Mary Akumu O. owns a cereal business. Her main commodity is maize, which she sells at Rongo Market in Kenya. She is married and the guardian of 8 orphaned children. Her main plan is to ensure education for all the orphans in her care. She would like a loan of Kshs. 30, 000 to expand her business inventory which she buys twice a week and sells at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert M. is 61 years old. He lives with his wife and son in their own house in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area. Albert has been a driver for about 20 years and also, together with his family he is engaged in stock-breeding. They have 3 cows, 30 sheep and 4 calves in their farm.

Albert uses the profit from stock-breeding activities for his family's needs. His business is located on his private land. Now Albert M. needs 1,100,000 AMD as a loan to buy some more cows.

loans.use: To buy some cows

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz A., 55 years old and married with four children, sells flour wholesale as well as retail. In this business for more than 20 years, Hafiz is able to support his family from the generated income. Today he is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more flour to enlarge his range of goods. Hafiz thanks everybody for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase profit

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru: Нодиров Убайдулло проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Убайдулло имеет среднее образование. Более 14 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода. Он одновременно занимается растениеводством. У него собственный земельный участок, где он выращивает оващи. Целью кредита является закуп крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Ubaydullo N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. Ubaydullo has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 14 years. He breeds cattle to resell it for meat. This business is the secondary source of income. Ubaydullo is simultaneously involved in agriculture. He owns a plot of land, where he grows vegetables. The goal of this loan is a purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Alex Randolph

texts.es:
Alex Randolph R. H.,  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cinco créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura para ya que va a cambiar el techo de su casa por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Alex dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alex Randolph R. H. works as a hygienist in Managua's Wholesale Market. He is married with two school age children to care for. He has taken five loans with CEPRODEL over five years. In this period of time he has invested a loan in the improvement of his home, thanks to funding granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is requesting is to purchase construction materials such as zinc, purlins, nails, and paint to replace the roof of his house, which is in a poor state of repair. All of this is to provide greater security and better living conditions to his children. Alex said that the granted loans have been for the improvement of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvements and Expansion

loans.name: Gioconda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Gioconda de los Ángeles López E.     ella se desempeña como directora de un colegio   ella tiene de laborar  para esta institución diecinueve  años, es madre de dos hijos ambos en edad escolar, ella es casada  actualmente. Ha tenido  nueve   créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un aumento a su casa de habitación, para tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Gioconda de los Ángeles López E. works as the principal of a school. She has worked for this institution for 19 years. She has two school age children, and she is currently married. She has had nine loans with Ceprodel. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to enlarge her house and have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and sand

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maireny is the coordinator of her group Union Con Esperanza (Union with Esperanza), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outsiD. of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with husband and two children.

Maireny is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes by traveling to the main markets in Santiago and purchasing to sell to her neighbors in her community. She will use the profits to invest in her university education as well as saving towards the education of her children. She also plans to save toward her goal of purchasing a plot of land on which to build her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Flacir

texts.en:
Flacir J. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years-old and unmarried.  Flacir owns and operates a service-based business providing shoe repair services to local community members. Flacir has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flacir joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flacir is requesting a first loan of 3,000 PHP which will be to purchase additional materials for the shoe repair shop. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials.

loans.name: Benicio Alcidez

texts.es:
el sr. Benicio S. vive en la Aldea Lazaro en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, Benicio tiene 30 años de edad.
el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para venta, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, Benicio es una persona muy activa y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. dice sentirse muy feliz ya que este tipo de actividad le gusta mucho hacerla, espera que para fin de año tener muchos chanchitos para la venta, la epoca de fin de año es muy buena para la venta de cerdo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para cerdos.
texts.en:
Benicio lives in the Lazaro hamlet of the city of San Lorenzo Valle. He is 30 years old and raises hogs. He has only been doing this for a short time, but he is very active and possesses a great desire to get ahead. He says that he is very happy because he likes doing this. He hopes that he will have many piglets to sell by the end of the year. The end of year season is a good time for hog sales. He will use the money from this loan to buy hogs and feed.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs and feed

loans.name: La Fe (Grupos 1-5) Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is the coordinator of her group La Fe (Faith), and her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Aurelia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small clothing sales business by purchasing necessary supplies - undergarments and other articles. She will use the profits to improve the well-being of her family and grow her business. Aurelia hopes to have her own house in the future. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a small undergarment sales business

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny C. is 50 years old and her husband, Mr. Thorn Sum, is 52 years old.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1977 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live in separate homes, one is in school and another one assists his parents in the business.  

Vanny and her husband are farmers. They grow sugar cane on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to use on their sugar cane farm, so Vanny is asking for a loan of $500 to help her capital.

Vanny will use her loan to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer to maintain her farm. 

In the photo, Mrs. Vanny C. was at home and not at her sugar cane farm.

loans.use: To use for growing sugar cane.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro trabaja de transportista; tiene una movilidad de servicio publico Taxi en la ciudad de La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su hijo y esposa; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona de 1ro de Mayo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su motor para su movilidad y así continuar trabajando.
 
Es el tercer crédito vía KIVA, el buen comportamiento de pago y la buena inversión de coedito anterior le faculta la aprobación de otro  préstamo solicitado por Pedro.
texts.en:
Pedro works providing public transportation services; he drives a taxi in La Paz. It is his main source of income with which he supports his wife and son. He has his own house located in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to pay for his vehicle’s engine maintenance so that he can continue to work. This is his 3rd loan through KIVA. His good repayment history and good investment of the previous loans make Pedro eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For taxi maintenance.

loans.name: The Fiske Five Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel F., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The F. Five. A 28-year-old married father of three children who range in age from three to seven, Emmanuel was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For the past year he has been selling phone cards in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia, and plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. Describing himself as an intelligent person, Emmanuel's dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth V. is from the village of San Vicente, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lilibeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby D. C. is a married woman who lives in Narra Avenue, Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store, Avon and Natasha (beauty products & accessories) dealership and food vending businesses. Her husband Diosdado, who is 48 years old, works as a retailer to earn his living. 

Ruby joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruby has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 90,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Ruby D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: more stock for her general store

loans.name: Joniban

texts.en:
Joniban O. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Joniban is single. Joniban owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Joniban has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2010 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Joniban joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Joniban is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joniban from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing fish to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 63 años es viudo y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Siempre ha estado dedicado a las tareas del campo, sus padres fueron sus principales mentores en esta tarea y toda su vida la consagró a esta labor, es así que día a día se sigue esforzando en todas sus actividades tanto en la siembra, como en la cosecha de maíz, papa, arveja entre otros cultivos más. También se dedica a la crianza de animales, en donde los fines de semana los vende en una feria ganadera cercana a su comunidad. Sus hijos son el principal apoyo en la realización de este trabajo, ya que le ayudan en la cosecha y en la venta de su producción, es así que se siente satisfecho por los logros alcanzados. En lo sucesivo desea continuar adelante con su trabajo. Es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 63 year old widow who lives with his two children in his own home. He has always been a farmer - his parents were his main mentors for this work and he has dedicated his life to this work. Everyday he strives his best in all his farming activities from sowing the seeds to harvesting corn, potatoes, peas, and other crops. He also raises animals and sells them at the weekends at a livestock market close to his community. His children are his main support in all this work as they help him with the harvest and selling his produce, and this makes him feel satisfied with their achievements. For the future, he wants to carry on with his work. This is his 14th loan from MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support and has already shown himself to be responsible about his repayments. Plus, he likes being part of the community bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive. He is grateful to the people who manage the loan and it will be very useful to him in continuing his business. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer for sowing potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 29 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in Bint Jbeil.  He has been working as an electrician since 1998, with 17 years of experience.  Khodor is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to start a new additional business, to increase his income and to improve his social situation.  His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and financial situation.  Khodor wants to start a new business, dealing with waterproof ceiling materials, etc.  Honesty and commitment are his slogans; his clients seek working with him because of his good reputation. In the future, Khodor aims to start a new business dealing with electrical construction and electrical tools.

loans.use: To start a new business selling construction materials

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel N. T., tiene 59 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, vive en la zona de la Maica Sud  una zona periférica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona exclusivamente agrícola. Se encuentra casado, y por la edad que tiene, ya es abuelo, y solo viven con una de sus nietas que tiene 15 años. A quien cuidan y se encargan de hacerla estudiar; su nieta es la única compañera con la que cuentan.

El Sr. Angel y su esposa se dedica a la producción de leche cruda tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero, el con ayuda de su esposa ordeñan la leche todos los días, y ella se encarga de ir a venderla al mercado local y en el barrio casa por casa. Cada día produce unos 35 litros de leche diarios, los que los venden sin ningún problema, por las tardes se dedican al pastoreo y cuidados que requieran su ganado.

El Sr. Angel tiene el deseo de que su ultima nieta y compañera estudie una carrera técnica para que continúe y haga crecer la actividad que tienen, Aunque  ya antes tenía más cabezas de ganado pero, los regalo a sus hijos cuando se casaron, ahora se desea dejarle a su nieta igual.
El Sr. Angel solicito el crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero, para así cumplir con sus metas y brindarle a su nieta las facilidades cuando termine todos sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel N. T. is 59 years old and is involved in the production of milk. He lives in the Maica Sud area close to the city of Cochabamba, an area exclusively agricultural. He is married and with the age that he has he is a grandfather. He lives with his wife and with one of his granddaughters that is 15 years old, they take care of and make her study, she is the only companion that they have.

Mr. Angel and his wife are involved in the production of milk that they get from 3 dairy cows and with his wife’s help they milk them each day. His wife is in charge of selling the milk in the local market and in the neighborhood door to door. Each day they produce some 35 liters of milk, which they sell without a problem, in the evenings, they take the cows out to pasture and take care of whatever the cattle need.

Mr. Angel wants his youngest granddaughter and companion to study a technical degree to keep and continue the work that they do. Although he used to have more head of cattle but he gave them to his children when they got married and now he wants to do the same for his granddaughter.

Mr. Angel wants the loan to buy a dairy cow to meet his goals and to give his grandchild a good start when she finishes all of her studies.

loans.use: Operational capital, to buy semoviente (dairy cows)

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Flora is 23 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 8 and 22. They are all attending school. He has been a farmer for twenty years. He sells maize, beans, tea, millet and milk locally.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow, which will help improve his family's living standards in terms of both food and income. In five years he aspires to start up a large retail shop business and have a posho mill.

The challenge he is facing is that market prices for farm produce are low and there is not enough financing available to purchase farming inputs like fertilizers, which affects his crop production. He is thankful to Juhudi for the loan and hopes to get another.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of three children. Since Ali has a long experience in sales, in 2005 he decided to open his own food market. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation in the region.

He is requesting $1500 loan to expand his inventory and to buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to grow bigger and expand his work so he will be able to change his living conditions for the better.

loans.use: Increase his inventory and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: C2160 Cophecomba Group

texts.en:
Leoncie is the representative of a group called Cophecomba.    Leoncie owns a small shop selling green bananas, which she has had for one year.  She employs one person to help her manage the business.  Her store is open from eight in the morning and remains open until eight in the evening, every day.

Leoncie will use this loan to purchase more green bananas to sell.  She hopes to use any profits that she makes to purchase a fridge and start a new business selling cold soft drinks.

The Cophecomba group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase green bananas to sell

loans.name: Juana Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  vive actualmente en el Barrio 18 de Noviembre de la Ciudad de Santa cruz de la Sierra. La Sra. Juana tiene dos Hijos (1 hombre y 1 mujer) ella es madre y padre para su hijos, hace mucho tiempo se separo de su esposo, fue un golpe para ella pero día a día fue luchando para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, actualmente ella vende sus productos de belleza (pinturas, perfumes, cremas para rostros, cuerpo y Bisutería en general) donde ahora tiene su propia clientela y le va muy bien , el dinero solicitado será para aumentar su capital comprando mas Productos de Belleza y ropas para niños y joven a pedido de su clientela por la época de navidad, ya que tiene mucha demanda, y la Sra. manifestó  "agradezco a la institución por haber confiado en mi persona.
texts.en:
Juana currently lives in '18 de Noviembre' neighborhood, in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  Juana has two children (one boy and one girl).  She is both mother and father to her children as she separated from her husband a long time ago.  It was a blow for her but she worked hard every day to get her children ahead in life.

Juana currently sells beauty products (make-up, perfume, face creams, body creams and costume jewelry).  She has her own customers and things are going very well.  She will use the money she is requesting to increase her capital, buying more beauty products and clothes for children and young people to fill her customers' orders for the Christmas period as there is a lot of demand.  Juana says "I thank the institution for having placed their trust in me".

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for the end-of-year season

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 70 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de productos remojados como moraya,chuño entre otros productos más, la socia vende todos los días en el mercado de Túpac Amaru esto en la Av. La Cultura de Cusco ella vende desde las 09:00amhasta las 05:00pm siendo esta su única actividad que realiza el cual le hace posible aun poder ayudar a sus hijos cuando lo necesitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera vender más productos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Haydee is 70 years old, separated, and has 4 children.  She has a business selling products such as 'moraya' and 'chuño' (both are types of freeze-dried potatoes).  She makes her sales every day of the week in the Túpac Amaru market in Cusco's Avenida La Cultura.  She works from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  This is her only business and it enables her to help her children when they need it.  Haydee is a very happy woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

Haydee is requesting this loan to buy more products for her business so that she can offer her customers more variety and, thereby, sell more products.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business so that she can offer her customers more variety and, thereby, sell more products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and clothing.

He has operated a barber shop business for the past year; his potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  Peter faces a major challenge of competition in his business. He hopes to expand and purchase another hair cutting machine in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase hair cutting machine and a cow. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase hair cutting machine and a cow.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland O. Sr. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 40 years old, widowed and has 6 school-aged children. Roland owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Roland has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Roland joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roland has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Roland is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green bananas to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Roland from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas to sell

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en:
Tsetsegsuren is 45 years old and lives with her son in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Her son attends college. 

Tsetsegsuren began her business as a tailor after graduating from college as a designer in 1990. She worked at a small clothing factory as a tailor.  In 2000, she started selling construction materials at a local market. Now she rents a stall at a trading center and her business has become more stable. 

Tsetsegsuren is a hardworking and polite person who wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more construction materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jean  Nepomuseni

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuseni is 39 years old and married. He has owned a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6am until 10pm for two years. His business is well-organized.

Jean Nepomuseni has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying material for his business. With any profits, Jean Nepomuseni will build his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: Toribio se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Es una persona muy luchadora y se destaca por proporcionar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos,  tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad a su cargo. Todos los días se levanta temprano para empezar su actividad y ofrecerles a sus clientes las mejores frutas y verduras. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bananos, naranjas, melones, sandias, mangos entre otras frutas. Sueña con poder brindarle a su hijo una mejor educación y así pueda obtener un futuro.
texts.en: Toribio sells fruits and vegetables. He is a very hardworking person and stands out by giving his customers very good service. He began working in this field by the need to meet his expenses; he has a 6 year old son that is under his care. Everyday Toribio wakes up early to begin working and to offer his customers the best fruits and vegetables. The loan is to buy bananas, oranges, melons, watermelons, mangos and other fruits. He dreams being able to give his son a better education so that he can have a future.

loans.use: buy bananas, oranges, melons, watermelons, mangos among other fruits.

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Norma is 61 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are now adults. She works every day as a cultivator of her own farm. She plants assorted crops as her main source of income. She has been in this activity for more than 30 years with a monthly net income of 3,600 PHP.

In 2006, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Norma has successfully repaid a loan of PPH 12,000. She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 as her seventh loan, which will be used as start up capital to purchase rice to sell at retail.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She  has a business of selling products to restaurants. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Prosy sells her products in a market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items.  

The main business challenges for Prossy include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business. She lives in a home that she rents where she has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and chicken.

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
María Olga C. L. tiene 30 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos todos menores de edad en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura no tiene terrenos propios por lo que arrienda dos cuadras en las que siembra quinua, habas chocho, papas, además tiene tres cabezas de ganado de vacas lecheras, dos cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y comprar una casa en la ciudad de Riobamba para que los hijos vayan a estudiar en esa ciudad.

Le gusta pasear por el pueblo, las fiestas del carnaval, año viejo, las del 15 de agosto de María Auxiliadora.
texts.en:
María Olga C. L. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and minor children in the Guaranda canton, province of Bolívar. She has 4 children.  

The women's group CARBON CHINIPAMBA community bank is located in the community of Carbón Chinipamba, Cuatro Esquinas area. The Guaranda canton is 20 minutes from the cooperative office. Most of the members work in agriculture, cattle, and trade. They produce rice, barely, beans, quinoa, poatoes as well as animals such as: dairy cows and penned animals.  

María works in agriculture. She does not have her own land, so she rents two lots where she plants quinoa, beans, potatoes, and has three heads of dairy cattle, two pigs and chickens. She makes her purchases in the Guaranda market and sells her product in the wholesale market of the same city.  

She is asking for the loan to buy materials and animal feed. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and weather variation. Her dream is to buy land and to buy a house in the city of Riobamba so that her children can study in that city.  

She likes to go about town, the carnival festivals, New Year's, and the August 15 festivals of María Auxiliadora.

loans.use: to buy materials and animal feed.

loans.name: Yelian 2 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 2 est un groupement constitué de douze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Marie Odile. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1954 au Bénin, Marie Odile est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie Odile ne vit plus avec son mari. Marie Odile vit seule et assure seule ses besoins. Pour y arriver, Marie Odile vend des vivres (haricot, maïs, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Marie Odile achète ses produits au Bénin également. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Marie Odile et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 2 is a group that comprises a dozen people whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is Marie Odile. The group members reside in the same district in Benin. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Born in 1954 in Benin, Marie Odile is the mother of four children, who have all had schooling. She no longer lives with her husband. She lives alone and supports herself. To do so, she sells staple foods (beans, corn, etc.) at a market in Benin. She purchases her goods in Benin, too. 

This initial loan will certainly enable Marie Odile and her group to boost the level of their businesses and to grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy grains (corn, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 28, is a married and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leidy Laura

texts.es: Lady vende verdura, frutas y abarrotes en un punto comercial donde también tiene una miscelánea y comercializa accesorios, papelería  y detalles para toda ocasión, mediante sistemas de contado a sus clientes del barrio y de los alrededores de él y también cuenta con unos pocos clientes a los que les vende a crédito. Este negocio lo inició Lady  ayudando a su mamá en un restaurante que tenía en su casa  y cuando el punto se popularizó,  Lady  adicionó una frutera con pocos productos, a la que fue gradualmente agregando otros; así ha logrado sostenerse con una experiencia de 8 años, ha crecido  y ahora también surte con productos de la canasta familiar a tiendas aledañas a su negocio. Su sueño más adelante es convertirse en un autoservicio y adquirir su vivienda propia y este es justamente su más grande desafío. El credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen, frutas, verdura, abarrotes y variedades que surtirán su miscelánea,  para venderlos y obtener una rentabilidad no menor de un 25%.  Mientras Lady realiza un gran esfuerzo para lograr su sueño se mantiene muy contenta, porque genera ingresos para sostener  a sus dos hijos pequeños, que la inspiran a salir adelante  para propiciarles un futuro potencialmente exitoso.
texts.en:
Lady sells fruit, vegetables and groceries from a sales location where she also has a general store and sells accessories, stationery products and gifts for all occasions.  She sells, for cash, to neighborhood customers and also people from surrounding areas.  She also has a few customers to whom she sells on credit.

Lady started this business by helping her mom in a restaurant that she had in her home.  When the location became popular, Lady added a fruit stall with just a few products.  She gradually added more and more products.  She now has eight years experience in her business which has grown.  She now also supplies neighboring stores with basic household products.  Her dream for the future is to turn her business into a supermarket and acquire her own home.  This is her biggest challenge.

This Kiva loan is Lady's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy a larger volume of fruit, vegetables, groceries and other products that she will use to stock her general store.  She will sell these products and obtain a profitability of no less than 25%.  While Lady makes a big effort to achieve her dream, she remains very happy because she is making income with which she is able to support her two young children who inspire her to get ahead so that she can provide them with a potentially successful future.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of fruit, vegetables, groceries and other products

loans.name: Pazilet

texts.en:
Pazilet is 50, widowed, and has one daughter. She works as a nurse at the local hospital. In order to support her family, three years ago she began a cattle breeding business. Currently, she has three milk cows at her farm. She sells milk to local customers and makes a monthly profit of 5,000 soms (KGS). 

Pazilet plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase two cows. With the revenue, she plans to pay for a good education for her daughter. In the future, Pazilet plans to broaden her business activities. 

======================================

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Teddy lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.
Teddy has a bakery business. She has run this business for ten years, and she works six days a week. Teddy sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cartons of baking flour and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Teddy include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a delivery van to ease transportation problems and also to see her business grow into a big bakery.

loans.use: to buy cartons of baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Benilda Margarita

texts.es: Benilda tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es la propietaria de “Sala de Belleza Bernarda”, negocio que inició para generar ingresos propios, una vez terminó los estudios técnicos de belleza; hoy se siente orgullosa de estar desempeñándose en su carrera, porque desarrolla su gran potencial y además porque ayuda a perfeccionar la imagen personal y profesional de sus clientes, levantando su estima. Su mercado está compuesto principalmente por mujeres y jóvenes, también trabaja con el género masculino e infantil, en su negocio hace cortes de cabello, peinados, desrizado, alicer, blower, maquillaje y todo lo que requiere su público para sentirse bello.
