Su desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para vender mercancías, producto de lo que necesita su clientela una vez ella los asesora. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cremas, tintes, lacas, masajes, maquillaje en mayores volúmenes que los que usualmente compra, para ganar descuentos especiales y continuar ofreciendo en su sala de belleza, la asesoría como su principal valor agregado. Su meta más adelante es tener una infraestructura con tecnología que impacte el mercado y haga sus procesos más efectivos en un ambiente verdaderamente desestresado para ella y su clientela.
texts.en:
Belinda, 22, lives in the city of Cartagena and owns “Sala de Belleza Bernarda” (Bernarda Beauty Salon), a business she started to earn her own income when she finished her technical beauty courses.  Today, she feels proud to be working in her chosen field because she’s actualizing a great potential and because she helps her customers improve their personal and professional images thereby boosting their self-esteem.

Her market is primarily women and young adults; she works with men and children too.  She does haircuts, hair styling, hair straightening, curl relaxing, blow drying, makeup and everything her customers need to feel beautiful.  Her challenge is not having enough working capital to sell merchandise-those products she advises her customers about that they need.  

This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy creams, hair color, nail polish, massage products and makeup in larger volume than she currently purchases to be eligible for special discounts and to be able to continue to offer beauty consultancy as the main added value to her beauty salon.  Her goal for later on is to have an infrastructure with technology that impacts the marketplace and that makes her processes more effective in a truly stress-free environment for her and her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has one child.

Saif has owned a shop since 2006, doing photocopying and selling stationery and mobile phones. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.


He is requesting a $2500 loan in order to buy a laser photocopier and to add more inventory to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a laser photocopier and to add more inventory to his shop.

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the chairman of the Community Bank “Bien Fait Plus”, which is composed of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Patrick sells phone accessories in his area located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2005. His beginning capital was $100. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Patrick is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received five loans from MFI HOPE DRC  and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well located business place. He makes $100 profit each week. 

Patrick intends with the next loan to purchase more phone accessories to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phone shop in his area. He is 33 years old and married. He also takes care of a younger brother and a niece.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rona runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Rona has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Rona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ” iniciará su noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Marisol. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cocinas, venta de chicharrones, costuras, plásticos en general, venta de chompas, costura de chamarras.
 
La señora Marisol,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de sus familiares. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de buzos deportivos que viene trabajando hace tres años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de tela, hilos, etc.) que adquirirá de la feria y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en su comercio. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las compañeras y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Zapatito Veloz” (Swift Little Shoe) community bank is about to start its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Marisol.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling stoves, selling 'chicharrones' (fried pork rinds), sewing, selling plastic products, selling sweaters and sewing jackets.

Marisol tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined through an invitation from some of her family members.  She currently has a business sewing track suits and has been in this business for three years.

Marisol will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying fabric, threads, etc.).  She will buy her supplies in the market and then, when she has made her outfits, she will sell them in her store.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family in so far as she can.  She is married and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marisol replied that she enjoys sharing with her fellow bank members and also the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 61-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol where she tills a land with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Erlinda does her best to support her family. She requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Erlinda hopes to have a stable income. She also desires to help send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old. She is married with one child.

Lolita has a mini pharmacy that sells medicines and other food supplements like vitamins. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to develop the pharmacy and buy additional stocks of medicines and other food supplements to sell.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To develop and purchase addtional medicines to sell

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 36 years old with three children aged 6 to 12 years. All of them are currently in school. She is married to a technician. Emerthe sells cooking oil, rice, flour, and other goods in a store she has been running for five years. She would like a loan to expand her inventory and add a more diverse selection to her store. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to become a self-sustaining businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. Regina has a shop that sells breads and snacks & serves milk and coffee. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy snacks & coffee for the shop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & coffee for the shop.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en: Alaa' is a 27-year-old young woman. She has a grocery store which is her only source of income. Alaa' wants to get a better collection of groceries. She needs to increase her income, so she needs to purchase more groceries to resell. Alaa' does not have enough money to pay for these additional groceries, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When she gets the loan she will be able to purchase more groceries. This will enable her to have a better collection, sell more, and increase her income to provide better living conditions for herself. Alaa' is a conservative woman, so her brother Ismael is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is 44 years old, residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 18 ans et 23 ans, il commence avec la papeterie en 1986, il achète des cartons de cahiers de différents qualités, des rames de papiers, des stylos, crayons et des livres.
Il a toujours fait ses remboursements a temps, et très régulier dans les épargnes, il a un puissant capital.
Pour le nouveau prêt, il va acheter dix cartons de rames de papiers, 10 cartons de cahiers, des cartons de stylos de différents couleurs, des crayons de couleurs et tous les  fournitures utiles, les registres pour les bureaux et les enfants qui sont sur les bancs d’écoles.
Pour sa famille, il est entrain de se battre pour construire sa maison et s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et il est entrain de penser a élargir son étalage.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old.  He is a married father of 4 children who range in age from 18 to 23, he started a stationary store in 1986. He purchases boxes of notebooks of varied quality, reams of paper, pens, pencils, and books.
He has always reimbursed his loans on time and regularly puts money into savings and has a large working capital.
With this new loan, he will purchase ten boxes of reams of paper, 10 boxes of notebooks, boxes of pens of different colors, colored pencils, and all necessary supplies, business and school registers.
For his family, he is trying hard to build a house and provide for the education of his children.  He is thinking about expanding his stall.

loans.use: to purchase reams of paper, boxes of pens, pencils, registers, and notebooks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 23 years old and a business lady.  She is married to Stephen. They do not currently have children.  She has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which she uses to support her family.

Susan is applying for her first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to stock up on textile materials. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will support her parents. Her hope is to open her own boutique shop.

loans.use: To stock up on textile materials.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe es una es persona trabajadora que su objetivo en la vida es de mejorar su vivienda donde habita con su familia, con mucho esfuerzo la ha acondicionado poco a poco para darles a sus hijos una vivienda digna, que por falta de capital no ha terminado las mejoras que el necesidad realizarle a la vivienda. Felipe está solicitando crédito para poder realizar las mejoras de su vivienda para la compra de zinc, pilares entre otros equipos para la construcción.
texts.en: Felipe is a hardworking person whose life goal is to improve the house he lives in with his family.  With much effort he’s gradually been furnishing it so that his children can have a dignified home.  For lack of capital, however, he’s been unable to finish the improvements he needs to make on the dwelling.  Felipe is asking for a loan to carry out the home improvements.  He will buy metal sheeting, pillars and other building materials and supplies.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gneleniton I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe GNELENITON I sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 54 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GOUNDO, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "GNELENITON 1" are married women averaging 54 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in Commune de Guegneka, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. The group members are on their seventh collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, GOUNDO, who is the second person seated from the left in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of about 125,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Tchenawa Group

texts.fr: TCHENAWA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Assiba Delphine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 57 ans. Assiba Delphine a très peu fréquenté l'écoel. Assiba Delphine est mariée à un certain Cyprien. le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assiba Delphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Assiba Delphine vend des céréales dans sa région ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Assiba Delphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Assiba Delphine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe TCHENAWA, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des céréales.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Mai 2009, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (en médaillon avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons et 05 filles et âgée de 53ans. Son activité consiste à acheter différents  produits alimentaires et des chaussures pour le revendre en détails.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter de l’huile de palme d’un montant de 30000f et payer un transport de 2500f pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser assurer la dépense quotidienne de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 22nd of May 2009 at the inauguration of the banc villageois. This group is made up of women who have experience in the banc villageois programme. They all come from the same village and they share strong ties of solidarity and mutual aid. They all work in small businesses.

Mrs. Aissatou (who is in the inset with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is aged 53, and married with two boys and five girls. Her business consists of buying different food products and shoes for resale as retail.

With her new loan, she plans to buy 30000f worth of palm oil and to pay 2500f of transport to sell it retail from her home.

She plans to use the profits to cover daily expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy 30000f worth of palm oil and to pay 2500f of transport to sell it retail from her home.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en: Zoila has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Zoila has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Zoila has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Zoila hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Miss Maria del Rosario lives with her husband and four children in the community of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. Her husband is a labourer and he earns very little, for which is not enough to cover all of their expenses. Three years ago she, through a friend, learned that she would be able to earn an extra income through the sale of cosmetics through catalogue. Thanks to this business she and her family has been able to come through and without this business they would not have been able to afford their childrens’ education. Miss Maria del Rosario requires a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to keep up the business and pay for a large shipment and, in this manner, have the merchandise available for her clients.

You can help her and her family. Become part of their efforts. Miss Maria del Rosario has worked hard with the love she has for her family. The decision is in your hands, your generosity would be a great help for them. Make your decision, they will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María del Rosario vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en la comunidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Su marido es obrero y gana muy poco, por lo que no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos. Hace 3 años ella, por medio de una amiga, se enteró que podía ganar algunos ingresos extras por medio de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado, junto con el apoyo de su familia, salir adelante, ya que sin esto no podrían costear los estudios de sus hijos. Doña María del Rosario requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder continuar y pagar un pedido grande y de ésta forma tener mercancía en existencia para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Tú puedes apoyarla a ella y su familia y ser parte importante de sus logros. Doña María del Rosario ha luchado mucho por el amor que le tiene a su familia. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda para ellos, decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer sinceramente

loans.use: purchase merchanise

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is 35. Dieu’s husband, Em, is 37. They have two children, ages 12 and 7. The children are students.

They have 3,000 square meters of land where they grow rice. Because of the alkalinity of the soil, their rice production is low. Em has learned how to raise several species of fish. Their income, which comes from both growing rice and aquaculture, is $10 per person/month. Now, they need to receive a loan of $75 for buying young fish and fish food so that they are able to continue and expand the aquaculture business. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Continue and expand their aquaculture business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan D. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  D. runs a small grocery store in her village and can make about $13 per day in revenue.  Her husband is a police officer and makes about $2 per day.  The couple has one child who is still in school.  D. hopes to use this loan to expand her grocery business by purchasing more grocery products to sell.  In the future, she hopes that she will be able to further expand her business and perhaps open a stall at the local market.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to build a larger house for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her business

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married and has an 8-year-old son. He has always been interested in machinery and technologies. That is why he decided to start his own small repair business. Andrei owns a maintenance shop providing car repair services in the town of Ugriniv, Ivano-Frankivsk region.

Andrei has been in this business for five years. Flexibility, customer friendly service and deferred payment options are some of the reasons his business has been so popular in the community. “Nadiya Ukraine” lending services have promoted the growth and profitability of his venture. Andrei has received and promptly repaid three loans with no defaults. Currently, he makes about $2,000 of monthly net profit.

Andrei is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy 600 liters of motor oil for his maintenance operation. He is hoping that offering different types of refined oils, as well as a full range of other petroleum products, will increase his sales and allow him to provide better service for his customers and enhance their vehicles' performance. We believe Andrei’s focused approach to business and his diligent hard-work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: Purchase oil for repair shop

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod and his wife (see picture) rent a point of sale on the central market. They sell fresh fruit and vegetables. Farhod purchases the produce, while his wife sells them. Farhod also does small jobs for private entities in order to bring home some extra income. The profit from the business and the small jobs make up the family budget. Farhod is 36 and he has three children. Farhod has been a client of MicroInvest for the past year and a half and is planing to continue borrowing funds in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Фарход и его жена (она на фото)арендуют торговое место на центральном рынке. Она продают свежие фрукты и овощи. Фарход ездит за товаром а его жена продает их. Кроме этого Фарход подрабатывает на разных работах у частных лиц. Все эти доходы составляют его семейный доход. Фарходу 36 лет, у него 3 детей. Фарход сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже 1,5 года и планирует и дальше получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса..

loans.use: For further expansions

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alim has an internet computer cafe in the center of Saatli city. The business is quite interesting but demands investment from time to time, otherwise Alim would  risk losing his customers. This summer Alim applied for a loan of US$ 500 from Normicro's Saatli branch to renovate his internet cafe. If he is able to do this, Alim will have higher income to support his parents.

loans.use: To buy a new computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a single mother with a grown son. She lives in Zaporozhye and owns a vending business at the Angolenka market. Tatyana sells bedding, children’s clothing, and household items. She has been in this trade for 11 years. Presently, she has about $900 in turnover capital.

Tatyana has an entrepreneurial mind that is always lively, active, constantly calculating, and always on the lookout for the next big opportunity. Her business is profitable and stable, however, she would like to press on and expand it even more. Today, Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her stock and meet the growing demand from this Christmas season.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Mardon

texts.ru:
Mardon Ordinaev is 69 years old, married and has 9 children. He has a High school education. Mardon works at the dehkansk farming business and has a small piece of land of his own. He plans to use a portion of the obtained credit to purchase fertilizer, wheat seeds, fuel and machine oil. He plans to use the other portion of the loan to purchase cattle to raise and resell. He is also in the business of making milk-products that he sells to the inhabitants of the city of Javana. Mardon plans to repay the loan over a period of 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Одинаев Мардон– 69 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 9-х детей. Мардон работает работает в дехканско-фермерском хозяйстве и миеет небольшой участок собственной земли. Часть полученного кредита он хочет использовать на приобретение удобрений, семян пшеницы, горюче-смазочоных материалов, на другую часть он хочет приобрести крупный – рогатый скот для откорма и продажи. Также он занимается производством кисло-молочных продуктов и реализует его местным жителям и жителям города Явана. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 11 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, wheat seeds and cattle

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Over 18 years ago Mariela started her family with Darío. In the beginning things were very difficult for them, with family problems and many failures in each of the businesses that they entered. As a product of these losses, her husband became involved with alcohol, and during those difficult years Mariela was the only support of her family. She never lost hope and with the important support of her children decided to enter into the noble work of weaving clothing textiles. Initially she only was dedicated to manual weaving, but by saving they implemented their factory piece by piece. Currently they feel very proud and content for the results they have obtained, because finally life smiles on them and gives them the opportunity to progress. Mariela and her husband Darío have hopes to give a good education to her exemplary and loved children and in order to solidify their desires they plan to increase the volume of production. With this goal, they appeal to your great heart and ask for a loan. Your kind collaboration will permit this family’s dreams to become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Hace más de 18 años la señora Mariela formó su familia junto a Darío, en principio las cosas para ambos fueron muy difíciles, tuvieron problemas familiares y muchos fracasos en cada uno de los negocios en los que incursionaban, producto de éstas pérdidas decepcionado su esposo se dejaba envolver por las bebidas alcohólicas, durante esos difíciles años y por ese entonces Mariela era el único sostén de su familia. Ella nunca perdió las esperanzas y con el importante apoyo de sus hijos decidió entregarse al noble trabajo del tejido de prendas de vestir, inicialmente solo se dedicaban a tejer manualmente, pero conforme iban ahorrando fueron implementando poco a poco su taller, actualmente se sienten muy orgullosos y contentos por los resultados que van obteniendo, porque finalmente la vida les sonríe y les esta brindando la oportunidad de progresar.Mariela y su esposo Darío tienen la esperanza de brindarles estudios superiores a sus ejemplares y queridos hijos y para concretar sus deseos tienen pensado aumentar el volumen de su producción, con ese fin recurren a tu buen corazón y hacen la solicitud de un préstamo. Vuestra gentil colaboración permitirá hacer realidad los sueños de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is married with 2 children and is 26 years old. She is a hair stylist by profession. She spent 2 years learning the job and has been in it for 9 years. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy hair weaves and other hair accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and other hair accessories for sale

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Saida M. lives in Rudaki district, in the village of Gizhdaloobod. She works as a teacher in a secondary school. Saida has a large and happy family- five children and two grandchildren. She has experience raising animals, and she would like to buy a few sheep. This will help her family get some additional income. Besides this, she is a very active woman and has a lot of free time. To achieve her goal, Saida is applying for a loan of 450 US dollars. She can repay her loan within nine months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Махминова Саида проживает в районе Рудаки в поселке Гиждалообод. Работает учителем в средней школе. Имеет большую и дружную семью. У нее 5 детей и 2 внуков. Имеет опыт работы в животноводстве. Поэтому хочет закупить нескольких овец. Это поможет ее семье получать дополнительный доход. Кроме того она очень активная женщина и у нее много свободного времени.Для достижения этой цели Саида хочет получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США, а погасить кредит она сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a very persevering woman, and she has never been put off by difficult circumstances. A few years ago she owned a food store, but because of her delicate health she had to sell all her products. Now she is better she wants to start all over again, and she will work hard so that her dream becomes a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria, es una persona muy perseverante y nunca se ha dejado derrotar por las circunstancias difíciles. Hace un par de años poseía una tienda de comestibles y debido a su delicado estado de salud tuvo que vender todo lo que tenía en ella, ahora ya recuperada de su dolencia desea iniciar una vez más su actividad y esforzarse para hacer este sueño realidad.

loans.use: An injection of capital to reopen her shop/Inyección de capital para reabrir su tienda.

loans.name: Leydi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Two years ago, Leydi started a business selling food. It belonged to her mother in the beginning, but due to health issues, she had to leave the business. Taking advantage of her mother´s clients and with much effort, she has been able to increase production. Leydi´s business is important to her because with the income it produces she can give a better standard of living to her two little ones, who are 4 and 2 years old, and add to her husband´s income.

She needs a loan for US $400, which will be repaid in 6 months, to improve the appearance of her business and she is asking for help so she can remodel and paint it. With your help, Leydi will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Leydi inicio hace 2 años con el negocio de venta de comida, inicialmente este era de de su mama quien por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar el negocio, entonces ella aprovecho la clientela de su mama y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado elevar su productividad. Para Leydi es importanete su negocio ya que con los ingresos que este genera puede ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeños de 4 y 2 años, y complementar los ingresos de su marido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar la imagen de du negocio, pide apoyo para remodelarlo y pintarlo. Con tu ayuda Leydi hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel her business.

loans.name: Tagoimurod.

texts.ru:
Tagoimurod D. lives in the area of Shahrinav. He is married and has 5 children. He has a higher education and works as a assistant manager in a private organization. In parallel he is also engaged in the trade of food and goods. He has been engaged in this type of business for 16 years. His shop is located next to his home. He wants to receive a loan so that he could increase his commodity circulation, he plans to pay back the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Тагоймурод проживает в районе Шахринау. Женат и имеет пятерых детей.Имеет высшее образование . Работает экономичтом в частной организации. Параллельно он занимается торговлей продуктов питания и хоз товарами.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 16 лет. Торговая точка находится рядом с домом. Хочет получить кредит для того . чтобы увеличить товарооборот сроком на 15 месяцев

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 1. She has been selling tomatoes since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US550 from her sales.

Magdalena now hopes for a loan to buy more tomato inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Teng Sokcheng Group

texts.en:
This group that desires to get a loan is located in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and consists of four people. They plan to use the loan for many different purposes. Mrs. TE. S. is the group leader and this will be her third loan. She is a farmer and poultry breeder in the local village. Her breeding poultry business raises a lot of chickens. Since this business is succeeding, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more chickens for breeding. Mrs. TE. S. is a 51-year-old widow, her child is a bed maker who earns to little income to support himself and his family. Mrs. TE. S. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. 

All the members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luís es un hombre muy trabajador, que con mucho esmero sale todas las mañanas rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo, junto a ello, cuida de sus vaquitas, las lleva todas las mañanas a alimentarse. Es así que demuestra mucha dedicación hacia sus vacas, ya que de una u otra manera le ayudan a solventar los gastos dentro de su hogar, porque desde muy temprano su esposa las ordeña y vende su leche por lugares cercanos.Más ahora Luís desea invertir en sus tierras, para producir mayor cantidad y trasladar sus productos a los mercados cercanos de la zona, con el fin de seguir creciendo económicamente. También, quiere comprar otra vaquita, para que su esposa pueda elaborar quesos y llevarlos a las ciudades para su venta, para eso requiere del préstamo que solicita, el cual le ayudará a comprar semillas y abonos, indispensables para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luís is a hard-working man who goes to cultivate his fields every morning with great care. Along with that, he tends to his calves, taking them to feed in the mornings. His work demonstrates his dedication to his cows, since one way or another they help solve his household expenses. Early in the morning his wife milks them and sells it at nearby places. Most recently, Luís wants to invest in his lands to yield larger quantities to transport to the area markets, helping his business to continue growing economically. He also wants to purchase another calf so that his wife can make cheeses and take them to the cities to sell. He is requesting a loan for these purposes, helping him purchase seeds and fertilizer, essential products for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer as well as another calf

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra H., who is 37 years old, lives in the village of Rosey Srouk in Takeo province. Importantly, she is the mother of three children, all of whom attend the local school. For a living, she bakes cakes and then sells the cakes for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Chey Kakada, pictured on the left of the photo, is a farmer. More specifically, he owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice in order to earn a living.

Unfortunately, Mrs. Ra H. and her husband do not generate sufficient income to support their growing family. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. In turn, she hopes to increase her income and to thereby improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Nuevo Amanecer” esta representado por la señora Catalina. En general los socios se dedican a la venta D. comidas, cajonería, abarrotes a la elaboración y comercialización D. pan casero y los socios al transporte público. Alguno D. los socios ya trabajo con grupos solidaR. pero en su mayoría es la primera vez que trabajan bajo esta modalidad, pero saben la responsabilidad y el compromiso que se requiere para un financiamiento. Todos saben que la competencia en el mercado es fuerte en especial en el comercio D. productos D. primera necesidad pero ellos tienen experiencia en su rubro ya el es el sustento D. su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. material e insumos para la venta en especial para la época naviD.ña así como para las mejoras D. sus herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Morning) is represented by Mrs. Catalina. In general, the members sell food and snacks, make furniture, bake and sell homemaD. bread, and work in public transportation. One of the group members has already worked with other groups, but for the majority of them, this is their first time working within the group-lending model. Still, they understand the responsibility and commitment required to get a loan. They all know that market-competition is strong, especially in the sale of staple goods, but they all have experience in this area, having already provided for their families with this kind of work. The loan will be used for the purchase of goods to sell, especially during the Christmas season, as well as improving their work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is a 35-year-old man. He is married and has five children. The first born, a son, is independent, while two are in the college currently. The last two are also in junior high school. Margaret works to support her husband financially. She is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from cold stores in the nearby cities and smokes them. She distributes to food vendors in her community and also sells in the market square. She says she has been in business for twelve years. Margaret wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk so that she can distribute to more customers. Margaret belongs to a Trust Bank group called “Kingdom.” The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Kuldosh

texts.en:
Kuldosh is 58 years old but in spite of his years he still works in the fields. He and his three sons grow potatoes on land that he rents. They work from early in the morning to late at night. Kuldosh would like to have a rich harvest this season so that his son can get married. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan to buy more potato seeds.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Originaire du TOGO, dame G. vit le jour à Cotonou, la capitale économique du BENIN le 23 Août 1980. Elle y est restée pour grandir, se marier et pour mener son activité génératrice de revenu. Mère de 2 garçons tous scolarisés, elle veille scrupuleusement pour leur bonne éducation. Ces enfants sont tous à la charge de leurs parents. Les activités menées par cette bénéficiaire sont multiples. Il s'agit de la vente des chaussures, de la fabrication et la vente des oreillets. Elle sollicite un crédit pouvant lui permettre de faire un approvisionnement important. Dame G. désire faire un achat de 3 cartons de chaussures et du materiels pour la fabrication des oreillets. Cette bénéficiaire, qui a toujours un respect scrupuleux de l'échéancier de remboursement est à son 5ième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
With roots in TOGO, Ms. G. was born on August 23, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN. There, she stayed to grow up, get married, and earn an income. She is the mother of two boys, both in school, and she oversees their education scrupulously. Both these children are supported by their parents.

This loan recipient’s business activities are many. They involve selling shoes and making and selling pillows. She is requesting a loan that will enable her to acquire important supplies. She would like to buy three boxes of shoes and the materials to make pillows. This loan recipient, who always has a scrupulous respect for making payments on time, is on her fifth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three boxes (36-count each) of shoes and some material for making pillows

loans.name: Kabwe Group

texts.en:
Chelina has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 7 years. She belongs to Maisha bora group loan (Group code 2101).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.  

She is requesting her firtst loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.  

Chelina is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 20, 17, 16, 14  and 12. She also cares for five additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Magreth, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mahmadusuf

texts.ru: Холов Махмадюсуф житель города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Нигде не работает , но занимается сельским хозяйством.Имеет участок земли , который засеивает разного рода сельхоз культурами. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы оплатить аренду земли , а также закупить салярку. Погасить кредит  планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadusuf H. lives in Vahdat. He is 28 years old, is married and has two children. He does not have a job, but he has an agriculture business. Mahmadusuf has a plot of land where he plants different types of crops. He plans to take out a loan in order to pay for leasing land and also in order to purchase vehicle oil. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent land and purchase vehicle oil

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Болтаев Абдусамад проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 34 года, женат и имеет троих детей.Образование среднее. Занимается купле-продажей крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим бизнесом пять лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы  сделать пристройку к сараю. Это необходимо для того, чтобы улучшить условия по уходу за бычками.
texts.en:
Abdusamad B. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary education. He is involved in sales of cattle and has been in this business for five years. Abdusamad plans to obtain this loan in order to build an addition to his barn. This is necessary to improve care conditions for the bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for barn addition

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is 38 years old and has two children. She is married to A. who is a taxi driver. Lawal sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says that the profits from this business will be added to the family savings to enhance the children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is seeking financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 6,000 for the maintenance of her hog-raising business. Thelma is hoping that her business will grow fast to further support their needs and that they may continue to send all her children to school.

Thelma is 50 years old and living in the village of Catayauan Lallo, Cagayan. She is married to Renato Taraday, a farmer in their village. She has five children namely: Angelie, 28 years old, a college graduate; Janiel, 24 years old, also a college graduate; Jenifer, 22 years old, and a high school graduate; Jinky, 19, who is still in third year college; and Renato Taraday Jr. who is 10 years old and in grade school. 

Thelma believes that, through perseverance, she will be able to manage her hog-raising business well. The business is of great help in fulfilling her family ambitions in life. She prays to God that her requested loan will be granted. It is intended to be used for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To be uses for business maintenance

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es pequeña agricultora de hortalizas y productora de leche de vaca mismo que lo comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 13 años de edad mismos que también colaboran con el trabajo en el campo, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que se mantiene su familia. 

Vive en la comunidad Palomar (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz). 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad y incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Amalia is a micro-entrepreneur who grows vegetables that she then sells, along with her cow’s milk, in the city of La Paz. She lives in her own home with her three children, ages 18, 15 and 13. They collaborate with her in her farming activities, the primary source of income to support the family. She lives in the community of Palomar (2 ½ hours from the city of La Paz). The loan will be destined to buying a cow to increase milk production. This is her second loan with Impro, and her good standing with regard to her previous loan qualifies her for additional credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie R. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Vergie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vergie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
To make ends meet, Daniel works a day job in a packaging factory and nights and weekends running his business, Puerta Cleaning Services. He specializes in carpet cleaning and odor control as well as standard house cleaning, but his portable carpet-cleaning machine isn’t powerful enough. In order to keep clients from going elsewhere, Daniel put a deposit down on a used truck-mounted cleaner that would enable him to serve more clients more efficiently. The new cleaner will help him expand his business, hire an employee, and make him less vulnerable to job loss if the factory where he works closes.

A $7,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will help Daniel purchase the truck-mounted cleaner. It will also allow him to invest in advertising and marketing to build his client base, including putting a decal on his cleaning van.

loans.use: To buy a truck-mounted carpet cleaner

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: “Praying without ceasing” is the principle in life shared by Dominga B., a simple entrepreneur who is seeking financial assistance for her businesses. At her age of 43, Dominga still is energetic and determined to become successful in her chosen business. She manages a furniture making business in their simple village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. She also operates a little eatery business in the village and raises pigs. She is married to Jose B., a farmer and her partner in managing her business well. They are gifted with three children namely: Gemma, Jeremy, and Emerald. Gemma is a college student taking up computer programming. Jeremy is still in high school and Emerald is an elementary pupil. She is living with her family, happy and helping each other to maintain the good bonding they currently have. Her dream is to expand their business further, thus requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP32,000 for additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica started her beef sales eight years ago and sells in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality beef and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 38 years old and married with two girls who are currently in school.

Monica takes delivery of beef from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of beef to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of beef

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
"Eseta I. (0) is a 37 years-year-old woman living in the town of Lotofaga Alasopo.  She is married and has 1 child school-aged children.  To make a living, Eseta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Eseta has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 440 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Eseta is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Eseta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em S., 52, is married and lives with four of her children in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and also sells grocery items, typically making about US$2 each day. Her husband (pictured) has a business charging batteries from home. This business allows him to make US$8 in revenue every day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Em S. included.

In light of these economic difficulties, Em S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a truck so that her family can transport goods from market to sell and also batteries. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: Lung

texts.en: Lung M. and her family members appear in the photo provided. Lung M., 29, has two young children who are still to young to be enrolled in school. To earn a living, Lung M. retails in the sale of chickens that she buys in bulk from middlemen/poultry famers. She typically generates an income of $5 a day to feed her family. She also relies on the income from her husband's job. He drives a motor taxi. In order to raise more money to support her family’s standard of living, Lung M. has requested a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy piglets to raise in a stall that she has built next to her house.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise in a stall that she built.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
T. and his wife operate a wooden furniture business in their town. They make many different styles of furniture, including ger furniture. Ger furniture is much smaller than other types and is traditionally painted using classic Mongolian designs and colors. They began their business in 2000, and T. supplements their income by also selling prepared lumber. He and his wife work very hard to improve their family’s quality of life. T. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~$350 US) loan in order to purchase more wood for their growing business.

T. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two adult children in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: S. is a 45-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with seven kids, four of whom are attending the public high school and are dependent on her income. The others are employed. Her husband, Sin Somoeun, is 46 years of age, and works in construction. In the past, S. and her family always hired a taxi for traveling anywhere because they don't have a vehicle.  Because of that, S. is looking for a loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a used motorcycle for her and her family's touring needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Hudjamurodov

texts.ru: Худжамуродаов Хасан проживает в районе Щахритуз. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Сын работает на стройке. Жена помогает мужу. Сам Хасан более 4 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
H. Hudjamurodov lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 54 years old, he is married and has five children. His son works in construction. His wife helps her husband. H. has been doing animal husbandry for more than four years. He feeds and sells large cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nde

texts.en:
E. is married with five children. She and her family live in Ntassen, Cameroon, in a house with seven rooms.

E. has had to overcome some challenges in life, such as ill health, difficulty paying her children's school fees, the death of her father, and persistent increases in the price of basic commodities. She farms and sells firewood in order to earn a living.

This will be E.'s eighth time receiving a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2000 and has been quite successful in the past, due to her business's location and reasonable prices. With her experience, she now has good yield from her pig farming and firewood businesses.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, and give them good medication when they are sick. Part will be ploughed back into her provision store.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying of rice, savon, oil, groundnuts

loans.name: Iponi

texts.en:
Iponi V. is currently in the business of selling air time on all mobile networks in south sudan and is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones and more air time to sell.  Iponi is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a police man. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase mobile phones and more air time to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 47 years old. She is married and has nine children, the youngest of whom is 6 years old. She is a very hard-working woman. She wakes up daily at 4:30 a.m. to start preparing "fufu" (cassava dumplings) to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. Fufu is made from fermented cassava and it can be eaten with Nigerian soups like egusi (melon soup), vegetable soup, etc. 

Margaret is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to make more fufu to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to make fufu

loans.name: Murodbeg

texts.en:
N. Murodbeg is 36 years-old. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last 10 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a second loan after successfully repaying a first one. With the previous loan, Murodbeg was able to increase the number of heads that he trades. Murodbeg is married and the father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trading and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He hopes to see his children complete higher education and to get good jobs unlike himself.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Group, Kampala

texts.en:
K. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a hard-working woman with several businesses. 

She has a hardware shop, she makes pancakes and she also makes banana juice for sale in Kampala central. She decided to work in all these businesses because she has always wanted to provide the best for herself and her family. She is surely doing that. 

She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using the proceeds from her growing businesses. Margaret needs a loan to help boost all her businesses and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials and bananas for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Jovelita

texts.en:
Jovelita C. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Jovelita is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. Jovelita is a fish vendor; she sells a variety of fish to the local community. Jovelita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jovelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jovelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariela Janette

texts.es:
ESTA CLIENTA ES UNA GANADERA DE LA ZONA DE POTOSI ES UNA MUJER CASADA Y MADRE DE 2 HIJOS Y EN LA CATUALIDAD SE ENCUENTRA EMBARAZADA 
POR SU LEJANIA DE LA AREA HURBANA NO POSEE LOS SERVICIOS DE ENERGIA ELECTRICA POR LO QUE EL CREDTIO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE UN PANEL SOLAR PARA MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA
texts.en:
This client raises livestock in the zone of Potosi. She is marriedand has two children, with a third on the way. Since she lives so far away from urban areas she does not have electricity. She is requesting a loan to purchase a solar panel to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of solar equipment

loans.name: Nann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nann R. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. With her farming, she does not earn enough income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and piglets for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Nann R. is a 47-year-old widow with five children:  one is a seamstress in the garment factory and one is a constructiO. worker, while the other three are attending the local school. 

Mrs. Nann R. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members, consisting of 16 people from Sophi village in Takeo province. The members of the loan will use it for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy a cow and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic plates and bowls

loans.name: Lyka Mae's Group

texts.en: Lyka Mae D.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as candies, diapers, sugar, coffee, cotton, baby oil, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 21 years old, single and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Lyka Mae has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Lyka Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lyka Mae is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. Lyka Mae is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Tulips 4". About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marbel Petrona

texts.es: La joven Marbel de 22 años de edad, es muy emprendedora, y trabajadora, desde hace cuatro años  comenzó a trabajar como domestica, y con sus ahorro logro afiliarse con la Avon para vender cosméticos y poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que son bajos, casada, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y han logrado hacer una pequeña división propia en la casa de su mama. Su anhelo es lograr llegar a comprar su propio terreno. Con este financiamiento lograra levantar las paredes para construir el baño y lograr una mejor higiene y privacidad en el hogar. A futuro quiere invertir más en cosmético, ropa, zapatos y solo dedicarse al comercio por completo.
texts.en:
Young Marbel, 22, is hard-working and entrepreneurial. She started working as a cleaner four years ago and has now saved enough to start a business selling Avon products. She'll buy and sell Avon cosmetics, a business that will allow her to increase the small income she collects now. Marbel is married and her husband works as a security guard. They've managed to set up a space of their own in the house of Marbel's mother. Marbel would ultimately like to have her own place. With this loan, though, she will build the walls for a bathroom, a project that will give the couple more privacy in the house. In the future, Marbel would like to buy more cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc. and commit herself to her business full time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for bathroom project.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, Trabajando para el Futuro (Working Toward the Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Luz’s group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their four children.

Luz is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small neighborhood general supply store that she runs out of her home, by purchasing necessary products for sale such as clothes, beans, sweets (candies) and other comestible items as well as a blender.

Luz will use the profits to improve the life of her family: buy better food and clothes, fix a window and buy school supplies. Hoping her children will grow up to be good people, she dreams of a computer for them and a better education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy beans, sweets, clothes and a blender for her small neighborhood variety store

loans.name: Macarlina

texts.en:
Macarlina G. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Macarlina is married and has four school-age children. 

To make a living, Macarlina owns a specialized retail store which primarily sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Macarlina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Macarlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macarlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Macarlina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Macarlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
La señora Marisabel vive con su madre y su hijo en casa propia en la  zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Marisabel  trabaja en una empresa de limpieza. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un horno y poder hacer pan y otros para vender y así poder mejorar sus ingreso familiares.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Marisabel lives with her mother and her son in her own house. They live in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. Marisabel works for a cleaning company. The requested loan is to buy an oven to be able to make bread and other things to sell. That way she will be able to improve the family income. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven to be able to make bread and other products to improve her income

loans.name: Blanca Teresa

texts.es:
Blanca Teresa M. L. tiene 45 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 2 hijos, Cristian  (11) y Heidi (18),  vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Blanca es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Blanca tiene una tienda de abarrotes y un bazar en donde vende cosméticos de yambal Realiza sus compras cada tres meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda y para traer cosas para su bazar. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa y ser directoria de yambal. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades y la falta de dinero.

Le gusta mucho bailar.
texts.en:
Blanca Teresa M. L. is 45 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 2 children: Cristian (11) and Heidi (18). She lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Blanca is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José cooperative. Blanca has a convenience store and a bazaar where she sells Yanbal cosmetics. She carries out her purchases every three months in Matilde Esther and sells her products in the local community. She requests the loan to invest in the store and merchandise for her bazaar. She thinks that the credit is an opportunity to do well. Her dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house and to be director of Yanbal. she faces challenges such as illnesses and the lack of money. She likes to dance a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and bazaar.

loans.name: Vira

texts.en:
Mr. Vira U.
