(because he was not available for the photo, his wife stood in for him ) and his wife, Mrs. Sa-um, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1975 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home; two are garment factory workers; one assists his parents in the farming business, while another attends school.

Vira grows taro and papaya on his farmland in the village, assisted by his wife, a scarf weaver. Vira has received several loans already, and he now is requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to build a restroom for his family’s use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family’s use.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Selling fresh fish is the main part of 50-year-old Tam L.'s daily activities, from which she earns a living. (Note: Mrs. Tam L. was not available at that day, so her husband is pictured instead.) Mrs. Tam L. sells fish she gets from her bulk supplier. She receives help for transporting fish to the market from her husband, and additionally, her husband takes time to run a motor-taxi service. 

The couple lives with seven children, while another one is already married and has started a new home. Tam L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Tam L. wishes to have more money to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en:
Henrik H. lives in Agarak town in the Meghri region of Armenia. He has a family consisting of his wire, two children, and his mother.

Henrik works at a local factory as an electrician. To sustain his family he also keeps bees, and honey sales bring his family an additional income.

To increase his income and to reduce the affects of the business’s seasonal nature, Henrik is planning to purchase more bees.

loans.use: To purchase more bees

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: general store, fishing and tricycle (motorcycle transport) businesses. Her husband Ronie T., who is 33 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have  no children. 

Meriam joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meriam has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future. 

Meriam T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en:
Chinzorig P. is a 29 year old single parent who lives with her mother, brother and son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son, age 10, attends a local secondary school while her mother is retired and stays at home.

Chinzorig operates a transport service in her town. She uses her own Russian jeep to transport people between neighboring towns. She started her transportation business in 2010 after operating a small cafe in a rented space since 2001. Also she had sewn car seat covers to supplement her income. Her brother is also driver and runs a taxi service in the capital city of the province.

Chinzorig is a hardworking person and is known by her customers for her good character. For the future she hopes to have her own work place with a sustainable operation. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to make full repairs to her car.

loans.use: To make full repairs to her car

loans.name: Isidoro Martin

texts.es: El señor Isidoro Martin tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de sal, inicio por cuenta propia y buscando una fuente de ingresos, el cual vende sal por quintal el cual vende en otros municipios. El se encuentra muy alegre con este financiamiento que ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, con ella ha podido ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. Este financiamiento será destinado para la compra de sal por quintal.
texts.en: Señor Isidoro Martin is 41 years old, married and has three young children. He works buying and selling salt. He started with his own funds and is looking for other sources of income. He sells his salt in sacks of 100lbs to other municipalities. This financing would make him very happy as it would demonstrate that he is a very responsible person. He has been dedicated to this humble activity for 10 years with which he can offer his children an education, food and clothing. This loan will be used for the purchase of 100lb salt sacks.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills.

She makes natural juices for sale to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fresh water from home contributing to her other source of income. Beatrice faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She hopes to establish rental house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a fridge compressor to repair her fridge of storing natural juices which she makes for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the community.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge compressor to repair her fridge of storing natural juices which she makes for sale.

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
Eight members form this village loan; they are from the Traeuy Troeng village in the Kandal province. This village loan selected Mrs. Chheng K., 53, as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their familys' living. 

Mrs. Chheng K. is a farmer who owns a rice field plot to cultivate rice for a living. She does not have enough farming supplies to cultivate rice. So she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and rice seed to do so. Her husband, Mr. Chhem Ol, 53, works as a fisherman, and also helps in his wife's farming activity.

This couple has four children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and another who is attending in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and rice seed to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Barbara Hilda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una pensión restaurant, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y pension restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la época navideña como panetones, chocolates y champañes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Barbara Hilda is a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Barbara Hilda is 43 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is a grocery store.  She also has a guest house / restaurant.  She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She would like to expand and improve both of her businesses.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for the Christmas period such as panettones, chocolate and champagne.

She is grateful to those who are taking part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy products for the Christmas period such as panettones, chocolate and champagne

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is 33 years old and is married with five children who are between 5 and 15 years old. She sells beans, Irish potatoes, and other vegetables. Donatille has been in this business for about four years and employs two people.

Donatille would like to use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs such as sugar and other popular items like beer.  She would like to buy a large amount in order to wholesale to other store owners.  With any profits Donatille plans to build a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, resiD. en Berlín departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y aun no tienen hijos, se dedica a una tienda donD. ofrece artículos para el hogar, tiene 28 años D. edad.
Rosa inicio este negocio hace 2 años, por iniciativa propia, instalado en su casa D. habitación, ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería como frijoles, arroz, aceite, detergentes, arreglos florales, entre otros productos que ofrece en el negocio, con esta compra ella quiere disponer D. suficiente inventario para atender la demanda, además que tendrá la oportunidad D. poder vender más.
Su propósito es fortalecer el negocio, garantizar ingresos al hogar y aumentar la familia con su esposo contar en un futuro con hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the Berlín department of Usulután with her husband. She doesn’t have any children yet. She works in a store that sells items for the home. She is 28 years old.

Rosa began this business 2 years ago on her own initiative, opening the store in her home. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as beans, rice, oil, detergent, floral arrangements and other products to sell in her business, and with this loan she wants to be able to have sufficient inventory to meet demand in addition, to have the opportunity to be able to sell even more.

Her goal is to strengthen her business, guarantee her household income, and with her husband grow their family by having children in the future.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as beans, rice, oil, detergent and flower arrangements.

loans.name: Lilia Yudith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lilia Yudith; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y también vende útiles escolares, ella lleva en forma independiente a la ciudad de Quillabamba y también trabaja como secretaria en una empresa privada, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de carne y útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros y libros al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the communal bank named "Llapanchispac" and it is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Her name is Lilia Yudith. She is 30 years old and is married common-law and she has a son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling meats and school supplies. She is also employed as a private secretary in the city of Quillabamba. She wants to improve her businesses selling meats and school supplies. She requests a loan to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, and books in wholesale. 

She is very happy to receive a loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling in Lebanon. She worked as a beauty specialist for 5 years. Then, she started to offer beauty services from her home. As is common for the majority of Lebanese people, she cooperates with her family to cover living expenses and especially education expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to be capable of paying her university fees so as to pursue her education peacefully without any financial difficulties.

loans.use: paying her university fees

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Zakia M., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three children. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for three years. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Zakia's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more sarongs, fabrics, bedsheets and curtains and has repaid her loan successfully. Zakia hopes for a loan to start selling food in remote areas.

Zakia will share this loan with her loan group, DDC, which has 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Zakia is in the front row, second from right.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Because Of Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan to enable them to expand their businesses. With this loan they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Fatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka 55 years ago. Fatu is married and has seven children. Her husband is an electrician and six of her children have grown up and finished school; one is still in secondary school. Fatu sells rice and palm oil. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more rice and palm oil wholesale.

loans.use: Buy more rice and palm oil wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Matilde de  50 años de edad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien es comerciante y la apoya con los gastos del hogar; Rosa se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, activa, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, actualmente cuenta con un trabajo fijo ya que labora desde hace 27 años de conserje en el Hospital Jacinto Hernandez de Nueva Guineacon de donde obtiene sus ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones de pagos y los gastos basicos del hogar, ha venido obteniendo sus activos fijos mediante creditos que con tanto sacrificio y esmero ha demostrado ser buena paga realizando sus abonos en tiempo y forma. 
Solicita su sexto crèdito, para invertirlo en  compra de materiales como cemento y arena con los cuales pretende mejorar su cocina que se encuentra en mal estado, pues de esta manera mejorara las condiciones de vida, su sueño es gozar de salud y trabajo para asi ayudar a su familia ya que son bien humildes.
texts.en:
Rosa Matilde is 50 years old.  She lives with her husband, a businessman, who helps her with the home expenses.  Rosa can be described as a person who is hard working, active, responsible and dedicated to her work.  For the past 27 years she has worked as a janitor in the Jacinto Hernandez Hospital in Nueva Guineacon.  Her income earned there is used for payment obligations and the basic household expenses.  

Rosa has obtained her fixed assets through loans that through much sacrifice and effort she has proven to be reliable in making payments on time.  

She is requesting her sixth loan, which she plans to invest in materials such as cement and sand that she will use to improve her kitchen, which is run down.  In this way she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to enjoy health and work so that she can help her family, given their lack of economic resources.

loans.use: For making improvements in kitchen

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group A In Kyenjojo

texts.en: A. Clovis is the leader of Kamu Kamu Women's Group A in Kyenjojo. He is also the treasurer of his group and a strong force in ensuring that all the other members pay back their loans promptly. He is married with school-going children. Clovis sells goods like maize, beans, and coffee, and is also a tea farmer from Kitoma. In fact, he has a very big tea plantation, so much so that trucks come to his home to load, meaning he does not waste money looking for a market, since he is strategically positioned, hardworking, and friendly. He is able to make 320,000 shillings as weekly profit in his tea-growing business. He accumulated most of his capital from tea-growing, enabling him to start up the grocery-selling business. He needs a loan to be able to stock more goods for resale.

loans.use: to stock more goods for resale, like maize, beans, and coffee

loans.name: Jerose

texts.en:
Jerose C. is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 21 years old. Jerose is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Jerose owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business specifically in beauty salon. Jerose has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jerose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jerose is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for her Beauty Salon services. This will be the first loan taken out by Jerose from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her Beauty Salon Business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. sells porridge and smoked fish at Elmina near Besease. She is divorced and has five dependants.  Esther has been living on the income from her sales of porridge and fish for 10 years after her divorce. She is responsible for the well being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cartons of fish to process for resale.  She says the income she will be getting as a result of the loan will be reinvested into her fish business.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish to process for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene la edad de 49 años, está soltera  y vive con sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los pollos para su engorde y también los materiales para el agrandamiento de su local y así poder tener más espacio para el engorde de sus pollos. Ella cuenta con la granja de estos animales y quiere engrandecer sus ventas y producción para así poder abastecer el comercio local. Ella  quiere generar las ganancias para así ir creciendo como productora de carne de pollo  y cada día poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old, single, and lives with her two children who are her main priority.  She intends to use her loan to buy chickens to fatten and also materials which she needs to enlarge her premises so that she has more room in which to fatten her chickens.  She has a chicken farm and would like to increase her sales and production so that she can stock the local market.  She would like to make profits so that she can continue to grow as a producer of chicken and be able to provide her children with a better quality of life every day.

This is Teresa's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't received other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better repayment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens and building supplies

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es:
Don Jose Santiago, es casado, tiene 57 años de edad, estudió los estudios primarios, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales estan estudiandiando, se dedica a la tejeduria al tejido de corts típicos, tiene 34 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inicio como operario para otro negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al amarre de hilo.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo de diferentes colores, ya que es materia muy necesaria para su trabajo, de esta forma ampliar su negocio y contar con mas trabajores que trabajan es este negocio. Espera alcanzar su objetivo con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Santiago is married and 57 years old. He has an elementary school education. He has 4 children, 2 of whom are studying. His work is weaving cloth for traditional garments. He has 34 years of experience with this work. He began as an operator for another business. He has the support of his wife, who works tying up the threads. 

He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy thread of various colors, since it is a very necessary material for his work. In this way, he will be able to expand his business and hire more people to work for him. He hopes to reach his goal with this loan.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Leonor has a auto repair shop wherein her husband works as the auto repairman. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Leonor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Nury

texts.es: En su negocio llamado “Productos por catálogos Nury C.”,  Nury su propietaria,  vende mediante guías especializadas cosméticos, perfumes, ropa femenina y adornos para el hogar mediante el sistema de distribución a crédito en un porcentaje del 80% y  el resto de  contado,  a clientes ubicados en el barrio donde habita en el municipio de soledad, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en esta ciudad vende también  a clientes fijos, que la conocen por su amable y oportuno servicio. En su negocio Nury cobra semanalmente y quincenalmente y adquiere una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 25%, que planea aumentar en la medida en que consiga obtener financiación con la que incrementaría su capital de trabajo. Este es justamente el motivo de recurrir a un credikiva, con el cual comprará de contado y obteniendo descuentos, cosméticos, accesorios, perfumería que tiene encargado por sus rentables clientes.  Nury inició su negocio apoyada por su madre, de quien adquirió una gran experiencia, que le ha ayudado a través del tiempo, cuando con sus recursos logró un capital propio para desarrollar su propio emprendimiento mediante la venta de los  productos mencionados. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su vivienda, haciendo un segundo piso  que le permita separar el ambiente familiar del productivo y lograr mayor descanso en cada espacio.
texts.en:
Nury is the owner of her own business called “Productos por catálogos Nury C.” (Nury C. Catalog Products).  She sells cosmetics, perfume, ladies' clothes and decorations for the home through specialized catalogs.  She sells 80% of her products on credit and the rest for cash, to customers in her neighborhood, in the town of Soledad which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  In this city she also sells to regular customers who know her for her kind and timely service.

In her business, Nury collects payment every week and every fortnight.  She has a profitability on her sales of 25% and she plans to increase this as she manages to obtain financing with which she will increase her working capital.  This is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan.  She will use her loan to buy products for cash and thereby obtain discounts.  She will buy cosmetics, accessories and perfume that she has orders for from her profitable customers.

Nury started her business with the support of her mother, from whom she gained a lot of experience which has helped her over time.  She used her own  resources to put together her own capital and set up her own business selling the aforementioned products.

Nury's goal for the future is to expand her home, adding a second level which will allow her to separate her family area from her business area.  This will allow her to relax more in both spaces.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories and perfume that she has orders for.  She will pay cash and thereby obtain discounts

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar  se conformó gracias al esfuerzo de todas las miembros, ellas se encuentran en el 6 ciclo. Manifiestan que están felices, que trabajan forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan cada día por llevar a sus casas el pan de cada día. Luchan por el sustento de ellas mismas y la de sus hijos. Cada una disfruta de todo lo que hace y dicen que el programa las ha ayudado mucho a crecer, no solo económicamente, sino a nivel personal también.
La Sra. Mariana es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas, sabanas, abrigos, y demás. Por medio de esto pudo salir adelante y cubrir sus necesidades económicas. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde promocionar sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su stock de mercaderías,es decir para la compra de ropas de temporada, ya que con esta estación que entra recibe muchas demandas de clientes.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar committee was formed thanks to the efforts of all the members.  They are in their sixth loan cycle.  The say that they are happy to be working together and supporting each other in the program.  

All of the members are female heads of household who struggle every day to take home the daily bread.  They struggle to sustain themselves and their children.  Each one enjoys everything she does and says that the program has helped her to grow a great deal, not only financially, but personally as well.  

Mariana is a businesswoman.  She sells clothing, sheets, coats, and other items.  Through this activity, she is able to succeed and cover her financial needs.  She dreams of someday having a shop where she may promote her merchandise.
  
She is requesting the loan for the supply of her stock merchandise as she knows that having a wider variety of merchandise will attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old and married to a woman named Annah.  He support ten members of his family.  He has been a farmer for 26 years and now his monthly income is about 15,000 Kenyan shillings.  Annah helps him on their farm, which helps bring in more income for the family. 

Joseph plans to use this loan of 40,000 shillings to buy fertilizer, a posho mill (a machine use to grind corn or wheat into flour) and pay school fees for his children. This is his second loan and he succefully paid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a posho mill, and pay for school fees

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora  Esperanza se dedica a la venta de zapatos  , estudio hasta  la secundaria terminada , tiene un total de  tres hijos una mujer dos varones  desde  hace cinco años se ha dedicado a vender zapatos .
A la señora  Esperanza  le gusta mucho vender calzado por que tiene buenas ganancias  pero aparte de todo cuando ella desea comprar  zapatos para  sus  hijos , se lo dan a mitad de precio, le gusta mucho tener su negocio por que ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.
Le gustaría  poner su propia zapatería ya que vende, muy bien  , y en su casa  luego no puede exhibir bien los calzado y  como los tiene  en una bodega . Sus clientes le recomiendan  que ponga su zapatería para que cuando vayan a comprar ellos vean lo que tiene.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  hacer mas grande su local y vender bolsas y  zapatos.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman dedicated to shoe sales.  She completed middle school and has a total of three children: one girl and two boys.  She’s sold shoes for five years.

Esperanza enjoys selling shoes very much because profits are good but, above all, when she needs to buy her children shoes she gets them at half price.  She likes having her business because she helps her husband meet household expenses.

She would like to set up her own shoe store because she sells quite well and she’s not able to display the shoes as well at home as she could in a store.  Her customers have recommended that she open a shoe store so that when they come by to buy they can see everything she has in stock.

She asked for the loan to enlarge her locale to sell purses and shoes.

She thanks the foundation for the support it’s given her to get ahead and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo, a 36-year-old married man with four children, lives with his family in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main dream is to construct a permanent house for his family.

Apollo owns a retail shop and also deals in a motorcycle transport business. His major challenge has been constant price fluctuations which affect his profits. His desire is to own a wholesale shop. Apollo needs this loan to buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons. She lives in Nouba village near Hebron city in Palestine. Hiba works as a secretary of a school with a low income, so she has her own project, which is tailoring clothes to sell. Hiba has sewing machines and wants to purchase fabrics and threads to increase the size of sales and earn better income. But the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so Hiba needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Hiba gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will buy all she needs for the project from fabrics and threads to increase the size of her sales and earn better income to live with her family in better conditions. Hiba is photographed in the FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads to tailor clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is 59 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns income from buying and selling livestock. Bibiana has requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. Bibiana has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Bibiana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía como chompas, pantalones, polos y muñecas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, polos, pantalones, muñecas y llaveros al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Tres de Mayo de Poroy Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Gabriela is 27 years old and married.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling crafts such as sweaters, pants, jerseys, and dolls.  She sells on foot from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  With this business Gabriela gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling crafts.

Gabriela is requesting the loan to buy wholesale sweaters, jerseys, pants, dolls, and key rings.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweaters, jerseys, pants, dolls, and key rings.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 29 years old and married with two children aged 6 and 2. Her husband is a fisherman. Ginalyn and her husband work together to support their family. Ginalyn sells her husband's catch at their local market. She also buys crabs from other fishermen and resells them. Ginalyn works hard to help provide for their needs. She requested this loan to buy fishing nets and hooks and more crabs to sell. Ginalyn hopes for this loan to help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and hooks and more crabs to sell

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 46 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. Her husband is a worker in a paper production factory.

To earn a living, Lien has a general store selling basic household products, cakes, candies, beverages, spices, and instant food. She has a requested a loan to increase the range and quantity of these goods to stock her store.

Lien hopes that the loan will help her to increase the turnover of her store and enable her to set aside savings for her children's education as well as for her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy more products (cakes, candies, and beverages) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and seven siblings. He is supportive to his family especially with the heavy cost of living and expenses. 

Kassem is an expert in floor covering; he has been working in this occupation for the past 17 years. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed tools and supplies to be able to satisfy his customers' demand. In that way, he will be capable of increasing his business profits. In the future, he plans to work on projects inside and outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and supplies.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат женат и имеет двоих детей. Он старательный и трудолюбивый человек. Его жена домохозяйка. Шухрат занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он сеет пшеницу и получает хороший урожай. В бизнесе помогает ему его любящая жена. Кроме этого он имеет дополнительный доход от услуг такси. На полученный доход он хочет сыграть свадьбу сына. Шухрат запрашивает займ для покупки семян пшеницы для посева. Он заранее благодарен кредиторам КИВА  за помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Shuhrat is married and has two children. He is a hard-working man. His wife takes care of the home. Shuhrat grows crops. Mainly, he grows wheat, which brings in a good harvest. His loving wife helps him with his work. He also gets income by providing taxi services. He would like to use the extra money he makes on his son's wedding. Shuhrat is asking for a loan to purchase wheat to sow. He is grateful in advance to Kiva lenders for their support and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase wheat for sowing

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 36 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, in the district of Yen Phong, in Bac Ninh province. She has two children who are in school.

Lien has been selling fruit in the market for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. This is the 6th time she has requested a loan from SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy fruit for resale.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Jocelyn has a shop where she sells vegetables like carrots, sweet potatoes and cabbage. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 24 years old and single. For the past five years he has operated a barbershop.

Robert has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy materials and equipment needed for his barbershop.

Robert hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment needed for his barbershop.

loans.name: Musyoki John

texts.en:
Musyoki John is 24 years old. He is married and has a two-year-old son. 

He has provided transportation services for the last three years in a commercial area. His business faces a problem of inadequate funds to maintain the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy another motorbike. Musyoki hopes to own more motorbikes to increase the service in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Marco  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio es  un señor trabajador humilde, es albañil el nos cuenta que desde  muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar en lo que es la albañilería ya que es un trabajo buena le deja buenas ganancias y siempre tiene trabajos extras.
Don Marcos es soltero, tiene tres hijas a quien quiere mucho cuando se va a trabajar sus hijas se le quedan a su mama.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace tres meses.
El pidió el préstamo para la compara de mas materiales para la albañilería  ya que desea terminar rápido sus trabajos  para que sus clientas estén contentas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir trabajando y crecer como  él desea.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a hardworking and humble man who works as a bricklayer.  He tells us that since he was very young he has enjoyed working as a mason, since it is good work that gives him good earnings, and he always has additional work.

Marco is single and has three daughters who he loves very much.  When he goes to work, his daughters stay with their mother.  

In addition, he has been selling used clothing for 3 months.  He is requesting a loan to buy more masonry supplies, since he wants to finish his jobs quickly so that his customers will be pleased.

He thanks the Fundación for helping him to continue to work and grow, which is what he wants to do.

loans.use: to buy masonry supplies

loans.name: Ma.cristina

texts.en:
Ma.Cristina is 40 years old and married with 2 children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc. In the future Ma.Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been married for 27 years and has one child and three dependents; his brothers who are orphans.

Patrick does cattle fattening and goat rearing as his major source of income. He owns 20 cows and 60 goats on his farm. Patrick has managed to look after his family and also pay school fees for his three brothers. He has constructed a permanent house for his family through income from goat and cattle sales.

Patrick is applying for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy more goats for rearing and also construct a dam for his animals.

His major challenge is the dry season which affects his animals, leading even to the death of some of them.

Patrick wants to be the leading supplier of goat meat in his region.

Patrick is an honest and hardworking man and is confident he will meet his loan obligations on time to qualify for future loans.

loans.use: to buy goats and construct a dam.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Monica, from Chuka, Kenya. Chuka is not known for farming but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and, together with her husband, is blessed with three lovely children.

For the past 10 years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and because of her experience, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. Income from goat and cow milk, eggs, and crop selling have allowed her to earn a decent income. To make the extra coin, Monica engages in small personal business.

Monica passionately loves dairy farming and animals on her farm have been given names. Milking and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs an extra cow to satisfy fully the demand.

She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Monica does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15 and 20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Monica will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

Listening to Monica speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming, but because of passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Monica, and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

With your contribution this mum will be able to make her dreams a reality. Let's go and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en: Evangelista is a hardworking mother from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 74 years old and a businesswoman who engages in rice production business. Evangelista has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. Evangelista hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old and she lives with her three children of 3, 7 and 11 years of age. She is single and does not receive any economic support from the father of her children. She has always struggled alone for the wellfare of her little ones and her love for them is what has permitted her to always continue forward, although it has not been at all easy. For all of this she some time ago started selling comforters by catalogue and this way afford the schooling of her children and provide them with necessities to live with dignity.

But now she requires a loan of $550 to be able to meet fill the orders placed and pay off outstanding accounts, and this way increase her earnings. Do not leave Claudia and her family alone. They need you. You only have to decide and show them your great generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia tiene 30 años de edad y vive con sus tres hijos de 3,7 y 11 años de edad, es soltera y no recibe apoyo económico por parte del padre de sus hijos. Ella siempre ha luchado sola por el bienestar de sus pequeños y el amor a ellos es lo que le ha permitido continuar siempre hacia delante, aunque no ha sido nada fácil. Por todo lo anterior ella hace algún tiempo comenzó a vender edredones por catálogo y así poder costear el estudio de sus hijos y darles lo necesario para vivir dignamente.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $550 dólares, para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene y pagar las facturas pendientes, incrementando así sus ingresos. No dejes solos a Claudia y su familia, ellos te necesitan, solo tienes que decidirte y mostrar tu gran generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana runs a bustling little fruit stand at the central city market in Nikopol. She has been selling fruit there for three years. After trying her hand at marketing several different products, she found her niche selling a variety of fresh and dried fruits. Through her creativity, hard work, and financial assistance in the form of loans and advice from “Nadiya Ukraine”, her business has developed into a very successful enterprise. Svetlana maintains around $1000 in inventory. In a typical month she will see about $2000 worth of sales with a net income of a little over $1000. Svetlana is requesting a loan for $500 to supplement her available working capital. Her only son, who she raised by herself was, just recently married. Svetlana was able to help financially with the wedding but now needs to rebuild her cash reserves as the busy summer season approaches. She is excited about the possibility of helping her son and daughter-in-law further by opening a second vending location that her daughter-in-law could help run. Eventually, she may be able to operate a successful business of her own.

Світлана активно займається бізнесом з продажу фруктів. Вона володіє невеличким прилавком на центральному ринку м Нікополь. Вона торгує фруктами вже три роки. Спробувавши торгувати іншими товарами, Світлана вирішила все ж таки зупинитися на торгівлі свіжими та сушеними фруктами. Завдяки творчому підходу, наполегливій праці, порадам та фінансовій допомозі від „Надії України”, її бізнес поступово розвинувся та став дуже успішним. У Світлани приблизно 1000 доларів в товарі. Щомісяця її доходи складають приблизно 2000 доларів, чистий прибуток - трохи більше $1000 доларів. Світлана просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб збільшити свій робочий капітал. Її єдиний син, якого вона виховала самостійно, нещодавно одружився. Світлана змогла допомогти з весіллям, але зараз необхідно поповнити свій капітал напередодні активного літнього сезону продажів. Вона дуже хотіла б й надалі допомагати сину та невістці фінансово, і саме для цього планує відкрити другу торгову точку. Невістка Світлани буде допомагати їй з торгівлею, й врешті-решт, можливо, зможе самостійно вести власний бізнес.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mankah Dorothy

texts.en: Born in 1973, Dorothy is married with four children. The ever increasing needs of her children are her motivation to become an entrepreneur. With her training in marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans, and support from group and center members she is seeking for a loan of $400. Dorothy plans to buy vegetable seeds, palm oil, Accra-beans (dough nuts) and a wheel-barrow for transportation. This activity will provide her community with fresh raw food and snacks. She plans to repay the loan during the  term.

loans.use: Buying of Accra beans (dough nuts) and growing of vegetables.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Business Description

Kelvin has two years of experience in this industry. He used to work delivering propane gas tanks and learned the business that way. Six months ago he decided to invest his savings in this business and acquired his own gas tanks. He currently runs a small shop from 6:30 AM to 11:00 PM; his shop is centrally located and he has many clients.

Loan Use

Kelvin needs this loan to invest in more gas tanks to meet the increased demand. This additional investment will allow him to greatly expand his business.

Personal Information

Kelvin is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother in his grandfather's house. Theirs is a humble and simple home. He's an only child and works very hard to help his mother, who is a single woman, get ahead. His mom has a job and also contributes to the family's expenses. They hope that with Kelvin's hard work and his growing business they will be able to make improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Kelvin lleva 2 años de experiencia en esta actividad, el trabajaba como repartidor de gas y fue aprendiendo el negocio y hace 6 meses decidió invertir un poco de dinero que había ganado y compro cilindros de gas. Actualmente trabaja en un local donde el mismo lo atiende desde las 6:30am hasta 23:00p.m. Su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado donde él tiene bastantes clientes.

Uso del Préstamo

Kelvin desea comprar más cilindros de gas ya que los que él tiene no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda que tiene de sus clientes. A mayor capital tendrá más oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.

Información Personal

Kelvin tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá en casa de su abuelo. Su casa es demasiado sencilla y humilde. El trabaja mucho para poder ayudar a su familia ya que su mamá es una mujer sola y el como único hijo quiere sacar adelante a su mamá. Su mamá también es un soporte para él con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene su trabajo que le permite generar ingresos para el hogar. Con el esfuerzo de Kelvin y mejorando su negocio aspiran arreglar su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase additional propane gas tanks

loans.name: Bisanavbar

texts.ru:
Bisanavbar T. is married and has 2 children. She has high school education. With help of her daughter, Bisanavbar sells cosmetics and underwear. Her husband is away in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. In 2003, Bisanavbar received $30 loan from MicroInvest. Then, her business assets totaled $50, and Bisanavbar was selling only cosmetics. She used the loan to expand her business and added underwear to her assortment of goods. Bisanavbar is one of the exemplary clients of MicroInvest. In the future, she plans to expand the variety of products she sells.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тухтаева Бисанавар мать двоих детей, замужем, образование среднее. Занимается торговлей косметики и нижним бельем. Муж на заработках в России. В её деятельности помогает ей её дочь. В 2003году получила займ в размере 30$, тогда её активы составляли 50$, и она продавала только косметику. После получения займа она расширила место деятельности, добавила в ассортимент нижнее бельё. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» она является одним из примерных клиентов. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить наименование товара.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase production

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali, and is part of the group belonging to the Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, (communal bank of the triumphant leaders). She is 49 years old and has 4 grown up children. She is separated from her husband, which was one of the motivations for starting her own business so she could cover the costs of her home.

Elida runs a small restaurant from her house. She sells lunches every day and in the afternoon she prepares delicious cakes and pastries which everybody loves. Every day she gets up very early to get to the market to buy the necessary items to prepare her meals, resting only after much hard work and then preparing for the next day.

With the loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy sodas, gelatin and sweets, rice and sugar, investing the rest in the daily meals. Elida told us that she feels good, and has no problem working so hard. Thanks to the loans, she can work without worry and see that her business is growing every day.

La señora Elida pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Rosa Merino 168, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y todos son mayores de edad. Está separada, motivo por el cual decidió poner un negocio para los gastos del hogar. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) pudo instalar un negocio de venta de comida, golosinas, gelatinas, flanes, gaseosas y kekes. En la actualidad ella tiene un restaurante en su propia casa, vende menú todos los días, y por las tardes prepara sus gelatinas, tortas, flanes (postres), que son muy ricos y sabrosos, y son las delicias de sus vecinos. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los insumos que va a necesitar para la preparación de sus comidas y demás antojitos que vende, y después de una ardua labor ella descansa para seguir con mas fuerzas para el día siguiente. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000, (US$ 1,004.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses. Invertirá S/. 300 en gaseosas, S/. 30 en flan y gelatinas, S/. 50 en golosinas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar e invertirá S/. 90 soles diarios en la comida del día. Elida nos dijo que se siente bien, no tiene ningún problema y trabaja sin ninguna novedad gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos y los prestamos obtenidos, puede trabajar tranquila y ve que su negocio crece cada día más.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SODAS, SWEETS, SUGAR, RICE AND OTHER ITEMS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SERVES IN HER SMALL RESTAURANT.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
The moment Olga started a family, she has always been looking for ways to support her husband with the costs of living; she became involved in various activities to generate extra income in order to provide their eight children domestic peace, security, and well-being. She noticed that her neighborhood lacked small grocery stores and decided to invest a bit of her savings to open up one. This small business has allowed her to cover food costs for her dear children. She believes that increasing the variety of products and merchandise will ultimately be useful to her family. While she dedicates her time running the store and taking care of her children, her husband Lorenzo works at an auto mechanic shop. The couple hopes to leave most of their inheritance to their children and their education. To materialize their plans, Olga requests a loan that will be well invested.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Desde que formó su familia doña Olga, siempre buscó la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, desenvolviéndose en diversas actividades para tratar de generar ingresos extras a fin de brindar a sus ocho hijos tranquilidad, seguridad y bienestar.Observó que en su zona de vivienda no existían muchas tienditas de abarrotes y decidió invertir el poco ahorro que tenia para aperturar e implementar su tiendita, este pequeño negocio le está permitiendo cubrir los gastos de alimentación de sus queridos hijos, ella cree que aumentando la variedad y el stock de su mercadería podrá obtener mejores utilidades para su familia.Mientras ella se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijos y de su tiendita, su esposo Lorenzo por su parte trabaja en un taller de mecánica, juntos con mucho esfuerzo pretenden dejarles la mejor herencia a sus hijos, su educación. Para concretar sus planes doña Olga requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que será muy bien invertido.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods of basic needs at wholesale prices for her small store

loans.name: Huk

texts.en: Mrs. Huk Sophal, 30, is a grilled beef seller in the evening and sells noodles in the morning at Beong Salang commune, making on average US$ 6.50 in profit a day. Her husband, Eng Meng Heng, 39, is a pharmacist earning around $3.50 a day. The couple hopes to use this loan to expand their business by purchasing more beef and selling in larger quantities. The rest of money they will use to renovate their house.

loans.use: purchasing more beef and selling in larger quantities

loans.name: Block A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lucia P.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Lucia is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Lucia makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for school fees and construction.

Lucia is joined in her small group by Mary J., Susan P., Grace C., and Jackline J.. Mary J. has a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Susan P. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to construct an oven for the bread. Grace C. operates a business selling bread and wants to stock more wheat and cooking oil. Jackline J. is currently selling vegetables and is requesting a loan for cultivation.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Abed Al Salam

texts.en: Abed Al Salam is 43 years old and has six children. He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in the town of Saida, where he makes a living as a carpenter. He is applying for his sixth loan from Al Majmoua. He plans to use this latest loan to buy wood to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy wood for a carpentry business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, since she was a little girl, has always been a good saleswoman of various products. Thanks to the teachings of her parents, who were very well-known salespeople in the area. Beatriz now works doing the same thing her parents used to do and was able to send her kids to good schools. Now her kids are all grown-up and have good jobs and they all have their own families to take care of. Beatriz sells charcoal/fuel and refreshments. Thanks to God, her business is going very well. She's currently in the process of opening up a restaurant which she will run from her store. She doesn't have enough money and this is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz desde muy niña supo desenvolverse en los negocios de diversos productos, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres que fueron grandes comerciantes de la selva central. Ahora Beatriz trabaja en el mismo oficio de sus padres y con el ha podido mejorar la educación de sus hijos quienes ahora son profesionales y tienen su propia familia.Beatriz se dedica a la venta de combustibles y a la venta de bebidas en su pequeña bodega que gracias a Dios marcha muy bien y está pensando abrir un restaurante en su bodega pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder empezar y solicita le podamos apoyar con préstamo.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda, who belongs to the Village Bank Arco Iris, is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the neighborhood called Yuracc Yuracc which in Quechua means White White. Leonarda visits different fairs of the region where she sells fruit and vegetables and also buys cereals, cheeses, and other products to sell at the Nery García market and house to house. She now requests a loan of $700, money which she will invest in the purchase of wheat, corn, barley and cheese.

Leonarda dreams that she will have sufficient savings to allow her children to study and achieve professional careers, and that she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, corn, barley and cheese.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business because she needed income to help her husband pay for her son’s education, given that she wanted to help her family get ahead and give them a better standard of living. She started seven years ago selling used clothing from her house. Little by little, the business grew and she currently sells her wares at the local markets and only rarely now from her home.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, to be repaid in five months, to buy a pack of clothes to sell given she has a very low inventory. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana inició el negocio por que necesitaba un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo a pagar los estudios de su hijoya que ella deseaba sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo ropa usada en su domicilio, hast que poco a poco fue creciendo y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes y solo en ocaciones en su domicilio.

Ella necesita un credito por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar una paca de ropa para vender ya que tiene muy poco en inventario. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Huor

texts.en: Mrs. Huor N. is a villager in Trakiet Village in Kampong Speu Province. She owns a small grocery store in the village. Her husband, Mr. Vannak Vuth, assists in his wife's business. Mrs. Huor N. is 38 years old and the mother of eight children, five of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the picture. To support her business, Mrs. Huor N. needs to buy grocery products from the Kampong Speu market.  She now faces a problem because she does not have a motorbike for transporting goods from the market to resell. Thus, Mrs. Huor N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transporting goods to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is the wife of E. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room decorated house. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is in 3rd standard. Her elder son is in 2nd standard and her younger son is in kindergarten.

Nabeela baji's husband has as a business Installment Corporation. He has in this business various stock (fridges, televisions, mobile sets). He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Nabeela baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Nabeela baji's husband is a well-known businessman in the community. He keeps good quality stock in his shop. Nabeela baji has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more stock (television, CD's and specifically handsets) for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy stock (fridge,CD's and specifically handsets) for her husband's business

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa es una mujer que muy alegremente cría a animales vacunos para luego vender la carne en los mercados D. los pueblos.  Diariamente los lleva para que se alimenten con bueno y delicados pastos para que sus animales puedan desarrollarse correctamente.  Justa es una dulce pastora que vive  y mantiene su hogar gracias a sus animales.  Ahora  desea incrementar su ganado, sobre todo mejorar la raza D. sus carneros, para así vender la lana por kilos en las zonas textiles.  Por ello requiere un préstamo para la compra D. animales D. raza, y pronto tener un negocio D. venta D. lana, al igual que D. carne. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudarla a hacer esto posible.
texts.en:
Justa is a woman who very happily breeds cattle in order to later sell the meat in the town markets. Daily, she leads the cattle to be fed in a good and sensitive pasture so that they can properly develop. Justa is a gentle herder who lives and keeps her home thanks to her animals. Now, she would like to increase her livestock and, above all, improve the breed of her sheep in order to sell wool by the kilo in textile areas. In order to be able to do this, Justa requires a loan for the purchase of breed animals. She will soon have a business selling wool, similar to her business of selling meat. We hope you can help to make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of breed animals to improve the quality of her cattle and the quality of her sheep in order to sell their wool.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mr. Phea P. was born in 1977, and he now lives in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, he is a farmer; more specifically, he owns land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Nhen Nob, helps him on their plantation. Moreover, they have a 3-year-old child, who is too young to work or study.

Unfortunately, he has been experiencing problems on his plantation because his field is infertile, which has an adverse affect on his crops. To address this problem, he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase the crop yield on his plantation. In addition, he explains that if there are any remaining loan proceeds, he would use such proceeds to purchase more pesticides.

loans.use: To increase his plantation's crop yield by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa Dinndin, 34 years old and a resident of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, is busy tending her little sari-sari store. Being single, she devoted her life to her business as she grew up to have her own sales. She tried snack selling pancakes and "benignit" ( a porridge with coco milk). Her loyal customers are her relatives and neighbors. One day, she decided to start a mini grocery store with a small amount of capital. She is impressed with the returns.

Elisa is in her 4th year of membership to Paglaum MPC where she got working capital. She feels fulfilled that through her little sari-sari store, she is able to help the community. She plans to expand her business by venturing into rice trading and animal feed.

Elisa hopes that one day she'll become a big-time wholesaler of rice and feed, a commitment not only to herself but to the community.

loans.use: Capital for rice trading and animal feeds

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank; “Amaqella” means “Don’t be lazy” in Quechua. She is 48 years old and married with six children. Juana and her husband sell construction materials, mainly bricks and sand. They inherited the brick-selling business from Juana’s parents, and they started selling sand about 20 years ago. Juana and her husband take the sand from a nearby river and buy the bricks directly from the manufacturers. They sell both sand and bricks from their car, and have many regular customers.

Juana is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy fuel for her vehicle and pay her brick-makers. Her goal for the future is to buy a bigger car to haul more construction materials around.

loans.use: Buy fuel for vehicle, pay brick makers

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Khadija M., age 44, is married with four children ages 27, 25, 22 and 18. She has a grocery and a retail shop where she sells food. She started these businesses in 1994 and works daily from 7am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $800. 

This will be Khadija’s six’s loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first five to increase the stock in both businesses and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan, part of it to increase her stock, to buy chairs for the grocery and to buy an ironing table for home use. 

Khadija will share this loan with subgroup A of the Muungano group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run shops, grocery, sell clothes, food and charcoal. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Khadija is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase her inventory, buy more chairs for grocery and ironing table

loans.name: Khong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Khổng Thị Duyên năm nay 52 tuổi. Chị Duyên  đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ hưu trí và 3 con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Sóc Sơn - Hà nội. Năm 2006 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện nay với việc chăn nuôi 15 con lợn và sự hỗ trợ của các con hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khong Thi D. is 52 years old. Mrs. D. lives with her husband who is a pensioner and 3 grown-up children in Soc Son District, Hanoi. In 2006, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to raise pigs. Currently, by raising 15 pigs and financial support of her children, the income of her family reaches VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND12,000,000 to buy foods for the pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying foods for pigs

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Rusia has been a alcohol seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more alcohol for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Rusia is 38 years old, married, and has five children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ross, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol items for her business.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Хабибов Лутфулло проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей.Занимается торговлей сельхозкультурами.  За кредитом обращается в первый раз и планирует использовать для закупки овощей и фруктов для реализации. Таким образом он увеличит товарооборот и сможет увеличить свои доходы.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Lutfullo H. lives in the Shahrinau region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. He is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. This is his first time applying for a loan and he plans to use it to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. This way he can increase his turnaround as well as his profits. Lutfullo will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround of goods

loans.name: Tukhtaboy

texts.ru: Тухтабой - мужчина 44 лет. Женат. Имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Тухтабой в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Tukhtaboy is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has five children. He raises and sells large and small-horned cattle. He buys the livestock at the market, feeds them for two to three months, then sells them at the same market. His wife spins cashmere yarn to sell at the market, and also helps with the farming at home. By doing so, she assists her husband in improving the family finances. For his part, Tukhtaboy wants to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of cattle

loans.name: Oloyode

texts.en: Oloyode is 48 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira ($500 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She started this business ten years ago and it has grown steadily. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bisoleha

texts.ru: Хабибуллоева Бисолеха- женщина которая кредитуется в Микроинвесте второй год. Кредит использует на расширение бизнеса  торговли женской одежды. Товар ей привозит её муж с Бишкека на своей машине. Поэтому Бисолеха экономит на транспортных расходах. Бисолеха получив очередной займ хочет привезти товары весеннего ассортимента. Бисолеха на месте бизнеса во время торговли.
texts.en:
Bisoleha H. is a woman who has been taking out loans at MicroInvest for the second year. She uses the loans to expand her women's clothing retail business. Her husband brings the merchandise on his own car from Bishkek. This is why Bisoleha saves on her travel expenses. Bisoleha wants to use her next loan to bring in the merchandise for the spring season. On the photo, Bisoleha is at her retail business location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spring assortment of clothing

loans.name: Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Orquideas" esta representado por la señora Yovannay presenta un parentesco familiar entre la señora Maria de Carmen y la señora Concepción son primas pero ambas cuentan con pequeños negocios propios. Una Gran mayoría de las socias integrantes se dedican a la venta de comida pero también a la venta de productos como ser ropa y cosméticos por catalogo. Dentro del mercado de venta de comida existe un elevado índice de competencia pero lo que rige es el sabor de la comida es por esta razón que los socios desean el crédito para mejorar sus locales y para la adquisición de mejores insumos para su cocina. El grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando honradez y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group "Orquideas" ["Orchids"] is represented by Yovannay. There is a family relationship between Maria de Carmen and Concepción. They are cousins but both have their own small businesses. The large majority of the members dedicate themselves to selling food but also to the sale of products such as clothing and cosmetics through catalogs. Inside the market of selling food, there is an elevated index of competition but what rules is the flavor of the food. It's for this reason that the members would like the loan, to improve their business places and to acquire better supplies for their kitchen. The group finds itself entering its second cycle, demonstrating honor and responsibility in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy capital for operations

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Maria Cecilia A. P. reside en la capital de El Salvador junto a su hija y su madre. Maria posee un panadería ubicada en un lugar muy céntrico donde sus clientes llegan a comprar todos los días, Maria no conformándose e imaginando la manera para aumentar su ingresos tuvo la idea de vender su productos en lugares de los alrededores, como las tiendas y es así como ha logrado expandir su producto en Antiguo Cuscatlán donde posee su mayor punto de ventas, Maria solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la panadería ya que quiere aumentar su producción diaria; ya que no es suficiente la producción actual para la demanda que posee actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria Cecilia P. A. lives in the capital of El Salvador with her daughter and mother. Maria owns a bakery located in a very central place where customers come to shop every day. Maria started to look for ways to increase her income, and had the idea to sell her products in shops nearby. This is how she got to expand the distribution of her products to Antiguo Cuscatlan which is her largest point of sale.

Maria is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients for her bakery because she wants to increase her daily production, since it is lower than the demand she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sol De Tihuanacu Group

texts.es: “Sol D. Tihuanaku” es una asociación que pertenece al Centro Focal “Juan Pablo II”, con 11 integrantes. Su presidenta es  Isabel D. quien las organiza para asistir al consultorio y hacerse un examen general. Una D. las integrantes es Margarita B., que tiene el negocio D. venta D. mantas y polleras, en L. feria “16 D. Julio” una D. las más grandes del país. ElL. cuenta que se agruparon por L. necesidad  D. contar con un capital D. trabajo para hacer crecer sus negocios, bajo L. garantía solidaria ya que en otras entidades financieras les piden garantías reales. Al igual que Margarita todas tienen sus propios negocios como L. venta D. pasteles, comida, ropa, artículos en cuero, abarrotes y tejido a mano y requieren del préstamo para L. compra D. mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
"Sol D. Tihuanacu" (Sun of Tihuanacu) is an association with 11 members that is part of the "Juan Pablo II" Community Center. Its president is Isabel D. who organized the group in order to access Pro Mujer's health services, including a general exam. One of the group's members is Margarita B., who owns a business selling ponchos and skirts in the "16 D. Julio" street market, one of the largest in the country. She counts on the group because it provides her with the necessary capital in order to grow her business under a joint guarantee, while other financial entities would require a real guarantee. Just like Maria, all of the other group members have their own businesses selling items such as pies, meals, clothing, leather goods, groceries, and handwoven goods, and they require a loan in order to buy merchandise and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise and Supplies

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Pour aider son mari qui est un chauffeur dans la prise en charge de leurs 02 enfants et dans diverses charges du foyer, cette femme a commencé le commerce  de bois de chauffage, elle s’approvisionne à tsévié car le bois de chauffage est moins coûteux, ce qui lui permet de gagner plus de profits.
