Une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 tas de bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
To help her husband, who is a driver, in supporting their 2 children and with the various household expenses, this woman started selling firewood. She gets her supplies in Tsévié, because firewood is cheaper there, which enables her to increase her profits. Part of her stock has run out, and she would like to resupply. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 10 bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bundles of firewood

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: "Living in a hacienda (sugarcane plantation) with low wages and raising ten children is very hard to manage. We had plans to give our children a better future through education but then we didn't have enough resources to provide for all of them. I dreamed that maybe someday my children will lift me out of poverty. But how?" - This is the question of Mrs. Clarita K., a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Hacienda Caridad, Brgy. Luna, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Mrs. K. knew that the small income that her husband earned was not enough for her dream for her children. This is the reason why she decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon - to borrow enough capital to start a business to supplement her husband's income. Using her first loan, she put up a food stall, selling different kind of fruit in the local market of Cadiz. She noticed that her business income helped her very much with the needs of her family. Her business is doing well and earns about PHP 12,000 per month. This new loan of Php 13,000 is Mrs. K.'s 9th and will be utilized for the purchase of additional inventory and as working capital. The profits from this will be used to supplement her family's income. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 4&5 Group

texts.en:
Nereyda is the group coordinator of the group Cristo La Fuente (Christ is the source) which is based in a rural batey surrounding La Romana. A batey is a rural community nestled in the expansive sugarcane fields that surround La Romana, where the cane cutters, whom are largely of Haitian origin, resiD.. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children in a home provided by the Sugar Company maD. of cement but lacking in electricity. 

Nereyda came to Esperanza for the opportunity to inject capital into her business. She is on her second loan cycle after having completed her first loan cycle. She plans to use this loan to purchase 10 dozen pairs of panties and 14 brassieres to sell in her community. She believes that there is ample market to make these sales and this increased quantity will improve her income, which is the primary source of revenue for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase lady's undergarments to sell

loans.name: Wobkine

texts.en:
Wobkine is a 44 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Wobkine has been working as a jewelry designer for three years. He produces bracelets, necklaces, earrings and other jewelry depending on the fashion and the demand. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new machine to expand his production. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Wobkine's work is special because he produces nice and trendy jewelry. His clients are his friends, neighbors and traders. When Wobkine first started his business he had family issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by selling throughout the Arab countries.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine to expand his production.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 33-year-old mother of four. She operates an open-air business in Industrial Area Nairobi where she sells food to employees of the industries. She serves chapati (flat bread), ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), rice, beans, green grams (mung beans), meat and fish, among other foods. Lilian is requesting her third loan of Kes 80,000 to add to her stock of wheat flour, cooking fat, cabbage and other cooking ingredients. She hopes to grow her business into a big hotel (restaurant) and start a wholesale shop. On a personal level, she desires to educate her children to university level and to buy her family a home away from the slums. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Venie

texts.en:
Venie L. owns and operates a video games business. She is also a fish vendor. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City. Venie has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Venie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Venie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Venie is requesting a new loan of 5000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mr. Mok S., age 58, is the father of two kids, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. His wife, Klang Chanthou, 43, is a local chef and a housing decorator as well. She appears in the photo.

Mok S. makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He currently earns an average of $4 a day and has been running his service for a long time.

Mok S. hopes to earn additional income by using a Kiva loan as capital to purchase a cultivating machine and will earn fees by renting it to farmers during the farming season.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine to rent to farmers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia C. is a 25 year old married lady with one daughter. Her husband is called Nicholas Kilonzo, and they reside in Bamburi, Mombasa. 
Lydia is a business lady and she sells a variety of ladies' shoes in the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last two years and her business has been quite a success. She has been able to grow from one shoe stall to four stalls in the span of two years.

Lydia was introduced to KADET by a client and is currently accessing her first loan. She plans to purchase more ladies' shoes to give her clients an even broader variety to choose from. Through subsequent KADET loans Lydia hopes to venture into other major Kenyan towns and to also start selling ladies' clothes. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase ladies' shoes.

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
T. Lhagvajav is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Her oldest son is a university student and her youngest son and daughter attend a local secondary school. She opeartes a coal and firewood trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She also works as a teacher at a local secondary school. Lhagvajav's husband is mainly responsible for purchasing and selling the coal and firewood as she is busy teaching most days. She manages the financials of the business and advises her husband on the day to day operations. They purchase coal and firewood twice a month and use their truck to transport the goods. Lhagvajav started the raw materials business in 2007 and has had much success over the last two years. She says, "My husband and I are working hard to save money for our childrens' education. In the future I would like to open my own store." She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase coal for her business and to pay some medical expenses for her children. At the picture: Lhagvajav and her husband.


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase coal for her business and to pay some medical expenses for her children

loans.name: Jubeida

texts.en:
Jubeida A. currently sells beans, peas and maize flour, among other products.  She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and maize flour to sell.  Jubeida is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has 4 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits that will be generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Paula Emelina

texts.es:
Muy alegre, la señora Paula S. se dedica a su actividad de tienda general donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles como pan dulce, pan simple, golosinas, huevos, arroz, cereales y otros. También ofrece productos varios como papel higiénico, jabones, servilletas y otros.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería con el fin de continuar beneficiando a su hijo en edad escolar ya que ella es madre soltera. Espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así logrará realizar el trabajo de venta de productos en el negocio en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Paula S. cheerfuly tends to her general store where she offers all kinds of food items like: sweet bread, regular bread, eggs, rice, cereals, etc. She also offers various non-food items like: toilet paper, soaps, paper napkins, etc. She needs funding to buy stock items for the store so that she can continue to provide for her young, school-age son since she is a single mother. She hopes to be favored with the loan approval so that she can continue to sell her products; she lives in León department.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange was born in 1984; she is married with one child who is 2 years of age. She lives with her family in the northern province of Rwanda, which is approximately two hours from the capital, Kigali. Her husband is a technician; they both work hard for their family. Solange has owned a shop selling different kinds of goods including drinks such as juice, mineral water, ripe bananas, etc. Before this business, Solange was a full-time housewife and she was not able to contribute toward the life of her family. She has been in business for one year. Her shop is open from 6 AM to 9 PM every day and she employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well.

Solange is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products which will make her more efficient, effective and more successful. She thinks with these products she will be able to attract more customers as well as earning more profit which in turn will allow her to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: additional products including drinks like juice, mineral water, ripe bananas, etc.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 25-year-old married woman who has been working as a hairdresser in a salon for the past five years.

In 2008, after having her first child, Nour started working as a home-based hairdresser to support her husband with the family income. The income from her work helps in satisfying her baby’s needs.

Today, Nour is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. hairdressing tools and supplies because she's planning to expand her business in the coming months and make it better to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
It is said that we should not be afraid to take a big step, otherwise we cannot cross a chasm in two small jumps. This is a motto of Nazira N., the leader of this group, who once decided to change her life totally and she did succeed. Now what she has is the result of her determination and a little bit thanks to curiosity. She is a person who is impatient and always wants something more than what she has. Her eager desire to obtain more from life leads her to victory. She married at the age of 20, and now at 23 she is the mother of two children. Her husband is a security guard in the night club. As soon as her first son was born, her ambitious mind did not let her stay at home and she immediately organized a business. At first, she got a loan about 7,000 KGS to build a small grocery shop inside of the house. With the rest of the money she bought goods for daily use. Now she has a refrigerator in the shop, which was purchased to sell ice-cream. The business flourishes day to day, and in the future she wants to buy a car and build a bigger shop. Now her profit per month is 5,000 KGS. With this loan she is going to buy foodstuff to increaseher sales. 

Damira A. is a 27-year-old wife and mother of two little children. Her husband is at home and they both deal with breeding and selling horses and cattle. This business was inherited. She has a shop where she is going to sell daily foodstuff, so she wants to get a loan to buy foodstuff. 

Aynagul S. is a 53-year-old wife and mother of seven children who are all married and live separately. Her husband is at home and looks after livestock. They are breeding, fattening and selling cattle. Also they sell milk. They started a business with 25,000 KGS and now the total revenue is 7,000 KGS. She wants to get a loan to buy a cow in order to sell milk.

Soltobek T. is 63-years-old and a married father of five children, three who are married and live separately and two who attend school. He bought a car with saved money and began to trasport passengers. His revenue is 13,000 KGS per month. He already married off his son and bought a house. He is planning to change his car and save money for the wedding of his other son. Now he wants to get a loan to buy bull-calves in order to fatten them and resell afterward.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff to increase sales.

loans.name: Trork

texts.en: Mr. Trork K. is 62 years old and a villager in Ta Preah village in TaK. province. He and his wife, Mrs. Mao Tet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn an income for their family. As farmers, they do not have any oxen for plowing. Thus, Mr. Trork K. decided to ask for a loan to buy 2 oxen for plowing. Aside from farming, this couple breeds ducks and can earn a small income to support their family. Mr. Trork K. is the father of two children; they are duck breeders who support their parents' business. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 2 oxen

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”, actualmente se encuentra en el XIII ciclo y está conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios; Guido es el presidente,  Marisol es la secretaria, Hilda es la tesorera y Dedicación es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco.        

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo,  venta de lubricantes, venta de joyería, venta de accesorios de computadoras, venta de repuestos de carros y venta de quesos. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo carpintería, mecánica, empleadas de hostales y uno es chofer la municipalidad de Anta.

Frine se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo a la venta de lubricantes y a la venta de comida, ella tiene una tienda alquilada donde vende sus lubricantes y su comida, ella vende lubricantes de lunes a sábados de 7 am hasta 8pm. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar comida y luego lo vende. Su esposo tiene un taller de reparación  de automóviles y así esta forma ayuda al ingreso económico del hogar. Ya son 4 años que Frine participa en el banco comunal y le ha va muy bien gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad con los pagos de las cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo filtros  y aceites. El sueño de Frine es abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de carros.              
 	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

(En la foto pequeña a mano izquierda sale la señora Hilda, quien no pudo asistir a la reunion de desembolso por tener otra obligación, su esposo estaba siendo evacuado a la ciudad de Lima porque se encontraba mal de salud).
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian Group, which is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle, is comprised of 14 hard-working and enterprising people who are always looking for the opportunity to get ahead in life. They make great efforts to provide their children with a better future. This communal bank is represented by Guido, the group president; Marisol, the secretary; Hilda, the treasurer; and Dedicación, the advisor. The members get together once a month in the microfinance offices of the Asociación Arariwa, Cusco headquarters. Some of the members have businesses in which they sell merchandise such as motor oil, jewelry, computers and accessories, auto parts, and cheese. Other members provide carpentry, automotive, or cleaning services. One of the members is a driver in the municipality of Anta. Frine sells motor oil and fast food. She rents a shop in which she sells her merchandise. She sells motor oil from Monday to Saturday, 7am to 8pm. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the food that she sells. Her husband has an auto repair shop, and they both help with the household expenses. Frine has been working with the communal bank for 4 years, and she has prospered because she is punctual and responsible with her payments. She needs this loan in order to purchase merchandise, such as filters and motor oil. Frine's dream is to open up her own auto part shop. Cusco is a city that is well-known for its archaeological centers, its history, and its landscapes, which makes it an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. (Hilda is pictured in the small photo in the bottom lefthand corner. She was unable to attend the loan disbursement meeting due to other obligations - her husband was in poor health and had to be brought to Lima).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase filters and motor oil

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La siempre alegre Felicia tiene 41 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona céntrica de su ciudad.

Buscar estrategias de venta es lo que más le gusta, pues hasta hoy en día y desde hace 20 años viene dedicándose a su tienda de comestibles. La parte difícil de su trabajo es cuando algunas personas piden crédito y luego no quieren pagar o se demoren en los pagos; “me hace perder ganancias”, refiere, pues trabaja con la ayuda de un empleado.
Con el dinero que ha ganado en su negocio logró construir su casa de material noble (ladrillos y cemento), donde tiene implementada su tienda. Ahora viene ahorrando para ampliar su espacio e incrementar su mercadería hasta llegar a ser  una de las distribuidoras de abarrotes más grandes e importantes de su localidad.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasta de laborar junto a su banco comunal, donde se comprometió a ser puntual y sobre todo responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más comestibles y productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
The always-happy Felicia is 41 years old. She is single and lives alone in her own home located in a central section of her city. Searching for selling strategies is what she likes most, and up till now, and for the past 20 years she's been devoting herself to her food store. The difficult part of her work is when some people ask for credit and then don't want to pay, or are late in their payments "causing her to lose earnings." She works with one employee. With the money she has earned from her business she was able to build her home out of good materials (bricks and mortar), where she also has her store. She has been saving to expand her space and increase her merchandise to the point that she is one of the largest and most important grocery distributors in her neighborhood. This is the first time she's had a loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic to partner with the communal bank, where she's promised to be on time and above all responsible in her payments. With the money she borrows, she will buy more food and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Asheer's Group

texts.en:
Asheer is a resident of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods). She is the wife of A. and owns a two-room house where she has been living with her family for over 20 years. 

She is a very caring and good-natured lady who always has a big smile on her face. She is very strong too and handles all problems with maturity. Asheer operates a clothes-sewing business from her house. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns income which helps her to manage her family's financial expenses. 

Her husband is a butcher by profession. He operates a butcher shop in the community and has been selling meat for the past five years. Asheer is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s butcher shop so he can purchase animals and sell the meat to his customers and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase animals in order to sell the meat

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Maximia Maria tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues comenzó con pocos productos, pues se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a vender sus productos en la calle, ya que le resulta mucho más favorable así pues obtiene más clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de bolsos, sabanas, calzado, perfumes y toallas ya que ser acerca la festividad del día de la Madre y tiene bastantes pedidos. Sueña con mejorar su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Maximia Maria is 34 years old, living with her two children who are still minors and in her care. She earns her income through the sales of general merchandise. For more than seven years, she has had this business which began with a few products. Later waking up at 5:00AM to sell her products in the street, proved to be favorable and increased her clientele. The loan is for her to buy bags, sheets, footwear, perfume, and towels as the Mother's Day holiday is approaching and she has many orders. She dreams of improving her humble accommodations.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags, sheets, footwear, perfume, and towels

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong B. and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun Soun (pictured together), live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, got married in 1979, and have seven children: three sons and four daughters.  Five of them are married and live outside the family home; one son is a gardener and another one stays at home. 

Kong and his wife are gardeners. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of 250 USD to purchase neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring land to expand his property

loans.name: Nuria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nuria tiene 37 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, está casada tiene dos hijos, Henry y Oscar de 18 y 16 años respectiva, su esposo es albañil y ella es empleada en el área de cocina del parque acuático Monte Grande. 
Ella trabaja como cocinera del parque acuático desde que se inicio, es la empleada más antigua, y trabaja de lunes a jueves de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. Nuria necesita el préstamo para terminar de construir un cuarto, comprar las puertas y ventanas, que servirá de dormitorio para su hijo mayor.
Las aspiraciones de Nuria es algún día tener su propio restaurante, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nuria, 37, lives in San Miguel. She is married and has two sons: Henry and Oscar, 18 and 16 years old respectively. Her husband is a bricklayer and she works in the kitchen of the Monte Grande aquatic park. She began working as a cook in the aquatic park since it opened. She is the longest standing employee. She works Monday through Thursday from 8am to 4pm. Nuria needs the loan to finish building a room that will serve as her oldest son’s bedroom. She needs to buy windows and doors. Nuria hopes to have her own restaurant some day and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Damasco Group

texts.es:
El grupo damasco está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ivania del Carmen Dávila desde hace cinco años de lunes a domingo tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, los fines de semana realiza nacatamales y comercializa ropa por encargo.
Las otras integrantes son Claudia  R. comerciante de ropa y Emerita M. quien desde hace 10 años vende ropa de todo tipo. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería especialmente por las hípicas y microfer.
texts.en:
The "Damasco" group is made up of 3 enterprising, dedicated and hardworking women. One of these is Ivania del Carmen Dávila, who has had a small restaurant for 5 years, where she sells fried food every day. On the weekends she also makes nacatamales (a special type of large tamale typical of Nicaragua) and sells clothing via advance orders. The other members are Claudia R., who sells clothing, and Emerita M., who has been selling all types of clothing for 10 years. They will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise, particularly for the horse parades and art festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, staple grains, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lucia Elizabeth

texts.es: Lucia Elizabeth D. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago Nonualco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. En este lugar vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos D. 8, 3 y 1 año D. edad. Lucia trabaja vendiendo ropa para mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa joyería como: cadenas, aritos, pulseras y anillos entre otros más, los cuales son D. enchape D. oro, los precios que ella ofrece son muy buenos, y así mismo la calidad del producto que ofrece es excelente, por lo que cuenta con varios clientes, los cuales realizan compras frecuentes. Lucia comercializa la mayoría D. la ropa y joyería a crédito, y es una mínima cantidad la que ofrece a contado, debido a las facilidades D. pago que ella ofrece, es que pueD. contar con varios clientes. Lucia solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa y joyería, y así mismo comprar mayor variedad, D. forma que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, esto lo hace con el enorme deseo D. poder obtener más ganancias y D. esta forma mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia Elizabeth D. D. M. is 40 years old and lives in Santiago Nonualco, located in the Usulután department. She lives with her family which includes her husband and three children, ages 8, 3, and 1. Lucia sells women’s and children’s clothing. She also sells jewelry, such as chains, earrings, bracelets, and rings, among other gold plated things. Her prices are very good and the quality of her merchandise is excellent. She has steady customers who buy from her frequently. Lucia sells most of her clothing and jewelry on credit and sells very little for cash. Because of her simple payment terms, she is able to count on many customers. [She] is asking for this loan so that she can buy bulk quantities of clothing and jewelry in greater varieties. This will better satisfy her customers. She has a great desire to increase her income and bring greater financial stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Mary Marden

texts.en:
Mary Marden N. is from the town of Talibon. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Marden owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sometimes, she helps her husband gather seaweed, which they sell to the market.
Mary Marden joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and buy equipment for gathering seaweed. This loan will be her first from CEVI. Mary Marden plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her store and equipment for gathering seaweed

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah S. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Sarah is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah sells daily personal products, such as shampoo, soap and perfumes, in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Sarah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Sarah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Emma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Emma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold G., age 39, lives with his wife and two children in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, a primary city in Mongolia. The family lives together in their own apartment. His oldest son attends the local high school while Enhbold and his wife operate the family business. 

They own a small bicycle repair and car parts trading business in their town. They have been engaged in this business for past 12 years and have built a sustainable operation. At first, the couple rented a small room for workplace, but after a year of successful business operation, they managed to buy the new house and fence in 2008 and expand their services. They business is located in a popular spot, which attracts more customers. In the future, they are planning to provide more services such as motorcycle and automobile repair services. 

He is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more bicycle parts when prices for those products are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase more bicycle parts to use in his shop

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Silvestrina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Fe y Esperanza 1 & 2 (Women of Faith and Hope). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Silvestrina’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic in an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry. Outside of the all-inclusive resorts, potable water and electricity are unreliable.

Silvestrina lives in a simple structure with her husband and some of her six children. For the past two years, she has run a Colmado, a place that sells all of the ingredients to cook daily food. Colmados are generally integrated into neighborhoods and a short walk from many homes. Silvestrina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business which started out selling salad. Silvestrina will use her loan to buy rice, flour, and other foods. She will use the profits to continue studying and expand her technical abilities to baking and sewing. Silvestrina wants to save money because, even though her children are not living in her house, she feels the need to help and support them anytime.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, and other foods

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: tricycle, food vending and catering. She lives in Catlagan, Bgry. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tricycle, food vending and catering businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 6,000. Thelma is now borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Thelma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Seom's Group

texts.en:
This village loan is comprised of eleven people. They are located in the Traeuy Troeng village in the Kandal province. This village loan selected Mrs. Seom C., a 44-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Seom C. and her husband, Mr. Sam Sol, are farmers who own a two-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mrs. Seom C. also sells groceries in the local village. In order to increase income to improve the family condition, Mrs. Seom C. wants to expand it. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy grocery to enlarge her business activities. 

This spouse has four children, one of whom is electrician and the others are students who also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To buy grocery to enlarge her business activities.

loans.name: Yayanmarca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “YAYANMARCA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la comunidad de Yayanmarca,  distrito de Cusipata, provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina ;   La socia  es conviviente  y tiene 6 hijos , la socia tiene 35 años de edad;  la socia a los largo de su vida a tenido que trabajar en todo lo que sea posible y pudiera darle una remuneración a cambio, ella sin estudios secundarios terminados y creyendo como era en la antigüedad a mayor número de hijos mayor posibilidad de labrar las tierras de cultivo y obtener mayor dinero para comer y tener salud esas prioridades la llevaron a no tener una planificación familiar y sin más que hacer ella debe dividirse y trabajar de sol a sol, la socia trabaja vendiendo productos secos (maíz, papa seca, habas, granos, quinua, frejoles, pallares ) y alterna con la venta de animales menores  (cuyes, y aves de corral); ella vende en el mercado de Combapata, la socia también cuando le traen los proveedores de la selva peruana hojas de coca en poca cantidad, las lleva a vender en su mismo stand en el mercado, la hoja de coca es considerada una planta sagrada y en la antigüedad los inkas la cultivaban, actualmente es parte de nuestra cultura y solo se le reconoce los propiedades y no más así como una droga, en la sociedad andina está hoja es tan sagrada como para poder perjudicarla con el mal empleo que le dan algunos humanos en contra de otros humanos. La socia con lo que le genera la venta de sus productos y animales menores educa y alimenta a sus menores hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar animales menores y algunos productos secos que no cultiva ella.  
Los otros socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos  se dedican a moler granos, los socios tiene en su mayoría pequeñas y grandes máquinas de molinos los cuales las alquilan al pueblo para moler los diferentes productos y estos poder vender al por mayor a las ciudades de casi todo el Perú.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ubaldina, 35, is a member of the ‘YAYANMARCA” communal bank which is located in the community of Yayanmarca, Cusipata district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

She has a life partner and six children.  Throughout her life she has had to work at whatever was possible that would produce income in exchange.  Not having finished secondary school and believing, like in the old days, that the more children one had the greater ability to cultivate the fields and earn more money to eat and have health, those priorities led her not to plan her family.  With no other alternative now, she must split herself up to work from sun to sun.

She works selling dry goods (maize, dehydrated potato, L. beans, grains, Quinoa, broad beans, pallares beans).  She also sells small farm animals (guinea pigs and barnyard fowl).  She sells in the Combapata market.  In addition, when suppliers bring coca leaves from the Peruvian jungle in small amounts she takes them to her stand in the market to sell too.  Coca leaf is considered to be a sacred plant and Incas grew it in antiquity.  It’s currently part of our cultures and it’s known only for its properties, not as a drug.  In Andean society this leaf is too sacred to desecrate using it for evil like some humans do against other humans. With what her sales of products and small animals produce she educates and feeds her minor children.

She is asking for a loan to buy small farm animals and a few dry goods that she does not grow herself.

The other group members alternate their activities with retail sales.  They grind grains.  Most of them have small or large mills that they least out in town to grind various products which the people can then go sell at wholesale in cities throughout most of Perú.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and a few dry grains that she doesn't grow.

loans.name: Alphajor

texts.en: Here is Alphajor J., a small-scale businessman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Alphajor sells jeans, T-shirts, underwear, bed sheets, portmanteaus, shoes, radios, etc. He has been doing this business for ten years now. With a loan of SLL 4,000,000, Alphajor will be able to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock. Alphajor is married to a businesswoman and they have three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

loans.use: Buy products for re-sale

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, con su esposo y dos hijos de 24 y 23 años de edad, solo uno de sus hijos es independiente, ella tiene 49 años de edad y posee una tienda donde ofrece productos comestibles del uso domestico y también sorbetes, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con ingresos, atiende todos los días de la semana y cerca de ella no hay otro negocio.
Doña Vilma está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  mercadería americana, con esta inversión busca fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, logrando mantenerles satisfechos.
Sueña con ser dueña de un minisúper y ser distribuidor de confitería, y de esta manera estabilizar los ingresos a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and two children who are 24 and 23 years old. Only one of her children is independent. She is 49 years old and has a store where she sells daily household items and sorbets. This business grew out of the need to help her husband with the income. She attends to the store every day and there is no other business close to her.

Vilma is requesting a loan for the purchase of American merchandise. With this investment, she is looking to strengthen the business and offer a variety of products to her customers, thus keeping them satisfied.

She dreams of owning a mini-supermarket and distributing pastries, thus stabilizing her family income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase American merchandise

loans.name: Socrates

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Socrates; el tiene 37 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios de carros, el socio vende en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja haciendo servicio de taxi, el socio quiere tener una tienda de venta de accesorios para carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the LLAPANCHISPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Socrates. He is 37 years old, single, with one child. This member alternates his daily activities with the business of selling car accessories. He sells as a traveling salesman. He also works offering a taxi service. The member wants to have a store selling car accessories. He is requesting this loan to buy car accessories.

The member is happy for this loan. He is committed to making all repayment installments.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to buy car accessories.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmela; ella tiene 43 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de imprenta, la socia se dedica a esta actividad por el momento y le gustaría agrandar su negocio en el futuro, la socia es una persona bien optimista y perseverante con las ganas de seguir adelante por ella misma, ella vende diferentes tipos de tarjetas para todo compromiso como bautizos, fiestas de 15 años, matrimonios entre otros más.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una máquina para su negocio de imprenta y así poder agilizar su trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmela, 43, is a member of the “PACHAPACCARI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with a print shop.  She is currently engaged in this activity and would like to expand the business in the future.  She is quite an optimistic, persevering person who wants to get ahead on her own.  She sells all kinds of greeting cards for all occasions like baptisms, 15 year old birthday parties, weddings, etc.

She needs the loan to buy a machine for her print shop thus streamlining the work.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her print shop.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Annabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as junk foods and beverages, to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peninah Wanza

texts.en:
Penina buys and rears livestock to sell later at a profit. She does this on her own plot of land. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of KES 2,000 per month. Penina is 46 years old, married and supports six members of her family. 

She learned about Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, from a member of another registered group and she has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy two goats for fattening and later selling. Penina intends to use the anticipated profits to cover her family's basic needs and save. In the future she hopes to become the leading livestock keeper.

loans.use: To buy two goats for fattening and selling later at a profit

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maura is one of the members of 'Minerva Mirabal group' (named after one of the legendary Mirabal sisters who resisted and were killed by the dictator Trujillo). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Maura is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and sausage by purchasing pork and beef, to prepare salted meat and pork sausage. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 30 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa; vive separada de su pareja, ella es el pilar de su hijo Carlos de 12 años y motivo por quien seguirá trabajando arduamente, viven en una casa alquilada. Nélida es el sostén de su hogar, desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, ahora es campesina y cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y caca, plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 11 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de la mano de los jornaleros  quienes le ofrecen sus servicios en las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los 500 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas.
texts.en: Nelida is 30 years old and she is originally from the district of Santa Rosa. She lives apart from her partner. She is the caretaker of her son Carlos, 12 years old, and he is the reason why she will continue to work arduously. She lives in a rented house. Nelida is the sole support of the household. Since she was a girl her parents taught her how to work in the land. Today she is an agriculturist and she has 2 hectares of land where she cultivates coffee and cocoa, plants that are native to the jungle region of Valle Rio Apurimac. She has been working on her own land for the past 11 years and during the harvest she has help from farm hands who offer their services to help collect the products. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest and its quality is the reward for months of hard work. She considers the most difficult part of her work to be the transportation of her products to the depots located in the city of San Francisco. She is able to get better prices for her products there. The difficulty rests on the fact that she doesn't have enough financial resources to make the advanced payments to the farm hands who help with the harvest. This is the reason why she accesses loans through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). But her priority now is to plant more coffee plants. She has 1 hectare of land that is not currently used. This is her eighth loan through MPF and she feels that this support will help her a great deal to progress in her work. She is very well liked by her colleagues at their communal bank, especially because she is so committed to them. With the 500 nuevos soles she requests she will hire farm hands to help her with the harvest.

loans.use: to hire farm hands to help her with the harvest

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny P. is from the village of Victoria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 46 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle repair services to local community members. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Jenny is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 42 years old. She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Norte. She is married with two children ages 17 and 19. Her source of livelihood is through farming. This has been her business for 10 years now, earning her family PHP 6,000 per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Segundo Fernando

texts.es:
Segundo Fernando tiene 45 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y además se dedica a la albañearía. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas ganadería y mejorar la calidad de vida y que los hijos estudien.

Le gusta leer libros, escuchar música y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Fernando R. M., 45, is married living with his wife and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has four children.

The NUCANCHI KAWSAY communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations:  farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

Segundo is a farmer, raises animals and is also a bricklayer.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales at the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy supplies and animal feed.  Assistance from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are insect infestations, diseases and weather variations.  His dream is to have more cattle, improve quality of life and that his children study.

He enjoys reading books, listening to music and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who sells fruit in the market. She has been running this business for almost two years and has used the profits to build a house. She is married to a construction worker and has five children ranging in age from 8 to 12.  All of the children are in school.
Beatrice will use this loan to buy produce such as bananas, passion fruits, tree tomatoes, and other fruits to sell in the market so she can continue to run a sustainable business. As Beatrice has a large family, she wishes to use the profits from her business to renovate her house and pay for her children’s education in order to improve the overall quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, passion fruits and tree tomatoes.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a retail shop where she sells a variety of fish. She is a new member of HSPFI and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.   Maria Fe has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Maria Fe has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes, eau en bouteille, vins, Afi est mariée à un retraité et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2005 en s’approvisionnant à Lomé et en revendant au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Afi is married to a retiree and is the mother of three children.  She sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bottled water and wine.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She started her business in 2005, gets her supplies in Lomé and sells them at the Hédzranawoé market.  She wants to see her children grow up in prosperous circumstances.

loans.use: To buy pagnes, bottled water and wine

loans.name: Ailaine

texts.en:
Ailaine is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, ages five, 10 and 13. For the past 10 years, she has been a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Ailaine earns about 10,000 PHP every month. 

Ailaine is requesting a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s house.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Nora del Carmen  vive en la ciudad de Managua trabaja en la cuidad.
Es una persona responsable con grandes deseo de superación tanto en su trabajo como en su vida personal
El señor visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y solventar algunos gastos personales. 
Las mejoras que la señora va a realizar es la tapia en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
Agradece a ceprodel por que gracias a los prestamos obtenido en nuestra institución a podido ir mejorando su vivienda
texts.en: Mrs. Nora del Carmen lives in the city of Managua, where she also works.  She is a very responsible person with a great desire to get ahead in both her job and personal life.  She visited our offices to request a loan to pay for home improvement and take care of personal expenses.  The improvement involves putting up a wall behind the house.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans she has received, which have contributed to a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is a 21-year-old single man from Madaba, Jordan. He has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD purchase more products and expand the area of his store. Bashar is looking to add a frozen product sales line to his store and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more products and expand the area of his store

loans.name: Jean Baptiste Diérry

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui cultive le mil, l'arachide  et le sorgho durant l'hivernage.Il entretient son épouse et ses cinq enfants avec cette activité après avoir arrêté la couture qui ne lui rapportait pas assez de revenus.Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il pratique aussi l'élevage en mettant chaque année sur le marché une vache engraissée et bien soignée. Il est membre de l'UIMCEC et sollicite auprès de l'institution un pret de 150000 F pour l'achat d'une vache  et d'un sac d'aliment bétail concentré. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité d'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a farmer who grows millet, groundnut and sorghum during the rainy season. He takes care of his wife and five children with this activity, having abandoned his sewing business which did not bring in enough income for him. In order to improve his family's living conditions, he also raises animals putting a fattened and well-treated cow on the market every year. He is a member of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs from the institution to buy a cow and a sack of concentrated livestock food. His ambition is to expand his beef fattening business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a sack of concentrated livestock food

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow with one child. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Teodora maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as it expands.  

Teodora dreams of growing her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day and finish his studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las Trabajadoras se denomina el grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Señora Verónica, contactó con la asesora para informarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el segundo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común.
La señora Verónica es una D. las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta D. gallinas, comenta que tiene muchos pedidos D. esto. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios D. la casa. Está muy orgullosa D. lo que hace, por lo que quiere seguir con el negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas y alimentos para estas. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
“Las Trabajadoras” (The Women Workers) is the name of a group of women that was established in the city of Ita, thanks to the efforts of the current Director General, Sra. Verónica. She contacted a program consultant to obtain information about the requirements for participating in the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. Once she was advised about the program, she was able to gather 14 women who are now working comfortably together in their second loan cycle. They have worked in a cooperative and unified manner as part of the program. All of them participate in fundraising activities, thereby helping one another reach their common objectives.

Sra. Verónica is one of the members who sells chickens. She says that she gets many requests for her animals. Thanks to her work, she has been able to move her family forward and cover the daily household expenses. Verónica is very proud of what she has accomplished and wants to continue with her business. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and feed for them. Verónica is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Savang (pictured here) and his wife, Sreytouch, have been married since 1974 and have four sons and three daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, three are garment workers and another one is in school. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Savang is a retired policeman. He and his wife now are rice farmers. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Hoi lives with her husband and three daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to make artificial flowers to sell. Hoi started this business seven years ago. 

Hoi would like a loan to buy better quality materials that will help her to make higher quality artifical flowers and enable her to attract more customers. With this investment, she hopes to earn a higher income and be in a position to save to reinvest in her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to make artificial flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She owns a retail shop. She also sells charcoal as an additional source of income. She has been in this business for over ten years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO with which she wants to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a motor van to ease transport costs and become a charcoal supplier at the market. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.ru:
Вазген родился в 1966 году. Он проживает в городе Иджеване (Ijevan). Вазген женат и у него два сына. Жена Вазгена работает медсестрой, младший сын учится в медицинском колледже, а старший - окончил техническое училище. Оба сына Вазгена проффесионально занимаются борьбой и уже достигли определенных успехов.  
7 лет Вазген жил и работал в России, а по возвращении на родину в 2005 году, он основал свой собственный бизнес: купил небольшое помещение и начал торговать мясом. Со временем Вазген развил свой бизнес и кроме торговли мясом, начал брать заказы на изготовление шашлыка и других блюд из мясных продуктов. Благодаря доходу, получаемому от своего мясного магазина, Вазген содержит свою семью и платит за обучение младшего сына. 
Вазгену необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для покупки из соседних деревень мяса для своего бизнеса, а также холодильника для хранения мясных продуктов.
texts.en:
Vazgen was born in 1966. He lives in the town of Ijevan. Vazgen is married and has two sons. His wife works as a nurse, his younger son is studying in the medical school and his older son has graduated from a technical college. Both Vazgen's sons are professional wrestlers and have already achieved certain success. 

Vazgen had lived and worked in Russia for seven years and when he returned to his homeland in 2005 he started his own business. He bought a small space where he started to sell meat. Vazgen has grown his business in time and besides meat selling he also started to take orders to make shashlik (shish kebob) and other kinds of meat dishes. The profits from this business help Vazgen to support his family and pay for the education of his younger son.

Vazgen needs a loan in the amount of 80,000 dram to buy meat for his business from the neighboring villages as well as a refrigerator to store the meat products.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator and meat for his business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42-years-old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two school-age children.

Divina has an iron scrap and plastic business and earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to  purchase  recycled materials  such as plastic and iron scrap materials.

Divina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Divina hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase  recycled materials such as plastic and iron scrap materials.

loans.name: Balbin

texts.en:
Balbin is married with two grown-up children. He is from the village of Carikkikan. Balbin is very dedicated to his work, most especially to his farm business. He has managed a farm for ten years. This is the main source of their income. His spouse helps him manage the farm. 

Balbin is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Balbin is planning to expanding his farm to provide a nice living condition for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, for his farm

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Evangeline has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas to resell.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to resell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 50-years-old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban. Esterlita is married with 5 children. 

Esterlita has a store that sells dried fish. Esterlita has had this business for 5 years. Estelita requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products such as dried fish.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as dried fish.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
Este es el segundo préstamo de Flor, de 49 años, ella es una mujer que tiene dos pequeños hijos, uno de 12 y el menor de 8 añitos, actualmente ella se dedica sola al cuidado y mantención sus pequeños, debido a que por situaciones personales tuvo que separarse de su pareja. Para salir adelante y darle a sus niños siempre una buena calidad de vida, ella se empezó a dedicar a la venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Nazca, famosa por las legendarias Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable jeroglíficos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar algunos abarrotes que le son necesarios, estos están siempre incrementando su precio y es por ello que quiere comprar todo lo que necesita en una sola ocasión a un buen precio, para poder ganar el dinero necesario para el buen cuidado de sus hijitos.
texts.en:
This is the second loan for Flor, age 49. She has two young children, one age 12 and the younger one only 8 years old. She currently dedicates herself alone to the care and support of her little ones, since for personal reasons she had to separate from her partner. To get ahead and always provide her children with a good quality of life, she began to work selling groceries in the city of Nazca. This city is famous for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable hieroglyphics carved into the desert which surrounds the city.
