They are generally attributed to the people of the Nazca culture, who inhabited the region from 300 to 800 AD. Because of this, the city attracts a large number of tourists. However, Nazca is also known for its hard-working people, who have survived in spite of frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high poverty rate in the region. 

With the help of Kiva lenders, Flor will be able to buy some groceries which she needs for her store. The merchandise is always increasing in price, and because of this, she would like to buy what she needs in a single purchase at a good price, so that she can earn the money she needs to take good care of her young children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Cesar  Guadalupe

texts.es: El joven  Cesar es una persona que le gusta vivir cómodamente   por  lo cual  se  esfuerza  día  con día,el se preocupa  por  acondicionar  su  vivienda es  por  ello  que  se  acerco a la  institución porque requiere  pintar las paredes del exterior de su casa ,ve  en el crédito la posibilidad de que  su  vivienda tenga  una  mejor   imagen es por  ello que agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Cesar is a person who likes to live comfortably so he strives daily to fix up his house.  This is why he called on the institution because he wants to paint his house so that it will have a better appearance.  He is grateful for the support provided by the institution for his project.

loans.use: Pintar  paredes del exterior de su casa.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 50-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a father of four children.

Faisal sells accessories and different kind of goods and products. He is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

Faisal is looking to purchase a bus for his business to distribute his products through it.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja, a quien ama y agradece todo el apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Blanca no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer manualidades y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, gracias a los ahorros que  puedo conseguir de trabajos anteriores, Blanca pudo adquirir una mototaxi, la cual alquila a otros choferes para que brinden servicios de transporte, ella trabaja todos los días y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Blanca se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general de su mototaxi, de esta manera ella espera seguir trabajando con su negocio de alquiler de su mototaxi y en poco tiempo espera poder adquirir más vehículos para ampliar su negocio; así pues Blanca seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su negocio de manualidades.
texts.en:
Blanca’s a 33-year-old-woman living in the city of Ica with her spouse who she loves and thanks for all the support provided.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, Blanca was unable to study Nursing because she had to go to work very young to help her parents with household expenses.  She likes making crafts in her free time and sometimes cooks a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication and thanks to savings from jobs she was able to get previously, Blanca was able to acquire a mototaxi that she leases to drivers to provide transportation services.  She works every day and thinks she does well because of the gracious customer service she provides.

Blanca is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to repair and service her mototaxi so that she can continue working leasing it.  She hopes in a short time to be able to acquire more vehicles to expand the business and continue working and striving towards reaching her great dream of having a crafts business.

loans.use: to service her mototaxi.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años, es una pequeña productora de café en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Toda su vida ha estado relacionada a esta actividad junto a su familia, la cual ha venido mejorando y ahora maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.
En los últimos años, su plantación de café ha sido afectada con problemas de antracnosis, lo cual ha disminuido la productividad de su cafetal y con ello los ingresos de su familia. Para mejorar las plantaciones afectadas ella ya está gestionando un crédito, pero además se ha propuesto renovar 0.7 hectáreas de café a fin de contar con una plantación más joven y vigorosa que le permita tener una mayor producción e ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Esta es la principal actividad económica de Carmen y su mayor deseo es poder continuar trabajando en este rubro ya que está segura tiene un gran potencial económico con el cual puede garantizar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old. She is a small producer of coffee in a community in the north of Nicaragua. She has been involved in this activity all her life, along with her family, and it has been improving and now operates under the fair trade certification criteria.
 
In recent years, her coffee plantings have been affected by problems with anthracnose, which has diminished the productivity of her coffee farm and with it her family's income. To improve the affected plantings, she is already managing a loan, but in addition, she has proposed renovating 0.7 hectares of coffee with the aim of having a younger and more vigorous planting that will allow her to have a better production and income to improve the conditions of her family. This is Carmen's principal economic activity, and her greatest wish is to be able to continue working in this area, since it is sure to have great economic potential with which she can guarantee the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to renovate 0.7 hectares of coffee

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en: Edilberto learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Bolibol, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Edilberto feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used to his business. Recently, he availed a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. Edilberto wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for business expansion and diversification.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en: Mubariz has his own store, where he sells foodstuffs. He has run this business for 8 years. In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $600 and built this grocery store. Then he bought foodstuffs and started his business. Before he had difficulties, because he must work a lot of to improve his business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy foodstuffs in order to increase his incomes.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Victorine.

texts.en: Born in 1978, Victorine is a widow with four children. The reality of having to provide to self and children after the death of her husband is her motivation into business. She took here first loan in 2003. With previous loans she has been stitching thorn dresses of community members. With her training in marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans, and available support from group and center members, given a loan of $200, she plans to expand her business by sewing school uniforms. She plans to buy fabrics, threat, needles, pines, paper and starch. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics.

loans.name: Matlubahon

texts.en:
Matlubahon is an experienced specialist in sewing dresses. She has a high education as designer of women's garments. She worked at a school as teacher of handicrafts, but the salary of a teacher is not enough for supporting her family.

She rented a premises for her own workshop. Gradually she bought several sewing machines and employed two assistants. Her business consists of purchasing fabric and making dresses, then selling them in the market. The high quality of their dresses has attracted many clients to her workshop. Presently her workshop is one of the best-known workshops in the area.

Since 2006 she has been a client of Micro Invest. Her first loan was $100. Step by step she increased her loan limit to $1000.Today Matlubahon takes orders from individuals for sewing modern garments for them. She always tries to do her best to satisfy her clients. In future months, Matlubahon wants to sew national autumn dresses from velour fabric. She wants to buy several kind of such fabric and she is requesting $600 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric.

loans.name: Helena Carlos

texts.pt:
Helena is president of the Teka Naha group. The group began in 2006, when she was elected president. The group sells firewood and vegetables for market. The group needs a loan to buy and transport the firewood from the area that it is cut to the market and to buy the vegetables for resale. The group is growing rapidly and they plan to expand the business in the future. All of the group members are women and they are all married and have children. All of their children attend school.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Helena e a presidente do grupo Teka Naha. O grupo foi formado em 2006, tendo ela sido eleita a presidente. O grupo dedica-se a venda de lenha, e horticulas. Assim o grupo precisa do valor do emprestimo para pagar a compra e o transporte de lenha do local do corte ate ao estaleiro e poder comprar horticolas aos produtores para a revenda. O grupo esta a prosperar e pensam no futuro alargar o negocio. Todos os membros sao senhoras e todas elas sao casadas e tem filhos. Os seus filhos estao a estudar.

loans.use: The purchase and transport of merchandise.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Five months ago, this entrepreneur got credits from FMSA and with the funds she started a small business. She sells soups, vegetable oil, seasoning, beans and other goods to prepare food. She has bought a little table which she uses to display the goods she is selling.

After the first five probationary months, which were very gainful for Delfina, the entrepreneur made up her mind to really do business. She has applied for a second loan with the intention of acquiring bigger quantities of goods so that she can increase her sales margins. This loan will allow the 27-year-old entrepreneur to improve many aspects of the business, and she will better provide food and education for her two sons.

loans.use: To buy goods such as vegetable oil, condiments and soups to supply her small business and make it grow.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is 34-year-old woman who has a small shop which sells snacks and some household goods. She usually earns US$5 per day with a small profit. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Neneng requests a loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, a native of the province of Huancane, has lived for seven years in the city of Juliaca. During this time, she has been selling spare parts for three-wheelers and motorcycles, merchandise that she takes to the province of Carabaya - San Gabán for sale. While she has been involved in this work, her husband, René, works at a private business distributing milk. Between the two, they are trying to provide an education to their three small children, who have all responded very well to the sacrifices and struggles of their dear parents. Lida is considering increasing her supply of merchandise to strengthen her business and improve her family's economic situation. To make this project into reality, she is asking for a loan. Lidia greatly appreciates the opportunity that you provide her in making her small business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia natural de la provincia de Huancane, hace siete años viene radicando en la ciudad de Juliaca, tiempo en el que también viene ofertando repuestos de triciclos y motos, mercadería que lleva para su comercialización a la provincia de Carabaya - San Gabán, mientras ella se desenvuelve en esta labor su esposo, René, trabaja en una empresa privada de distribución de leche, entre los dos tratan de ofrecerles educación a sus tres menores hijos quienes responden muy bien a cada uno de los sacrificios y esfuerzos de sus queridos padres.Lidia considera que aumentando el volumen de mercadería fortalecerá su negocio y por ende mejorará su situación económica familiar, para concretar su proyecto solicita obtener un préstamo.Lidia agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para acrecentar su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Cash to consolidate her small bike parts store.

loans.name: Haraf

texts.en:
Haraf G. H. lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 children. He has had a retail shop for the last four years. Mr. G. H. has been selling groceries and he has a good number of customers.

He is planning to take an individual loan to increase his inventory and expand his business so as to make a good monthly income to help his family and to be able to pay back the loan. He is happy.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou Mang is a 38 year-old mother and has been member of the Hathioume village bank in Ziguinchor for the past six and a half years. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. She buys cans of palm oil, lemons and brooms which she then resells. The income from the sales make it possible for her to help with the family's needs. Fatou is requesting a loan which will be refunded in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou M., 38 ans, mère de famille est membre du banc villageois de Hathioume à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie et a toujours respecté ses engagements.Elle achète des bidons d'huile de palme, de citron et des balaies qu'elle revend. Les revenus tirés du commerce permettent d'aider à l'entretien de la famille. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of lemons, palm oil and brooms

loans.name: Asha's Majengo North Group

texts.en:
Asha is 26 years old and is married with 1 child, age 2. Asha is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Rehema, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing in bulk to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia B. sells clothing that she sews, as well as rice and soup. She is single and her income is not sufficient for her and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is requesting a loan of $400 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny lives in his parents' home in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of La Paz. He earns a living making chompas, which are traditional sweaters. He is 34 years old and works alone, and is able to afford necessities from his business. He's requesting a loan to purchase a mechanical loom, which will help him produce higher-quality products and thus be able to reach a larger market. This is his first loan, but his background qualifies him as a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El señor Johnny vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la confección de chompas. Johnny tiene 34 año de edad esta soltero con esta actividad él mantiene sus necesidades de subsistencia tanto de alimentación y ropa. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina vaporizadora con la cual podrá dar mayor calidad a las chompas que elabora y así poder alcanzar un mercado mas amplio. No tiene crédito con nosotros es nuevo pero el análisis socio-financiero lo califica para obtener un crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical loom to produce higher-quality chompas (traditional sweaters) / Compra de una máquina vaporizadora para dar mayor calidad a su negocio de confección de chompas.

loans.name: Maria's Glory Group

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with one child, aged 2 years old. She is a clothes seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US140 from her sales.

Maria now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Eliatikiswa, who also has a shop of her own.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Джармуратова Гавхар жительница района Дж.Руми.Возраст 27 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Клиентка на местном рынке района имеет торговую точку ,на которой торгует  детской одеждой. Она покупает у оптовых поставщиков  товар и реализует его в розницу. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода ее семьи.В данный мрмент клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду.Поэтому решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gavhar J. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 27 years old, is married and has 5 children. Gavhar has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market, where she sells children’s clothing. She purchases products from wholesalers and resells them at retail prices. This business is the main source of income for her family. Gavhar would like to purchase seasonal clothing for sale. She has decided to take out a 12 month loan in order to do this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita dependía del dinero que su marido llevara a la casa, ante la necesidad de ver que en ocasiones no les alcanzaba decidió comenzar a vender plata para tener una entrada extra de dinero, primero con los mismos clientes de su marido quien vende frutas y verduras; al ver lo bien que le estaba yendo se decidió comenzar a hacerlo ya como negocio y es así como desde hace 2 años ella apoya la economía de su hogar con los ingresos de su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para tener mayor variedad de mercancía y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita depended on the money that her husband was taking home. After seeing that sometimes it wasn't enough, she decided to started selling silver jewerly in order to have extra money. She was first selling to the same clients of her husband who sells fruit and vegetables. After realizing she was doing well, she decided to do this as a business. This is how she has been helping to support her family's economy with the income of her business for the past 2 years.

She needs a loan of $150, which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, to have a bigger variety and be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon S.  is 30 years old. He is married and the father of two children. Alijon has been selling curtains for eight years already and has gained a rich experience in this kind of business. 

Initially Alijon started with selling children’s clothing with US$ 100 as working capital. Gradually he expanded his business and decided to sell curtains as there are few competitors in this kind of business. He has good taste in choosing curtains while purchasing them which allows him to have a good clientele.

Alijon wants to continue growing his business to improve his quality of life and guarantee the success of his children. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) which he will use to buy merchandise and offer products more rapidly as well as to fill his pending orders. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Alijon and his family thank you very much for helping them succeed.

loans.use: New modern curtains for re-sale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
In Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Marilyn L. is running a good pottery business. She is married with 4 children; 3 are already working and one is still in college. Marilyn has never focused only on pottery; she wants to try another business for additional income. She is considering a fishing business. Aside from fishing, she has embraced the idea of fishnet making and buying and selling "lahoy" (shark). She believes these businesses will supplement her living.

Just like pottery, the other businesses are also fragile. They are so delicate that Marilyn makes it a point to handle them with much care. One wrong move will surely bring the business down. But she is thankful to Paglaum MPC for helping her out, not only with capital but also with training in micro-entrepreneurship. This PHP 20,000 she has applied for will be used for the repair of their sailboat and purchase of additional fishing accessories.

She hopes to help the community by employing someone to help them with fishing. She makes a priority of saving for old age and she desires for her businesses to grow and flourish.

loans.use: For sailboat repair and purchase of additional fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
El Señor de nombre José Gabriel P. L. tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es soltero, este Señor tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 1 de sus hijos depende de el y tiene la edad de 21 años y cursa recientemente el 5 año de su carrera mercadotecnia, en sus deseos son lograr que su hijo supere su nivel educacional para que el día de mañana se un gran profesional en su carrera, sus propósitos son de darle mejoras a su taller ya que este es su lugar de trabajo por lo que es necesario efectuarle mejoras para proporcionar comodidad y calidad a sus clientes además esta el acondicionar a si vivienda para el bienestar propio y de su familia.


Su actividad económica es la de soldador, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto  Julián reyes ½ cuadra arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 30 años, el inicio este negocio por cuenta propia decide aprender este oficio en un taller llamado
Alonso a la edad de 15 años y es aquí donde encuentra su medio de trabajo y a la edad de 20 años decide instalar su propio negocio y obtiene a sus clientes por amigos y vecinos que sabían que trabaja a la perfección, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo asignado para la compra de herramientas que son necesarias para su taller como lo son: compresor, portapower, emeril ya que tiene que realizar la compra de estas en lugar donde resulten mas favorable y sus clientes se muestren satisfechos con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Señor José Gabriel P. L. is 57 and single. He has 8 children, of whom only one is still his dependent. This son is 21 and is in his fifth year of studying marketing. One of his dreams is to see his son increase his level of education so one day he will be a great professional. His goals are to make some improvements to his workshop since it is necessary to give better comfort and quality to his customers. He would also like to fix up his house for his own well-being and that of his family. He is a welder, and his business is located in the Julián Reyes neighborhood half a block up the road. He has owned this business for 30 years. He started it with his own funds when he decided to learn the welding trade. His workshop is called Alonso. When he was 15, he found his line of work, and at age 20, he decided to start his own business. He made his friends and neighbors his customers, who knew that he works for perfection. This financing will be used for working capital to purchase tools he needs for his workshop such as a compressor and a Porta Power kit. He needs to purchase these things so he will have favorable results and so his customers will be satistified with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Алламуродов Абдуло житель города Турсунзаде .Возраст 30 лет, женат ,имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент работает таксистом,так же занимается выращиванием пшеницы.Так как мука  на рынке стоит намного дороже. На полученный кредит Абдулло планирует закупить минеральные удобрения для хорошего урожая.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo A. is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary school education and drives a taxi. Abdullo also raises wheat because flour is much more expensive at the market. With this loan Abdullo plans to purchase mineral fertilizer to increase his harvest. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness E. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana, married with two sons named Alexander and Konstantin, has been operating a small clothing sales business for several years, earning an income of about 2,000 UAH per month. Hard working and honest, Oksana always repays money on time and believes that honesty and integrity are always rewarded. She would now like to borrow 1,500 UAH to fix her apartment.

loans.use: To fix her apartment.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Кенджаев Исмоилджон проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Уже 10 лет занимается услугой такси. Имеет свой автомобиль , которы и использует в качестве такси. Работает по маршруту Шахринау-Душанбе. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить запчасти для автомашины. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon K. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has been in the taxi service business for 10 years. He owns a car that he utilizes as a taxi. He works on the Shahrinav-Dushanbe route. Ismoiljon plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase auto parts for his car. He can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад - мужчина 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. Ахмад занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается домашней работой. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Ахмад хочет увеличить количество своего скота, чтобы получить большей прибыли.
texts.en:
Ahmad is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has four children. Ahmad raises and sells large and small-horned cattle. He buys his livestock at the market, fattens them for two to three months, then sells them at the same market. His wife is a housewife, working alongside her husband to improve the family's financial well-being. Ahmad wants to increase the size of his herd in order to increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Asuru A Angucia Gloria Group

texts.en: Gloria A. , 42, is married with two children, a boy and a girl.  They live with 12 dependent who go to school. She has been selling produce for over 11 years.  Gloria is using the loan to purchase beans, millet, sorghum, maize, simsim and ground nuts.  Her dream is to educate her dependents, build a good home and uplift her community.

loans.use: Purchase produce

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with four children and she is 36 years old. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 34 años, su principal motivación son sus tres hijos y sus padres, con quienes vive, ya que debido al abandono de su pareja atravesó diversas dificultades que sólo supo afrontar con el apoyo de su familia. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversas actividades, pero desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante en el mercado de su distrito, lugar que es muy concurrido, pero donde también hay más delincuencia, por lo cual trata siempre de tomar las precauciones necesarias. Además, vender en la puerta de los mercados no es tarea fácil, ya que tiene que instalar su carpa desde muy tempranas horas, debido a que las personas visitan los mercados generalmente por la mañana y vende hasta las tres de la tarde para después regresar a casa para atender a sus hijos. El deseo de Carmen es comprar un puesto dentro del mercado para dejar de exponerse al peligro, tener mayor seguridad y estabilidad económica en su negocio. Los años que lleva trabajando en su banco comunal le dieron la oportunidad de crecer económicamente, y este cuarto crédito la ayudará a mejorar y la posibilidad de seguir trabajando con sus compañeras, con quienes tiene muchos proyectos para realizar en su grupo, como organización. Con los 1800 soles que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de mercadería en prendas para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old. She is mainly motivated by her three sons and her parents, with whom she lives. Being abandoned by her partner has caused her to go through various difficulties which she could only face with the help of her family. Since being very young she has worked in various fields, but for the last seven years she has worked selling clothing, moving about in her district market - a place that is very crowded but that also has more delinquency, which is why she always tries to take the necessary precautions. Moreover, selling in the entrance to the markets is not an easy task since she has to set up her awning very early because people generally visit the market in the morning. She sells until 3:00 in the afternoon and after that returns home to take care of her children. Carmen's wish is to buy a stall inside the market so she can stop exposing herself to the danger, have better security, and have economic stability in her business. The years that she has working in her community bank have given her the opportunity to grow economically and this fourth loan will help her to improve and provide the possibility to continue working with her companions with whom she has many projects to carry out as a group, such as organization. With the 1800 soles that she is requesting she will acquire a larger quantity of clothing merchandise for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Bayarsayhan

texts.en:
Bayarsayhan S. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two children are both high school students. Bayarsayhan has a small retail business selling women's and men's clothing. He sells various women's and men's clothes imported from China at the stall that he rents in the local market. He usually purchases clothes for his business from Ereen, China, a border town where many cheap Chinese products are imported to Mongolia.

Depending on the monthly sale amount, he travels to Ereen, China, once or twice a month to bring back clothes for his business. While he is away in Ereen, his wife helps in his business as a saleswoman at his stall in the market. In the future, he hopes to open a large shop for various apparel.

Bayarsayhan also says that he hopes to start saving some money from his business's profit for his children's future education. His dream is to see his two children receive a good education and pursue their dreams. He is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel for resale

loans.name: 23 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "23 D. Diciembre" estan representadas por la señora Yaneth y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales presentan un nexo consanguíneo entre la señora Yaneth y su hija Lizeth ambas con ingresos y actividades independientes. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yaneth represents the 23 D. Diciembre Community Bank, which is comprised of 12 members. Two of the members are related, Yaneth and her daughter, Lizbeth. They have separate activities and incomes. The competition in the business arena is pretty high, but their dedication and their desire to work prevail over the competition. The loan is to acquire merchandise, supplies, and materials to expand their sales locations, which will allow them to generate better income to give their families a better quality of life. The members of the group generally have experience thanks to loans with entities similar to the Foundation Agrocapital. Hence, they know the way to work, how to be responsible, and the commitment that is required to receive a loan for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a widow who lives happily together with her family in the village of Siempre Viva Sur in Mallig, Isabela. Delia is a type of person who never gives up in achieving her dreams in life. She patiently maintains her hog-raising business to further develop a good business and become successful somehow. She is requesting to borrow from Kiva as additional business capital. Delia is hoping to give her children a better future by sustaining her current business and eventually getting into other types of businesses that would be of great help to her family.

Moreover, Delia is blessed with four children as the fruit of her love with her husband. Now, their two children already has their own jobs at the moment, though they are not college graduates, while two of them have successfully finished their college education through her hard work and patience in her hog raising. She was glad that since the death of her husband due to vehicle accident, she has successfully given her children with better living opportunities. Because of her dream to become a successful entrepreneur, she is requesting the assistance of Kiva loans.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is forty – nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Patricia is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for twenty years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad en el centro poblado menor Villa el Sol, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años ella tiene una bodega - tienda en la que vende artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y verduras, este negocio ha sido la única fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar durante estos años.

El tiempo durante el cual ha mantenido su negocio le han valido para hacerse conocida entre sus vecinos los que siempre acuden a ella para comprarle sus productos ya que la zona en la que viven está alejada del mercado, su hijo la ayuda todos los días y juntos tratan de salir adelante trabajando con esmero.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio e implementar su tienda con mas variedad de artículos, por este motivo ella está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Esta es la tercera vez que Basilia trabaja con nosotros, su responsabilidad y puntualidad la ha hecho ser considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Basilia is 45 years old, a single mother, and lives with her 28 year old son in the suburb Villa el Sol, in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 20 years she has been running a grocery store, where she sells essential items (rice, sugar,oil), groceries and vegetables. This business has been her family's only source of income during these years. In the time that she has had her business, she has become well known among her neighbors who always come to her to buy her products since the area in which they live is far from the market. Her son helps her every day and together they try to get ahead working with care. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her business and set up a store with more variety of items. This is the reason for her request of a loan of 2000 new soles from our institution. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of more products which she can provide to her customers. This is the third time that Basilia works with us. Due to her responsibility and punctuality, she is considered an excellent customer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mr. Norn Y. is a villager in Trapaing Khlout village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Khuong Mun, is a grocer. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family living. In order to improve the family living, Mr. Norn Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a car and be a taxi driver. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a car to be a taxi driver.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira P. D. A. resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán dentro del municipio D. Cojutepeque. Yanira tiene 62 años D. edad, vive solamente con su hija D. 11 años D. edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Yanira es una mujer muy fuerte y luchadora, a través D. su negocio sostiene los gastos del hogar y su hija, Yanira tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa usada, las ventas son diarias con una clientela estable, por estar en una zona con mucha afluencia, ahora ella solicita D. un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. invertir en su negocio con mayor cantidad D. ropa para ofrecer a su clientes.
texts.en:
Yanira P. D. A. lives in the town of Cojutepeque that lies in the department of Cuscatlán. She is 62 years old and lives with her 11 year old daughter who is a student. Yanira is a strong woman with a fighting spirit. She maintains a secondhand clothing business in order to generate income for her household expenses and to support her daughter. She has a stable clientele who live in an affluent area and purchase from her on a daily basis.

Yanira is requesting a loan so that she can acquire a large quantity of clothing to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with additional inventory

loans.name: Lieng Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lieng Sim S. lives in Ang Svay Chek village in Takeo province. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children aged two and five years old.

Lieng Sim and her husband, Mr. Ur Peng Leom (see photo), breed pigs at her house. Since this business is going so well, she would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan through Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea (AMK) to buy more piglets.

loans.use: To buy more piglets.

loans.name: G. Véronique

texts.fr: K. G. Véronique est née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ANAGO Josia, un revendeur, Véronique est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. C’est depuis douze ans que Véronique vit dans le quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou avec son mari et ses enfants. Véronique vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Véronique n’a pas été à l’école. C’est pourquoi depuis onze ans, Véronique vend à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, des bois de chauffage. Véronique exerce comme activité secondaire, la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, etc.). C’est à Adja au Mono et à Ekpè, sur la route de Porto-Novo (capitale administrative du Bénin) que Véronique s’approvisionne. Véronique est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d’agrandir davantage son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, Véronique sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. G. Véronique was born in 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to ANAGO Josia, a retailer, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  For twelve years, she has been living in the Kpondéhou district in Cotonou with her husband and children.  She works in aid of her husband to meet family expenses.  Véronique has not been to school.  That's why, for eleven years, she has been selling firewood at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Her secondary business involves selling sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, etc.)  She gets her supplies in Adja in Mono and in Ekpè, on the road to Porto-Novo (the administrative capital of Benin).  Véronique is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  With the aim of expanding her business further and growing her customer base, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood wholesale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George N. is from  Linao Norte Tuguegarao, City. He is 32 years old. George is married and has an infant child. To make a living, George operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. George has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. George is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by George from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Sapakamapie Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Sapakamapie' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their businesses. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, make more sales, earn better profit, and consequently improve the living standards of their families.

Salaymatu B. on the left of the photo is the leader of this group. Salaymatu was born in Magburaka town thirty-two years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

Salaymatu sells fried chicken and foofoo (cooked food made out of ground cassava). Salaymatu has been in this business for more than ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a carton of chicken and a bag of foofoo.

loans.use: Buy a carton of chicken and a bag of foofoo

loans.name: Nancy Elsa

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Nancy es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa de ciudad de Pichari en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, a donde viaja una vez por semana, también vende ropa a pedido.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank "Morenita II." She is married, 33 years old, and has 4 children. Nancy has a store in her house where she sells groceries and fresh vegetables from the city of Pichari, where she travels once a month. She also sells clothing on order. She needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Nancy dreams of improving her business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Neris Clarisa

texts.es:
Neris V. de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y ladrillos tiene tan solo como servicios básicos agua y luz, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9, 4 todos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Neris comenzó trabajando con su mama, aprendió todo con respecto a la costura, después de un tiempo pudo comprarse una pequeña maquina de coser.

Ahora ella trabaja de lunes a viernes sola desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer confeccionando camisas, pantalones etc. Otra de las actividades que ella hace para tener otro ingreso extra es ser enfermera. Una de las complicaciones que ella tiene es darse tiempo para las dos actividades que realiza.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y otra parte para comprar techo para su casa. En el futuro quiere dedicarse solo a ser modista con un local propio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Neris V., 37, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of bricks and cement; its only utilities are water and electricity. She is a single mother of three children, who are 12, 9 and 4 years old; all the children are enrolled in the local public school. Neris began learning everything about clothes making from her mother. Eventually she was able to buy her own sewing machine. Now, she works Monday through Friday, from early in the morning until late at night, sewing shirts, pants, etc. To earn extra income, she also works as a nurse. One of the complications she faces is finding enough time for both activities. She will use part of the funding to buy fabric and part to buy roofing for her house. In the future she would like to be able to just be a seamstress with her own shop and to be able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and roofing.

loans.name: Nicole Aman

texts.fr: A. Nicole Aman est née le 16 Avril 1963 à Ouidah, une ville historique du Bénin. Il y a environs 19 ans que Nicole Aman s'est installée à Gbodjè dans la communne d'Abomey Calavi. Mariée à SOUSSIA Jonas, un maçon, Nicole Aman est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Nicole Aman vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Nicole Aman n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Nicole Aman vend depuis une dizaine d'année, du maïs (en gros et en détail) à son domicile. Nicole Aman achète ses produits à Parakou au Nord du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle se fait de plus en plus nombreuse, et Nicole Aman n'arrive plus à la satisfaire, compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu, Nicole Aman sollicite pour la première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Nicole Aman was born on April 16, 1963 in Ouidah, a historic village in Benin. About nineteen years ago, she settled in Gbodjè in the town of Abomey Calavi. Married to SOUSSIA Jonas, a mason, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Nicole Aman attended primary school only. To cover the different expenses incumbent upon her, she has sold corn (wholesale and retail) out of her home for about ten years. She buys her goods in Parakou in northern Benin. The demands of her customers are increasing more and more, and she is no longer able to satisfy them, given the few financial means she has at her disposal. To satisfy her customers and to have more income, she's requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying eight 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Khudayberdieva Asalhan`s Group

texts.en: Asalhan is the founder of this group. She actively participates in the local community. Although she is a 63 years old, she still works as a teacher in the village school. All three of her children work in Russia. They send about USD120 per month to their parents. Apart from this, they fatten cattle at home and sell milk products. This loan will be used for three things: to buy a calf to send to pasture, to buy seed potatoes and to repair her house. Salamat is 49 years old. She and her husband are farmers. They have their own land where they grow rice, cotton and potatoes. She also sells milk and eggs in the local market. Her two sons work in Russia and regularly send money to support their parents. The loan will be used to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. A. Jypargul, 35, is married with three school-aged children. She works with her husband. Last autumn they sowed winter wheat. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer for wheat. She also has one milk cow. She has been working in this business since 2005. Burul is the treasurer of this group. She is responsible for paying back the loan on time. She collects the money from the other group members and comes to the MBF office. She is married with 3 sons and 1 daughter. The eldest son is 28 years old and the only daughter is 18. They have land where they raise vegetables. In the future she wants to increase her livestock and build a suitable yard for her animals. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of tje 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please click here. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf and seed potatoes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema O. B. is a married woman and a small-business entrepreneur. She prepares and sells cooked and fried food to customers at Mchikichini in Kariakoo market shopping center. She provides these services to customers as a food vender.

Rehema’s business requirements are purchased from the city market shopping center. She has been in the business for six years and managed to meet her daily family needs and her business capitalization from the business income.

Rehema needs a loan of Tsh 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas J. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five adult children.

Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling vinegar, soy sauce, oil, vegetables and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Camino A Jerico Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Camino a Jerico con domicilio colonia morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es constituido con el fin de solicitar un prestamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo para inversion de sus negocios. son tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

 
El señor Faustino I. M. tiene de 58 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo que depende de el, los otros hijos estan en los estados unidos,  Faustino se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia que instalo en su casa de habitacioon, ademas destaza cerdos los fines de semana. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para su pulperia.

la señora Luz Idalia R. tiene de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos que estan estudiando y le ayudan en la casa con la limpieza mientras ella sale ha vender ropa y carne en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo,  el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior. Su deseo es que sus hijos se graduen del colegio.

doña Clisanta E. B. tiene 61 años de edad es viuda, dependen de ella dos hijos. tiene nietos.
Clisanta vende ropa usada y con una hija tambien tienen una pequeña pulperia. El credito lo utilizara para comprar un fardo de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The solidary group "Camino a Jerico", located in "colonia morazan" of the town of San Lorenzo has been established with the purpose of requesting a loan to be spent as work capital for business investment. It has three members, two women and a man. Below is the description of their activities.´

Mr. Faustino I. M. is 58 years old, single and has 1 son who depends on him, his other children are in the U.S.A. Faustino has a general store set up at his house and he also cuts pigs in pieces on the week-ends. The loan will be spent to buy merchandise for his general store.

Mrs. Luz Idalia R. is 49 years old, a single mother of two students who helps her with the chores while she goes out to sell clothes and meat in the neighborhoods of san lorenzo. The loan will be spent to buy underwear. It is her wish that her children graduate from school.

Doña Clisanta E. B. is 61 years old, a widow and two children depend on her. She has grandchildren. Clisanta sells second-hand garments and she also runs a small grocery stores with one of her daughters. The loan will be spent to buy a bundle of used clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, meat, vegetables, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, candles, cooking oil, coffee, bread, etc.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
W. Aisha is a good-humored widow with one child in secondary school. After her husband’s demise, she found herself at a hard crossroads. She had to go to any length to conjure up a way of making her family’s ends meet on the little money her husband had left as savings.

The turn in her tide occurred when Aisha began her cosmetics sales business eight years ago in Mpigi church center. Her good hospitality has been her winning recourse and she makes 120,000 shillings a month.

Aisha’s dream is to solidify and expand her business. She also wants to see to it that her child studies up to the university level. With this loan she wants to be in a position to buy more cosmetics for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics like creams and body lotions for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of plastic kitchenware

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Casimira, 55, is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo (Success with Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Casimira’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure.

Casimira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a cafeteria by purchasing cups, flour, bread and a toaster.

Casimira will use her profits to save toward her dream of opening a small general store in her home, which would give her two stable incomes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy cups, bread, flour and a toaster

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito M. Jr. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Juanito is single. Juanito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Juanito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 7,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Juanito is now requesting his fourth loan from HSPFI, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to expand the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy desprendida y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles y verduras en general. En un inicio vendía estos productos, hoy prepara y vende especias, condimentos y salsas, de esa manera sus ganancias aumentan. Su bodega se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño espacio dentro de su domicilio, donde atiende calidamente a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz, por el negocio que realiza, ya que le permite cuidar a sus hijos. Sin embargo el tener que adquirir la mercadería necesaria, tiene que subir la pesada carga cuesta arriba donde queda su casa. Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa con material noble y ampliar su bodega y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, además se siente a gusto trabajar con sus compañeras de grupo.Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería comestible, de ese modo podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximina is 38 years old and is a very generous and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. More than five years ago, she began selling grocery products and vegetables. She began by selling these products; now she prepares and sells spices, condiments, and salsas, and thus her earnings have increased. Her store is located in a small space within her home, where she warmly serves her customers. She is very happy with her business, given that it allows her to take care of her children. However, acquiring the goods she needs requires her to carry the heavy load uphill to her house. Her greatest desire is to construct her house with durable materials and extend her store, thus improving her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP, and she knows that this contribution will be very beneficial for increasing her working capital. She is committed to making all payments on her loan, and she also enjoys working with her colleagues in the group. She will invest the requested loan in purchasing groceries and will thus be able to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more product to supply her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: El señor Rigoberto se encarga de un negocio de abarrotes, y pasa la mayor parte del día atendiéndolo. Su esposa tambien trabaja y al salir ella de su empleo le ayuda a su esposo a atender el negocio, son una pareja muy unida y se esfuerzan por tener un buen hogar. Ellos requieren de colocar una barda en la parte del frente de la vivienda, ya que como ellos no están prácticamente en todo el día, temen por la seguridad de su hogar, por que no cuentan con alguna protección. Es un matrimonio joven pero con muchas ganas de formar un patrimonio y tener una mejor calidad de vida para cuando lleguen los hijos que ya planean.
texts.en:
Rigoberto runs a grocery business and spends most of the day taking care of it. His wife also has a job and then helps her husband with the business once she has finished work. They are very united couple who work hard to have a good home. They need to put up a wall at the front of their house, because they are out for most of the day and they fear their home may not be safe because it is not protected. They are a young married couple who really wish to build up their wealth and have a better quality of life in time for the arrival of the children they are already planning to have.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of a wall at the front of their house.

loans.name: Jon-Jon

texts.en:
Jon-jon T. is from the village of Rizal. He is 34 years old. Jon-jon is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jon-jon owns & operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Jon-jon has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jon-jon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jon-jon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Jon-jon is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jon-jon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Bricelda

texts.en: Bricelda G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children ages seven and three. To make a living, Bricelda collects seaweed and sells it in the market. Bricelda has been engaged in seaweed farming for over 2 years now. She also recently started making and selling food items, and she would like to purchase more ingredients for making food. Bricelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bricelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now requests her second loan, for 6000 PHP, to further grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
Ni Made D. P.  is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Made is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Mekar Sandat (PK-10301).

Ni Made is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Made owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Made has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Made is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK in the amount of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Made plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Made D. P. (0) merupakan 37 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Mekar Sandat (PK-10301).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Made meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam P. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Mariam is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mariam owns & operates a business providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Mariam has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mariam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariam is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mariam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Eva Joy

texts.en:
Eva Joy P. is from the village of Cobungan, Sinian, Balinagao. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Eva Joy owns and operates a farming business, producing rice to sell. Eva Joy has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP a month from it. In 2007, Eva Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Eva Joy from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Ricchariy Llaqta Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “RICCHARIY LLAQTA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la comunidad D. Choquecancha, distrito D. Lares, provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santos ;   El socio  es casado  y tiene 3 hijos , El socio se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados, el socio también ahora es el nuevo regidor D. la comunidad, el entro junto a sus partido en las últimas selecciones, El socio continuará con sus tradicional trabajo D. compra y venta D. ganados. El socio requiere el crédito para invertir en su nueva compra D. ganados y aumentará a un dinero que tiene ahorrado. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ganados.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos  se dedican a diferentes labores como por ejemplo a la compra y venta D. ganados, a la agricultura, a la venta D. maíz, papa, morralla, chuño entre otros productos agrícolas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the  “RICCHARIY LLAQTA” village bank, located in the community of Choquecancha, District of Lares, Calca Province, in the Department of Cusco.  

His name is Santos.  He's married and has three children.  He earns his living buying and selling cattle.  He's also his community's new Adviser, having entered with his party into the last elections.  He will continue buying and selling cattle.  He needs a loan to invest in some new cows, for which he'll add in some of his own savings.  

The other members alternate their home activities with their retail businesses.  They work at different jobs, including, for example, buying and selling cattle, in agriculture, corn sales, potatoes, fish, potato flour, and other agricultural products.

Santos appreciates and values the loan he will receive here, and promises accordingly to make all his payments in full and on time.

loans.use: He is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina E. is a 52-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 4 business ventures:   salt, shrimp paste, frozen foods, and fishing businesses.   

She lives in Purok Okra, Brgy. Palaka Sur, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.   She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her salt, shrimp paste, frozen foods and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Rizalina is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can purchase 40 sacks of salt and 4 sacks of shrimp paste to expand her businesses.  This will be her 23rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Rizalina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase salt and shrimp paste to expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
Miguel Arcangel L. L.  tiene 43 años. Vive con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Miguel Arcangel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse mas.

Le gusta pasear y colaborar con el trabajo en equipo
texts.en:
Miguel Arcangel L. L. is 43 years old.  He lives with his five children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Vall Paraíso' community bank is located two hours from the Chillanes regional office, in Chillanes canton.  This group works in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Miguel Arcangel has been growing cacao for 2 years.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells them in Chillanes market and in the same district.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing cacao.  The loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces a number of challenges such as insect infestations and diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to work harder.

Miguel Arcangel likes to take walks and take part in team work.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing cacao

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
