Josephine M. is 52 years old and sells clothes in the Kwa Njenga Estate which is well-populated with many customers. She has been running this business for a period of 3 years and her monthly profit is 15,000 Kenyan shillings. She is a widowed mother of five sons, all of whom are over 18 years of age. She describes herself as hard-working and persistent. 

She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of 15,000 shillings is her first with KADET and she plans to use it to buy children’s clothes and shoes to sell during the Christmas holiday. If the loan boosts her business, Josephine will expand by introducing new shoes, since she currently sells only second-hand shoes.

Josephine dreams of sending her youngest son Wilson to study at a university.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes and shoes to sell during the Chrismas holiday.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She has owned a grocery store since 2000. Sonia is requesting her first loan from Al Majmoua  in order to add new products to her business. Sonia is a honest, hard worker and loved by most of her clients and friends. Sonia’s dream is to open a supermarket in the future. Her clients are most of her friends, relatives, neighbors, and passers-by.

loans.use: To add new products

loans.name: Virgilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La pulpa de tamarindo es uno de los productos típicos de Santa Fe de Antioquia, municipio ubicado al Occidente de Antioquia, lugar de donde es oriunda Virgilia del Rosario S. B., quien desde pequeña al lado de su madrea aprendió a elaborar las pulpas. 

Actualmente, Virgilia no sólo vende pulpa de tamarindo, sino también, panelitas de coco, pues descubrió que así tiene mayores ventas y puede aportar en mayor medida a cubrir los gastos de su hogar, los cuales comparte con su esposo. 

Debido a que la cosecha de tamarindo sólo se da al iniciar el año, Virgilia necesita proveerse de dicho producto para realizar las pulpas el resto del año, lo que le permitirá garantizar la venta de su producto.
texts.en:
Tamarind pulp is one of the typical products of Santa Fe de Antioquia, a town located to the west of Antioquia. Virgilia del Rosario S. B. lives here; as a child she learned from her mother to make tamarind pulp.

Today, Virgilia sells not only tamarind pulp, but also coconut panelitas (brown sugar loafs). She discovered that thus she could increase her sales and contribute more to household expenses, which she shares with her husband.

Since tamarind is harvested only at the beginning of the year, Virgilia needs to buy now that ingredient for her pulps for the rest of the year, ensuring the sale of her product.

loans.use: To buy tamarind, an ingredient to her product

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ferdinad; el tiene 32 años de edad, separado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a su negocio de imprenta el realiza todo tipo de tarjetas para los diferentes compromisos que suelen haber como fiestas de 15 años, matrimonios, bautizos entre otros mas, a la vez el socio es diseñador grafico esto le facilita el trabajo, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio el sale a delante y apoya a su hijo.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su imprenta como cientos de papeles,diferentes tipos de cartulinas entre otros mas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pachapaccari" community bank located in Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. His name is Ferdinand; he is 23 years old, has one child and is separated from his wife. Ferdinand runs a printing press that specializes in printing invitations for various celebrations, such as fiesta quinceañera (celebration of a girl's 15th birthday in parts of Latin America), weddings, and baptisms.

Ferdinand is also a graphic designer, which helps him in his work. The printing press is his only business at the moment, and Ferdinand is happy that he is able to support himself and his son with the income from his business. He is requesting a loan to buy different types of card stock, and other materials so that he will be able to handle high volume print jobs. He is happy to have this loan opportunity and is committed to making his loan payments on time.

loans.use: To set up printing business for high volume print jobs and to purchase different types of card stock, etc.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace Y. is from the village of North Mapang, Rizal. She is 46 years old. Mary Grace is a widow and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies to sell. She has been operating her business for 5 years and earns a monthly net income of 2300 PHP.

In 2008, Mary Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for her business. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Grace from PMPC.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Faïmaguebé

texts.fr: Dame  Faïmoguebé   est  mariée  avec  2 enfants   à  charge.   Elle   fait   le  commerce  de  céréales.  Elle  compte  15  ans   dans  cette  activité  et  s’approvisionne     au  Nord  du Togo à  Dapaong.  Après, elle  revend  au  marché  local  de Hedzranawoé.   Elle  sollicite un  crédit  pour  acheter  5 sacs  de maïs,  3  sacs  d’haricot,  2 sacs  de mil  et 2 sacs de sorgho.
texts.en: Faïmaguebé is married with two children in her care. She trades in cereals. She has 15 years experience of this business and gets her supplies in Dapaong in the north of Togo. Afterwards she resells her products at the local market in Hedzranawoé. She is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of corn, three sacks of beans, two sacks of millet and two sacks of sorghum.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad.  Ella es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos.  La señora realizó estudios de educación primaria. 
Sonia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de productos de panadería.
Este préstamo de S/.  2300.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 30 quintales de harina para la producción del pan.  Nos cuenta que cada día elabora dos quintales de harina.  Ella recibe la ayuda de su esposo, con quien también hace chacra como papa, habas y maíz.
Su sueño es mejorar en el negocio para tener buenos ingresos económicos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Luján" (Our Lady of Luján) located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno. She is 34 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of five children. She has completed elementary school education.

She has been working with the microfinance institution Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan amounted to 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. She is a baker. Currently she applies for a new loan of 2,300 nuevos soles which she will use to buy 30 quintals (about 1,350 kilograms or 3,000 pounds) of flour for bread-making. Every day she uses up 2 quintals of flour (about 90 kilograms or 200 pounds) in her bakery. Her husband helps her. They work also at their farm, harvesting potatoes, beans and corn.

Her dream is to improve her business and earn a good income. What she likes about her communal bank are the earnings from her savings.

loans.use: to buy flour for bread-making

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 63 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que empezó su actividad en la venta de comida antes trabajaba en una cooperación militar desde ahí se hizo independiente.

Ahora tiene su puesto de comida y trabaja diariamente con ayuda de su familia. Su dificultad en el trabajo es la delincuencia que abunda por el sector. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres y utensilio para su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias. Una de sus metas es que su hijos se encargué del negocio y que Dios de le salud para seguir en lo mismo.
texts.en:
Mariana, 63, is a hardworking woman who started a business selling food.  Prior to this she used to work for the military, and from there she became independent.

Now she has a post where she sells food.  She works there daily with the help of her family.  The difficulty she faces in her work is the crime that is common in her neighborhood.  With the loan, she will buy food and utensils for her business to increase her earnings.  One of her goals is to have her children take over the business, and she hopes that God will give her the health to keep the business going.

loans.use: to buy food and utensils

loans.name: Muneria Ole

texts.en:
Muneria Ole S. is 40 years old and the married father of four children. For the past five years, Muneria has been a farmer. His monthly income is 8,000 KES.

Muneria was introduced to KADET LTD by a client and is applying for his third loan. He is requesting 30,000 KES to buy farm supplies and prepare his land for planting. Muneria is a hardworking man who aims high and works to achieve his goals. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profit from his loan into his farm and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 39 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en casa de su hermana. Hace más de 4 años  vende comida en un puesto de ventas todos los días, en algunas ocasiones  tiene la ayuda de sus hijos pero generalmente ella misma prepara todo lo necesario para su negocio que ofrece desayuno y almuerzos, Le agrada trabajar en este negocio porque no requiere de todo el día para tener ganancias y aunque comienza desde muy temprano ya esta acostumbrada a este ritmo, permitiéndole establecer su economía. Por otro lado, también tiene otro negocio, que es el de alquilar equipos de sonido, eso le ayuda a acumular más ganancias. Tiene metas por lo que desea cumplirlos, una de ellas es tener un local amplio. Es su crédito número 10 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque le permite crecer como persona y tener una amistad sincera con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal y seguirá demostrando su puntualidad en los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunos ingredientes no perecibles y también el mantenimiento de sus equipos de sonido.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 39, lives in the company of her three children in the house of her sister. For over four years, she has been selling food at a vending post -- a job that she does ever day. Sometimes Yolanda's children help her with the business, but generally she prepares everything by herself and offers to her clients breakfast and lunch. She likes this line of work because she does not have to work the whole day to make a living though she does have to start very early in the morning. Yolanda is already used to this schedule and the food preparation business is the main source for her financial stability.

In addition, Yolanda also has a sound equipment rental business; this helps her increase her earnings. She has several goals that she would like to achieve, and one of them is to have a spacious commercial location. This is Yolanda's 10th loan with MFP; she feels very happy to be a part of her communal bank because it helps her grow as a person and develop true friendships with the other members of the bank. She will continue to be timely with repayment. Yolanda will use the loan to purchase ingredients for food preparation and to perform maintenance work on her sound equipment.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation, to perform sound equipment maintenance

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con sus nietos a su cargo D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, desD. hace 21 años, este negocio lo fundó junto a su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. productos domésticos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, huevos, pastas. Este préstamo le cubrirá este gasto y dará mayor estabilidad al negocio y a sus ingresos, ya que su familia y ella dependen del negocio.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus nietos, velar por sus necesidades y sus estudios, hasta que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her grandchildren who are in her care. They are 18 and 22 years old. She has a store from where she sells basic needs products. She has had the business for 21 years and it was founded by her husband. 

She requests a loan to purchase household products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, and pasta. This loan will cover this expense and it will proviD. her business and her income with greater stability. She and her family depend on this business. 

Her objective is to help her grandchildren, to proviD. for their needs and to send them to school, until they have achieved a career.

loans.use: to purchase household products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, and pasta.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Miselida

texts.es: Miselida, de 59 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija menor Diana de 25 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Cocinando sus ricos platillos que consiste en pollo frito y papas fritas y hamburguesas, Miselida pasa sus días expendiendo estos alimentos. Ella disfruta mucho de cocinar y lo hace con mucha habilidad, su comida es comprada por muchos clientes, los cuales acaban con los deliciosos platillos en unos segundos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, por que actualmente solo lo hace por la noches, aunque tiene 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza espera poder salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platillos, con el resto del dinero comprará mesas y sillas para amoblar el restaurante que tanto desea tener.
texts.en: Miselida, 59 years old, is a friendly and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house along with her dear, youngest daughter, Diana, who is 25. What she wishes for most is to work very hard to improve her quality of life. Cooking her delicious dishes that consist of fried chicken, french fries and hamburgers, Miselida passes her days selling these meals. She enjoys cooking a lot and she does it well. Her food is bought by many customers, who return for seconds for the delicious dishes. For the future of her business, she hopes to have a restaurant where she may sell the food she prepares all day and with greater tranquility since currently she only does it at night. Although she has eight years' experience with this work, she still finds it difficult to attend to all the customers that she has. With all the effort she makes, she hopes to be able to get ahead and improve her life. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is saving to pay back on time since she does not want to cause problems to the members in her community bank where she feels very happy. With the 2,500 new "soles" requested, she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes. With the rest of the money, she will buy tables and chairs to furnish her restaurant that she wants to have so much.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare dishes, as well as to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 
Maricar has a rolling food shop that sells snacks, like tempura & kwek-kwek . She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for tempura & kwek-kwek.
Maricar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for tempura & kwek-kwek

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is 40 years old and lives in the village of Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age dependents. Marisa has a small market at home. She sells assorted food products, rice, corn, refreshments and feed. Marisa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. She earns a total average monthly income of PHP 3,000 in this business. Marisa requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase feed to sell. Marisa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase feed to sell

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.en: Orfilia lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where she makes a living by selling basic foodstuffs out of her home. She has been engaged in this small business for many years and was among the first in her village to open a small general store. She is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cheese, snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, beans, rice, corn, cornmeal, and sugar.

loans.name: Walo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Walo est créé le 9 juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il est composé de vingt cinq femmes issues du même quartier, elles sont sœurs, cousines et amies; elles s'activent dans le commerce, couture, coiffure et teinture.


Racky est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mène un commerce de produits divers, elle a une bonne expérience, elle fait aussi de l'aviculture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou vert et couverte d'un châle rougeâtre.

Elle s'approvisionne en( produits cosmétiques,chaussures, habits....) dans les villes voisines, dans la capitale et revend au marché central de sa ville ou elle posséde une boutique.

 Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer la quantité de la marchandise pour espérer ainsi gagner plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite ouvrir plus tard un compte dans les banques classiques mais également participer aux charges familiales et subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité Walo est créé le 9 juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il est composé de vingt cinq femmes issues du même quartier, elles sont sœurs, cousines et amies; elles s'activent dans le commerce, couture, coiffure et teinture.


Racky est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mène un commerce de produits divers, elle a une bonne expérience, elle fait aussi de l'aviculture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou vert et couverte d'un châle rougeâtre.

Elle s'approvisionne en( produits cosmétiques,chaussures, habits....) dans les villes voisines, dans la capitale et revend au marché central de sa ville ou elle posséde une boutique.

 Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer la quantité de la marchandise pour espérer ainsi gagner plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite ouvrir plus tard un compte dans les banques classiques mais également participer aux charges familiales et subvenir à ses besoins personnels.

loans.use: Acheter  des produits cosmétiques à revendre.

loans.name: Juan Benigno

texts.es:
Juan Benigno tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijo de 30 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Juan se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.

Le gusta jugar vóley, además las fiestas como el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Juan Benigno is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 30 year old son in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  

The NUEVE DE ABRIL [April Ninth] community bank is located in the San José del Tambo parish, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. The members of this bank work in agriculture, mainly growing corn and cacao.

Juan grows corn and cacao. He buys and sells products in the San José del Tambo market.
 
He is asking for the loan to buy seed and agricultural materials. The loan will be used to support his financial needs and improve his farming activities. He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells as well as middlemen. His dream is buy a plot of land. 

He likes to play volleyball and he likes festivals like Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy seed and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Kabundaire United Ass Group

texts.en: Noah is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own a big produce store in town. Noah owns a store containing maize and cassava flour and he has been operating it for 10 years. His major challenge has been inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. Noah needs the loan to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alex

texts.es:
José de 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

José desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (50 cabezas de ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado, para que estén bien alimentados y los pueda ofrecer a mejor precio, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales y producto podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José es un joven trabajador y con su esfuerzo a sabido salir por sus propios medios adelante y trata de seguir ayudando a sus padres en lo que puede.
texts.en:
José is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents, without running water or electricity, in the rural area of the Tambogrande district which is part of the Piura department.  This area's focus is on agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last two years, José has been raising and selling sheep (50 head of sheep).  His farmyard, which is appropriate and extensive, is located in the rear of his home.  He feeds the sheep on balanced animal feed and natural pastureland, because his animals need to reach an ideal size for him to be able to offer them for sale in the different markets in the area, and so obtain good earnings to meet his personal obligations.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternative for the purchase of balanced animal feed, so that the sheep will be well nourished and he can sell them for a better price.  With the earnings that he will get from the sale of his animals and products, he will be able to cover his loan as well as have a better quality of life.

José is a hard-working young man who through effort has been able to move ahead in life through his own means, and who tries to continue helping his parents however he can.

loans.use: to buy more balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 and lives with her family in her own house in the village of Calao, West Santiago. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four grown-up children.

She has a business selling food in front of her house. Her food stall is in an area much frequented by people.  She has been doing this business for three years and she's glad because she is able to generate an income of P40,000 a month. She starts vending rice soup at 6:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening because she has many customers due to the good flavor of her food and cleanliness of her stall.

Erlinda would like to improve her food production business so she is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy  rice, utensils and ingredients for her food production business. This will enable her to continue offering good service to her customers and covering all her household expenses with her earnings. Now she is aiming that someday she will have a bigger and more comfortable stall for her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, utensils and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Nilda tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, una niña de 10 años y otro de 15 años. Su cónyuge le ayuda siempre en todo lo referente a sus negocios.
Ella se dedica al comercio. Empezó el negocio realizando ventas de comestibles como empanadas, milanesas, luego de a poco fue cargando, vendiendo productos de consumo familiar como fideos, azúcar, harina, aceite. Ella comenta que su despensa tiene buenos ingresos ya que tiene una clientela bien determinada que siempre acuden a su negocio. Por medio de esto, y con la ayuda de su marido pueden mantener a sus hijos y también a la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como ser fideos, galletas, arroz, aceite, azúcar, carne  y otros para abastecer su local y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilda is 39 years old and has two children, a 10 year old daughter and a 15 year old.  Her husband always helps her with everything in regards to her businesses.

She is a merchant.  She started the business by selling food like empanadas and  'milanesas' (a breaded meat dish).  After a little while she was stocking up and selling household consumer products such as noodles, sugar, flour, and oil.  She says that her grocery store has good earnings because she has well-established customers who always frequent her business.   With her customers and her husband’s help they able able to support their children and maintain their house.

She is requesting the loan to buy basic needs items like noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat, and other items in order to stock her place and meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items like noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Delilah works hard to support her family.

She has a boarding house rentals business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Delilah is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the upkeep of her boarding house rentals.

Delilah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the upkeep of her boarding house rentals.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. 

Rosalinda has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store. 

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La Sra. Emiliana vive en la  zona Capacachi, es casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando, que asume con sus gastos de educación, es de clase humilde y sencilla que tubo que trabajar mucho para salir adelante, es muy trabajadora y sacrificada, se dedica a la venta de papa por mayor en los mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba  y tambien vende sus productos en la localidad de Sacaba en los distintos mercados, el crédito solicita es para la compra de papa por carga y así de esta modo aumentar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Emiliana es una persona muy amable,  se siente agradecida por la confianza que se le brindo.
texts.en: Emiliana lives in Capacachi.  She’s married and has three children who are going to school.  She takes care of their educational costs.  She is of a humble, unassuming class and has had to work very hard to get ahead.  She is very hardworking and selfless.  She sells potatoes at wholesale in the farmers markets in the city of Cochabamba and in the  market in Sacaba.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy a carload of potatoes to increase her working capital.  Emiliana is a very kind person who feels grateful for the trust that’s been placed in her.

loans.use: to buy a carload of potatoes.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman who is 36 years old. She resides in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Juvy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, napkins and many others to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Juvy has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Juvy wants to build her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vidal, a farmer, and is a mother to their four children, two of whom are working while the other two have their own families already. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Editha makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She’s been ten years in this business. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting, such as fertilizer, pots, and seedlings, and to pay their monthly water bills. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Editha hopes her business grows in the coming years, and she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: German

texts.en: German is married and is a responsible father of two children. He is a conscientious and hardworking person. German has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over six years. He grows rice. When he started this business, he had two hectares of land and now he plans to expand his land. He wants to gather a good harvest and maximize his profit. German wants to obtain a loan in the sum of PHP 22,000 to purchase mineral fertilizers for his farm business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase firewood, oil and corn.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in her meat vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional meat to sell

loans.name: Talaloa

texts.en:
Talaloa is 60 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Talaloa owns and operates a business venture, selling fried food in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    

Talaloa is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make the fried food she sells.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and/or expand her business.

In 2010, Talaloa joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Talaloa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients necessary to make fried food to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 50 years old, is a mixed-crop farmer. She is a single mother of two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Priscilla will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from wild mangrove forest and from local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Caroline is single with one child. She is a farmer. She has been farming for ten years now and she is currently growing an orange orchard on her farm. Caroline is excited about beekeeping as it will help her to learn about bees.

This is Caroline’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Caroline’s hope for the future is to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sheila May

texts.en:
Sheila May is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a frozen food retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale.

Sheila May dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime has about 8 years of experience running and owning food markets. Prior to this, he used to be a street vendor, but he decided to switch due to the instability of the work. He started off by only selling vegetables, but now he has diversified his product line to include many different foods and home supplies. He is requesting the loan in order to continue investing in products that keep his clients coming back.

Jaime is 27 years old and has one son who is 6 years old. His wife is expecting a new child in only 2 months, putting pressure on Jaime to generate income for his growing family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products for his store

loans.name: Tuok

texts.en:
Tuok M. is 46 years old and has 4 children. She is currently supporting three of her children at home, and the oldest at a local University. Her husband is a police officer and earns a monthly salary of $100. Their family lives in a village about 30km south of Phnom Penh.

Tuok M. runs a small restaurant serving pork rice, noodles, and other basic Khmer dishes. She generates $20 of income on an average day, $5 of which is profit. She is using $200 of this loan to increase her basic cooking supplies to serve her growing client-base. She is using the other $200 for basic repairs and additions to the restaurant in an effort to attract even more customers. In the future, Tuok M. hopes to build an extension on the restaurant .

loans.use: Buy supplies for her food shop

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is a mother of 2 children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region.She is settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region. She has had her own business since 2003. Esmira is 39 years old and grows vines. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya and her husband, Vladimir, have a small clothing sales business located at the city market in Novi Rosdil, Ukraine. A cheerful, responsible business owner, Nataliya has extensive experience in retail. She and her husband have owned their business for the past five years and prior to that she worked as an employee doing retail. Nataliya and Vladimir maintain an attractive display of both practical and fashionable clothing.

Nataliya has requested a loan of $800 that will enable them to purchase a good supply of men’s clothing inventory. Nataliya’s immediate goal is to sell enough so that she can purchase some items for her daughter before she starts school in September. Long term, she would love to eventually buy her own store facility and work on further improving the business.

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing inventory

loans.name: Giselle Delice

texts.en: Giselle is 28 years old and has three children aged 11, 9, and 7.  Her husband works as a salesman in a town grocery. She would like to go into business selling women's clothing, and has come to us for a loan of $225 to purchase products such as T-shirts, pants, dress shirts and underwear.  Giselle wants to do this so that she can save money to help educate her children and improve the life of her entire family.  She’ll repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To start a small business selling women's clothing

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sra. Alejandrina belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungainas ("Striving Women of Yungay") community bank. Her business (shop) is located in Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. The shop is at the Yungay Fairgrounds.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000 (2,000 Peruvian soles or about US$667), to be repaid in 6 installments, Alejandrina will buy goods at bulk prices (sugar, rice, pasta, milk, cooking oil, soap, etc.) so that she can stock her shop.

Alejandrina, 48, is a widow with 4 children. She started selling general merchandise in a single stall at the Fairgrounds; with the loans she's received, she was able to help her children open their own stalls, also selling general merchandise. With the same drive, she has opened a general store in the nearby "distrito" of Tarica which she operates herself. Her goal is to buy or rent a larger space so that she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungaínas, su negocio (bodega) esta ubicado en la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash. Su local esta ubicado en el Campo Ferial de Yungay.

Con el reciente préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes al por mayor ( azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche, aceite, jabón, etc. ) y así poder surtir la bodega.

La señora Alejandrina tiene 48 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, se inicio con la venta de abarrotes en un solo puesto del Campo Ferial, con los créditos obtenidos pudo apoyar a sus hijos en la apertura de sus propios puestos de venta del mismo negocio, del mismo modo ha aperturado una tienda de abarrotes en el distrito de Taricá, Provincia de Huaraz, el cual está a cargo de ella misma. Su objetivo es comprar o alquilar un Stand mas grande y de esta manera ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulato is a 67-year-old woman with three children. Her plantation is her family's only means of support, and she has been running it for a long time. She sells her crops at the market while her sons do manual labour in the fields. She goes to the market with her produce three times a week and makes a profit of $124 a per day. She appreciates the help she has received from previous loans, and hopes to use her new loan to increase the output of her plantation.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Elonia

texts.es:
Elonia, with a lot of effort, managed to open a grocery store in her humble dwelling and the business is doing well: as a result of her daily efforts she has been able to meet the demands of her customers and as result of being located in a busy transit zone the demand for her products has been increasing. She is a little worried that she will be unable to take advantage of this opportunity, because she needs a sum of money to use as capital investment in order to satisfy her customers’ requests.

At the same time, she would like to finish the construction of her small house in order that her children can have better home-comforts and a environment that encourages their positive development. The combination of these facts has motivated Elonia to present her request for a loan with the objective of realising these projects. Don’t forget she’s counting on you!

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Elonia, con mucho esfuerzo aperturó una bodega en su humilde morada le va muy bien; con su desempeño diario ha podido percibir la demanda de las personas y por estar situada en una zona de amplia concurrencia la demanda de sus artículos se han ido incrementando; está un poco preocupada debido a que no le gustaría desaprovechar esta oportunidad, sin embargo requiere de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión para satisfacer las solicitudes de sus clientes.

Así mismo desea terminar la construcción de su casita para que sus hijos puedan tener mayores comodidades y ambientes favorables para su desarrollo.La suma de estos hechos ha motivado a Elonia a presentar su petición de un préstamo con el objetivo de realizar sus proyectos pensados no olvide que cuenta con usted.

loans.use: Inrease in capital in order to acquire larger quantity and better variety of essential goods.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.en: Vingawase is a divorced woman. She has a food vending business, and would like to receive a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is the caring father of a family. His young child suffers from an illness and Marcial works very hard each day with the only objective being to help him feel better and recover. Marcial cultivates corn and potatoes, and with the loan he will be able to increase the quantity of his production and continue to help his child.

Marcial, es un empeñoso padre D. familia, que lleva el triste dolor D. L. enfermedad D. su pequeño en su corazón y por quien se ha propuesto esforzarse día a día y sin tregua alguna con el único objetivo D. ayudarlo a sentirse mejor y a tener esperanza D. pronta mejoría.Siembra papa y maíz anualmente y su deseo es incrementar L. cantidad D. sus productos para cumplir con su propósito.

loans.use: TO BE ABLE TO CULTIVATE GREATER QUANTITIES OF POTATOES AND CORN.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en: Nasser is 37 years old and works and lives with his family in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. Nasser supports his family by making items out of aluminum, and has applied for his third loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy raw materials, and use the increased income he expects to earn to pay his children's tuition and furnish his house.

loans.use: to buy materials for an aluminium business

loans.name: Bebun P.

texts.id:
This proposed loan will be the second loan for Bebun. He has already paid the first. From the first loan, he felt that there is an improvement in his business, even though only a small difference. He still starts to collects trash early in the morning, and sorts, measures the weight, and resells the trash in the afternoon.

Bebun proposes to earn the loan to be able to improve his business that enables him to save to build his own house in Java.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman periode kedua bagi Bebun. Pinjaman sebelumnya sudah dilunasi. Dar pinjaman sebelumnya dia merasakan ada perubahan dalam usahanya, meskipun masih sangat kecil. Kegiatan sehari-hari tetap seperti biasanya, berangkat pagi hari mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan, lalu pada sore harinya dipisahkan menurut jenis kemudian ditimbang dan dijual. Kali ini Bebun bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk bisa mengembangkan usahanya dan bisa ditabung untuk membangun rumahnya di Pulau Jawa.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María and her husband began silk-screening 8 years ago. They have a small workshop in their house, where they work from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.

Luz María’s husband used to have a workshop where he made faucets, however he was not successful in this endeavor and instead decided to only make the bags in which faucets are sold. As a result, he learned silk-screening and now makes plastic bags with logos for various faucet companies.

Luz María also learned silk-screening so that both she and her husband could work together in their workshop. Two other people work with Luz María and her husband, as 8 months ago they formalized their business.

The loan that she has requested will help her purchase the materials she needs in her business, such as plastic bags, paint, etc.

Luz María wants to expand her workshop and increase the number of employees.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Luz María y su esposo se dedican a la serigrafía desde hace 8 años. Tienen un pequeño taller dentro de su casa. Allí trabajan desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

El esposo de Luz María tenía un taller donde elaboraba grifos de agua, sin embargo, no le fue bien en esta actividad, por lo que decidió dedicarse solamente a hacer las bolsas de los grifos. De esta manera, aprendió serigrafía y ahora trabaja proveyendo de bolsas plásticas con logotipo a distintas empresas de grifería.

Luz María también aprendió serigrafía, por lo que los dos laboran conjuntamente en su taller. Asimismo, tienen dos personas más trabajando con ellos. Recién han podido formalizar su negocio hace 8 meses.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los materiales que necesita en su negocio, como bolsas plásticas, pinturas, etc.

Ella quisiera agrandar su taller y aumentar el personal de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as plastic bags and paint for her silk-screening business.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben is a taxi driver on the Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 payroll. With this income he supports his young daughter. He lives with his in-laws in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.

Currently he does not have his own work equipment, and he is asking for a loan to add to his saving and make his dream to have his own car a reality. He will then be able to work as a car owner and increase his income by 25%.

This is his second Impro loan. His responsibility and on-time payments have allowed him to request another loan; he has paid off his last loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruben es chofer asalariado en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88, es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija; vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la Zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

En este momento no cuenta con una herramienta de trabajo propia, entonces el crédito lo destinará para completar al dinero que tiene ahorrado y hacer realidad su sueño de contar con su propia movilidad a medio uso para poder trabajar como propietario. Este hecho le traerá como resultado el incremento de su ingreso en por lo menos un 25% más.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo. El anterior crédito fue cancelado en su totalidad.

loans.use:
Purchase a vehicle to work as a taxi driver with his own car

Compra de una movilidad a medio uso para trabajar como taxi y dueño de su propio carro.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, age 22, is unmarried and a very hardworking trader. She enjoys selling goods, and the sale of cosmetics has been her major livelihood for the past six years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on a table at the community market. Cecilia believes that with the loan, she would have the resources to purchase more stock of cosmetics and jewelry to increase her inventory and income. She is a member of Anointed Ladies Group. Members in this group provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is a widow and mother of six grown-up children, with four of them fully independent and the other two currently in school. She is fifty-three years old and an energetic businesswoman who sells charcoal, cooking oil, bags of rice, etc.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. With her 22 years of experience in her business, she has supported four of her children to complete senior high school.

Mary obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal, cooking oil, and bags of rice, etc. to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the trust group called "Odo ne Asomdwei" meaning Love and Peace Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, cooking oil, and bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T. is 26 year old single lady. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now married with a kid. She sells lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past five years. She does her business through door to door sales. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group.  Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Jennifer does not sell on group meeting days and her photo was taken during her group meeting. Jennifer is wearing nice batik tie and dye clothe with long necklace and earring, looking into the camera with other group members behind.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat H., 46, and her husband, Mr. Leang Lonh, 50, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 1980 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside of the family home. Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other three children study at the local school.

Yat and her husband have been farming for over twenty years. They grow many types of vegetables such as cucumbers, squash and other many types of crops on their farmland, which is not far from their home.  She is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en: Mrs. Yann M. is a villager in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province and she is a farmer. Yann is 29 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is only two years old. In her plantation, she usually gathers rice revenue every January. Her husband, Mr. Tem Oeun, is a traditional medicine seller who can generate a small income to support the household, and he is shown on the right of photo. Although Yann and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Thus, Yann decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows.

loans.use: Yann would like to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Las Semillitas De Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Semillitas D. RSR" están representadas por el señor Raúl Alberto, esta conformado por personas que residen en el mismo barrio, los miembros del grupo se dedican al comercio D. productos como embutidos, ropa, zapatos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al transporte público, son gente trabajadora que sabe que existe la competencia y que depenD. D. el esfuerzo y la dedicación que uno pone en su trabajo para salir adelante, El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. mercadería y la adquisición D. productos nuevos para la época naviD.ña que es donD. existe mayor movimiento D. productos a la venta. La mayoría D. los socios (as)  tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben que se necesita responsabilidad y compromiso para salir adelante como lo dice su nombre son semillitas del progreso para mejorar la vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Las Semillitas D. RSR" (Little Seeds of RSR) Group are represented by Raul Alberto and is maD. up of people that live in the same neighborhood. The group members sell products like meats, clothing, shoes, and groceries in their small neighborhood general stores and proviD. public transport services. They are hard-working people who know that there is a great deal of competition so their success depends on how much effort and dedication each puts into their work. The purpose of the loan is to increase their inventory and acquire new products for the Christmas season which is when they have the most sales. Most of the group members have experience in support groups so they are familiar with the responsibility and commitment necessary to progress; as their name says, these are seeds of progress that will improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Menzelakhon

texts.en:
Menzelakhon is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. She and her husband are engaged in this business together. Slowly, the number of cows has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Menzelakhon’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is 35 years old and married with four children. He sells beef in small quantities to consumers.

Michael is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 naira to purchase more beef to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en: Mary L. is an enterprising Tanzanian business woman. She has been running a beauty salon at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam for four years. She is married and has three school children. She purchases products for her business from the wholesale shops in the Kariakoo city trading center. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000. to help improve her business.

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses S. is a member of Semuti group in Mityana. He was one of the first people to join this lending group nine years ago, and then he dropped out. Moses is frank to tell Pearl Microfinance Limited that for the three cycles he was out (one year), things were slow and his level of hard work had dropped a bit, and this affected his income.

He is the Chairman of the village and also has rental houses in Semuti trading centre that helps bring in money. Moses is also a farmer with various plantations growing matooke, cassava and maize.

Moses needs a loan to complete his other houses in the trading centre, by buying iron sheets. He also owns a boda (bicycle taxi) that he gives to others to ride for money, though at times he does the job himself. His wife is a teacher and they have six children who are all in school.

loans.use: Buy iron sheets for home construction.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is a 40 year old mother of five children - the oldest is 18 and the youngest is 8 months. Five of them are in school. She is married to a businessman who lives in Nyamasaria slum here in Kisumu. She would like to use this loan to purchase more dressmaking materials. She is asking for 10,000 KSH and hopes that one day Kiva or its partners could offer more advice on how to run a good business.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice sells garri (roasted cassava) in bags and bowls. She sells at Koshofe market in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

Alice is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Sharef Group

texts.en:
Sharef, the leader of this group, requests a loan for her business selling wood. Pray Khanum wants to take a loan for her husband who has a smithy shop. Lateafa wants to take a loan for a car part shop. Basera wants a loan for a bakery. 
There are four members in this group. They are applying for a loan of 48,000 afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders that provide support across the world.

loans.use: For expanding wood selling business

loans.name: Toribia Norma

texts.es:
Toribia es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Toribia es casada tiene 65 años, siete hijos ya son mayores y están casados.  
Toribia  tiene una amiga que tiene su deposito D. gas y la animo a vender  en su casa, ella ambiento su patio y se ha puesto a vender  gas, gaseosa, cerveza y los fines D. semana venD. anticuchos en la puerta D. su casa.
DesD. que Toribia esta en Finca ha podido logra muchas cosas, y aprendió ahorrar.
Toribia necesita un préstamo D.  2000 soles, para una vitrina para vender hojas, El sueño D. Toribia es volver a tener su librería
texts.en:
Toribia is a member of the Paz and Desarrollo Community Bank. Toribia is 65 and married. She has seven adult, married children. Toribia has a friend who she sells containers of gas. The friend encouraged Toribia to sell from her house. She set up her patio and has started selling gas, soft drinks, and beer. On the week ends she sells kebabs from the door to her house. Since Toribia has been in Finca, she has been able to achieve many things, and she has learned to save. Toribia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy a display case to sell sheets of paper sold by the unit. Toribia’s dream is to return to having a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a display case to sell sheets of paper sold by the unit

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina D. is 44 years old. She comes from the suburbs of the town Kalesija. She lives there with her husband and daughter who is in second year high school. Her husband works in a store in Kalesija as a salesman.

Jasmina produces vegetable for her own use and for sale, beside that she owns corn and wheat fields. Jasmina, also does poultry business in season. Jasmina has requested her first loan through WWI ( Žene za Žene International ) in the amount of 1500 KM to invest in their farming. Jasmina`s business profit increases their home budget and provides better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase minerals, seeds and pay transport costs conected to agriculure work

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 3 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.  Vive en el Centro Poblado Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cuañ utilizó para la compra de  ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor ovino y alpacas, además comprará productos de la región, como papas, quinua, chuño, habas, ocas, etc

Su deseo es poner una ferretería.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is a member of the community bank “Manuela de Hoy “which is located in the district of Llave, El Collao Province, Puno state. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children that graduated from high school. She lives in the town of Camicachi. Graciela has worked with Manuela Ramos organization for almost 5 years, her first loan was for $300.00 nuevos soles that were used to buy cows. At this time she requires a loan of $675 that will be invested in the purchase of small sheep, alpacas and local products such as potatoes, quinoa, Chun, beans, geese, etc. her desire is to start a hardware store. She likes the savings and meetings of her community bank

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep, alpacas and local products such as potatoes, quinoa, Chun, beans, geese, etc.

loans.name: Тахмина

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Тахмина женщина 28 лет, проживает в Костакозе. Вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Её муж работает водителем такси, поэтому в основно ухаживает его жена. Тахмина решила получить кредит для расширения семейного бизнеса.  Она хочет купить пару дойных коров и  корм для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel de 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa es modista y le tiene dos hijos de 5 y 18 años de edad, el desde muy temprano sale de su casa ya que trabaja en la cooperativa de buses de Managua desde hace doce años, trabajo cansado pero con la ventaja que entre mas vuelta de la ruta gana mejor, lo cual espera poder terminar de hacer su casa y poder tener a su familia en las mejores condiciones, con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic y va  a construir un porche para tener mas espacio y mejor para descansar por las noches. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que se le hace difícil poder construir y con el préstamo comenzara ya.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 51 years old and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married and his wife is a clothing designer; they have two children ages 5 and 18. He leaves his house very early, given that he has works for the Managua bus cooperative, a job that he has held for the past twelve years; it is a tiring job with the advantage that the more times he carries out his route, the more he earns. He hopes to be able to finish building his home, and to be able to provide better living conditions for his family. With this loan he will enter in his ninth loan cycle with Afodenic; he will use this loan to build a porch that will provide more space and a better place to rest at night. He thanks the Afodenic institution for the loan, given that it has been difficult for him to being construction, and with this loan he will be able to start building immediately.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a porch.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
"Telesia F. (0) is a 29 years -year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Leloto-Leauvaa.  She is married and has 3 children school-aged children.  To make a living, Telesia owns & operates a business venture.  The business operates in the agriculture sector.  The main purpose of the business is raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Telesia has been engaged in this business for over 2 years.  From these activities, Telesia earns approximately 145 tala WST a month.

In 2009, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Telesia has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.    She is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Telesia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business 0.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida M. is a 30 year old single mother of one child, Zainabu M.. She lives in Tudor, Mombasa in the coast province of Kenya. 

Farida works with companies in Kuwait seeking to employ people as well as providing clearing and forwarding services for the ports. She has been doing this business for 4 years. She heard of KADET from a friend and joined; she is now accessing her first loan with which she plans to purchase two new computers and a printer for her business. She also plans on using this loan for advertising by  way of posters and a public address system.

Farida hopes to become an importer of household products from Dubai in future.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase two new computers and a printer for her business and advertising

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn V. is a villager in Proeus Leu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a general goods seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to resell to earn more income for her living. Mrs. Lorn V. is 55 years old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more goods to resell to earn more income for her living.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU depuis 8 ans. Avec son crédit elle fait du petit commerce; elle vend du tissu, des chaussures, des jus naturels, de la crème glacée et de l'eau fraiche. Les bénéfices réalisés de son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
47-year-old Fatou D. is divorced and lives with her 5 dependent children. She has been a member of the Kambeng Doumassou Village Bank for 8 years. She runs a small business with her loan: she sells cloth, shoes, natural juices, ice cream and fresh water. The generated profits allow her to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuth H. and her husband, Mr. Hang Hean, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. For cultivating rice, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil, and they do not have enough money to buy gasoline for their plow. Thus, Mrs. Yuth H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline for the plow for her farming.

Mrs. Yuth H. is a 53-year-old mother of three children: one is employed in a garment factory, while another is a farmer, and the last one is attending the local school. They live in Doem Rom Del village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline for a plow

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein has been working as a home painter since 2003. He is unmarried and takes care of his mother, with whom he resides. Today, Hussein is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. He wants to buy an air compressor in order to improve and eventually expand his business.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor to improve and eventually expand his business

loans.name: Freja

texts.en: Freja M. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol and charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Freja is 30 years old and is married to a tailor. She has six children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a retail shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elias Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Elias Sebastião S. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 6 e 9 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Não estudou porque os pais na altura não o deixaram estudar porque davam prioridade o trabalho da machamba e pastagem de gado bovino. Vive na casa dos serviços com sua família e ainda sustenta a sua mãe e um sobrinho que vivem com ele.

Nuca saiu de Boane apenas saiu da casa dos pais para construir sua própria residência. Trabalha juntos com a sua esposa na Banalandia uma empresa de produção e venda de Banana no Distrito de Boane. Faz cerca de 8 horas por dia e tem um salário mensal de 1.630.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa)

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, ferro, areia e janelas) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 6.600.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência, e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Elias Sebastião S. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 29 years old, married, and is the father of 2 children who are 6 and 9 years old. They both go to school. He did not go to school because his parents at that time didn't let him study. This was because they gave priority to working on the machamba (a small agricultural field) and in the cattle pasture. He lives in the service worker houses with his family and even supports his mother and a nephew, who both live with him. He has never left Boane, only leaving his parents' house to build his own home. He works together with his wife in Banalandia at a banana production and sales business in Boane District. He works about 8 hours each day and receives a monthly salary of 1,630 MZN that he uses for household expenses. He even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). He has never had loans through banks. He found out about Hluvuku through service colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. With it, he plans to buy construction materials (beams, panes, cement, steel, sand, and windows) in order to continue with the construction of his house. The previous loan was for 6,600 MZN, for the same purpose. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans in order to continue to build his house and provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, a door, etc.)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Sandra es cosmetóloga y brinda servicios a domicilio y también en su misma casa. Además Sandra vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito. 
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de líquidos y tintes.
Los sueños de Sandra son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Sandra, 29, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has two children. Sandra is a cosmetologist and provides home service as well as takes care of customers in her own house. In addition, Sandra sells assorted clothing on order; her sales are on credit. Sandra needs a 1500 sol loan to buy dyes and other liquid supplies. Sandra's dream is to have a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
