Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS EMPRENDEDORES” de la Asociación Arariwa y esta compuesto de once socios. Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en la oficina del socio Favio. 

Nuestros socios en su mayoría trabajan como empleados de la empresa privada “Erusal” y también tiene pequeños negocios como por ejemplo venta de comida, abarrotes y cosméticos.  La socia Sonia es empleada del hogar en el domicilio de la socia Maruja. La socia Karina es una mujer joven que tiene 25 años y es natural de la ciudad de Oropesa. Karina ofrece a sus amigas, amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo productos de belleza como aretes, pulseras, anillos, perfumes, colonias y pinta labios. La socia Karina requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “LOS EMPRENDEDORES” in the Arariwa Association, consisting of 11 members. They live in the city of Cusco and meet once a month in the office of one of the members, Favio. Our members mostly work as employees of the private firm "Erusal" and also have small businesses such as selling meals, groceries, or cosmetics. Sonia is a household employee in the home of another member, Maruja. Karina is a young woman of 25, a citizen of the city of Oropesa. Karina offers beauty products such as earrings, bracelets, rings, perfumes, colognes, and lipsticks to her friends, family members, and workmates. Karina needs this loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes. The members appreciate and are grateful for the award of this loan and commit themselves to complete the payments according to the agreed schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: One member will purchase beauty products such as perfumes

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina P. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol beverages at home and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use and make more alcohol to sell. Christina is 24 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31 year old married man with one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past 10 years. He owns a taxi van to transport a larger number of clients. He services his town and its surroundings. He works upon the request of his customers for private transportation.

Today Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his van after being in bad circumstances so he can apply himself towards always meeting the demands of his clients and present a comfortable service for them.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for his van

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rolanda, se dedica a la venta de mercería y lleva 10 años en el negocio pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y tiene  01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Con su fuerza emprendedora que siempre le cautivo, Rolanda se dedica a la Venta de Mercería, siempre supo salir adelante sola trabajando duro y parejo, obteniendo sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia e hijos, se inicio con un préstamo de 300 Nuevos comprando mercería cómo; paquetes de papel higiénico, kolynos en paquetes y otras cosas más.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará mercería para su stock como: desodorantes, kolynos, talcos, espejos, cepillos, papel higiénico, linternas,  lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Rolanda, se siente contenta con su trabajo, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer que de verdad lo necesitan
texts.en:
La Sra. Rolanda, se dedica a la venta de mercería y lleva 10 años en el negocio pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando. Con su fuerza emprendedora que siempre le cautivo, Rolanda se dedica a la Venta de Mercería, siempre supo salir adelante sola trabajando duro y parejo, obteniendo sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia e hijos, se inicio con un préstamo de 300 Nuevos comprando mercería cómo; paquetes de papel higiénico, kolynos en paquetes y otras cosas más. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará mercería para su stock como: desodorantes, kolynos, talcos, espejos, cepillos, papel higiénico, linternas, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas. Rolanda, se siente contenta con su trabajo, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer que de verdad lo necesitan

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará merceria para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Mersulita

texts.en:
Mersulita P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. She is 45 years old. Mersulita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Mersulita owns & operates a food production/sales business, selling specialty food products such as viands in the local community. Mersulita is just starting this business. Previously she was engaged in fish vending. 

In 2009, Mersulita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mersulita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mersulita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mersulita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ángela Amelia

texts.es:
Ángela M. de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Actualmente esta separada de su esposo pero tiene 3 hijos y solo uno de ellos estudia en una escuela particular. 

Hace unos años atrás empezó vendiendo helados y bebidas en su casa pero como necesitaba más ingresos decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en arroz, azucar y mas bebidas para vender en su tienda. 

Hace poco tiempo amplio su negocio y comenzó a vender verduras y vegetales en su pequeña tienda a las afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 22:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites para su tienda. 

En el futuro ella quiere que su tienda sea una de las grandes en todo Fortín para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela M. is 39 years old and lives in a semi-urban zone in Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cane and only has light as a basic service. She is separated from her husband and has 3 children, only one of whom studies in a private school. Several years ago Ángela began selling ice-cream and drinks in her house, but as she needed more earnings she decided to invest her small savings in rice, sugar and more drinks to sell in her shop. A little while ago Ángela expanded her business and began selling vegetables in her little shop outside her house. She works from 6am until 10pm. With this loan she wants to buy rice, sugar, and oils for the shop. In the future Ángela wants her business to be one of the biggest in Fortín, so she can give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion enjoys being a member of ASHI and is grateful for the help this organization and its members provide. She benefits from hearing about the experiences of her fellow members and also appreciates having access to loans which allow her to run her own sari-sari (or variety) store. She is committed to meet the needs of her store's customers, and also enjoys the personal development which comes with running a business. She has applied for a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy new items to sell in her store, including rice, beverages, oil, sugar, condensed milk and other items.

Concepcion is hopeful that her business will grow into full-fledged mini-market and that she will be able to save for the future and for emergencies, since she and her husband are getting older. Their children are all grown and have their own families, and Concepcion is determined not to ask them for help. Her route for achieving this goal is expanding her store. Her dream is to earn enough money to send all of her grandchildren to college so they can find good jobs.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Guadalupe Rolando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Guadalupe Rolando D. H. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor D. la vivienda.
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara D. realizar la mejora. Ya que desea la seguridad D. su familia cuando el no se encuentra en su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el  sueldo que recibe D. su trabajo que tiene en una compañía D. trasportes en el área D. exportación, quien se encargara D. los gastos familiares será su esposa la señora Videncia Garcia quien es maestra D. una escuela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Rolando D. H.' house still needs a wall around it. However, he lacks funds to buy materials and pay labor costs to make this home improvement. He wants his family to be safe when he's away from home. He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns working in the export area of a transportation firm. His wife, Videncia García, who is a teacher, will take care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. L. is a 39-year-old widow and a laborer. She is also hired by people to do anything, typically earning about $2 USD per day. L. currently feeds two young children, both of whom go to school. She lives with her father and her young sister, who also share responsibility for the family by working at different jobs. Her father sells natural medicine and her sister is a garment factory worker. L. sees that her father’s business is profitable and she hopes to sustain it by asking for a loan to accumulate more raw materials for her father to produce medicine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to produce medicines

loans.name: Puy

texts.en:
Puy M., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Puy and her husband are employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3 each per day. 

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: N. Shadai is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Shadia has operated a cosmetics shop for 5 years. To help expand her business, Shadia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetics like lotions and braids. With the help of this loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and be able to buy food at home and to pay school fees for herself. In the future, Shadia hopes to travel to Rwanda. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: To buy more oil and braids to sell

loans.name: Logn

texts.en:
Logn S., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo province. She is a professional silk weaver, making approximately US$2.50 each day. Her husband, pictured here, is a motorbike mechanic and the family is also supported by his US$2 income each day.

Logn S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase both silk and mechanic’s tools.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business and mechanic's tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn F. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hilaria Sagabaen's Group

texts.en: Hilaria S. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Hilaria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Hilaria runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilaria has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Hilaria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en:
Jecil L. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 22 years old, married and has 1 infant. Jecil owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jecil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jecil is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jecil from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Sopp Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité sopp sa jeker est créé le 27 septembre 2009 il est composer de 11 membres.elles se sont unis par voisinage .leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame ALIMA M. debout a l'extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe elle a 32 ans ,marié et mère de 5 enfants.
Elle fait du petit commerce de jus de fruit.

Son nouveau crédit lui servira  d'acheter de la matière premiers pour faire les jus, afin de pouvoir rapidement 
accroitre ses bénéfice.
Avec les profits générés elle fait de l'épargne et acheté ses besoin en habillement et bijoux
texts.en:
The "Sopp sa jeker" solidarity group  was created on September 27, 2009. It is composed of 11 members. These women are neighbors who decided to form a group together. Their main business activity is  retail. Mrs. Alima M., standing at the far right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of five.

She sells fruit juices. Her new loan will allow her to purchase ingredients for making juices, in order to be able to increase her revenues quickly. She uses the revenues to grow her savings and to purchase necessary clothing and jewelry.

loans.use: Developing and promoting her business

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 32 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Con muchas ganas de trabajar Teofilo sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de papa, arveja y maíz, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que le cuesta mucho trabajo hacerlo, debido a lo amplio de sus cultivos. En adelante espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 32, is a very cheerful, hard working man.  He lives in his own house and his greatest desire is to improve his quality of life.  With a strong wish to work, Teófilo goes out every day to work his fields.  He grows primarily potato, peas and corn, products that sell rapidly in Tarma’s market because of their good quality.

What he likes best about his work is cultivating the fields.  He has been a farmer for 8 years and considers fumigating the fields to be the most difficult task because it is very hard work due to the extent of his fields.  In the future he hopes production will improve because his income depends on it.

This is his 8th loan with MFP and he is very happy to have gotten it and is willing to repay punctually; he is very well liked in his communal bank.

He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure for his fields because he wants them to produce more.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa T. is a 46 years old single mother who lives with her adult son in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her only son operates a computer service and photographing business which was started in August 2009, in a rented space to supplement their family income. Bayarmaa started her own business after graduating from vocational training majoring as a hairdresser and photographer in 1984. She has been operating her business for many years and has much experience. In addition, she also works as a servant in the police department of the province to increase her earnings.

Since 2009, she started to rent a space where she operates her hair salon. For the future, she is planning to not only expand and improve her business but also her son's business.

Bayarmaa is a talkative and open minded woman and says, "I want to have my own comfortable work place."  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase professional photo camera and color printer for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase a professional photo camera and color printer.

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr: Kossiwavi a 41 ans et a en charge 2 enfants. Pour contribuer au ménage elle exerce comme activité la vente de charbons de bois et compte deja 5ans. Elle achète au nord à Pagala ses marchandises et revend au marché Nukafu. Elle espère accroître son commerce grâce à ce nouveau crédit.
texts.en: Kossiwavi is 41 years old and cares for two children.  To help meet family expenses, she sells charcoal and has been for five years now.  She buys her supplies in the north in Pagala and resells them at the market in Nukafu.  She hopes to grow her business with the help of this new loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two sows and fodder.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El Senor Luis R., tiene 60 anos de edad, casado, con unicamente 1 hijo, habita en la comarca El Rodeo, Esteli, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 30 anos, su educacion es muy elemental, fue alfabetizado.
Inicio en estas actividades desde muy nino, ya que sus padres eran agricultores, se dedicaban a la siembra de cebolla, y el les ayudaba a regar las plantaciones.
Tambien ha tenido experiencia en la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral.
El realizo este credito para la siembra de Maiz, Sorgo y Frijoles; espera obtener buenos resultados de esta producion.
Su meta es ampliara su produccion de granos basicos; le pide a sus hijos que se concentren en sus estudios para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y puedan preparse, ya que el por falta de recursos no pudo hacerlo.
texts.en: Mr Luis R., age 60, is married with one child. He lives in the Comarca El Rodeo, Esteli, and has worked in agriculture for over 30 years. His education is very basic. He is literate. He started this work at a very young age, since his parents were farmers. They planted onions, and he helped them to water their lands. He has also had experience in raising hogs and barnyard animals. He is taking out this loan for planting corn, sorghum and beans; he hopes to have better results from this harvest. His goal is to expand his production of basic grains; he has asked his children to concentrate on their studies so that they can have a better future and be educated; what he could not do for lack of resources.

loans.use: the sowing of corn, sorghum and beans

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo es socio del Banco Comunal Milagros, tiene 41 años y es soltero. Es feriante, viaja todos los sábados a Acocro, ahí compra los cereales y lo vende en el mercado Nery García otras veces en los molinos, pertenece a FINCA hace 1 año y medio, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar, aprendió en las capacitaciones a como invertir su dinero. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en surtir su mercadería.
El sueño de Timoteo es poder ahorrar, para poder comparase un carro y poder viajara las ferias.
texts.en:
Timoteo is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagros” (Miracles). He is 41 years old, single, and works as a merchant. He travels every Saturday to Acocro where he buys grain and sells it at the Nery García Market and to grain mills on other occasions. Timoteo joined FINCA a year and a half ago. He enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because the members are provided loans, have the ability to save, and receiving training as to how to invest their money. He is requesting a loan to invest in increasing his inventory.

Timoteo dreams of saving toward the purchase of a car so that he can travel to the fairs.

loans.use: Purchase grain to increase his inventory

loans.name: Epifania Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Epifana tiene 54 años. Ella es madre soltera. La actividad economía de ella es una pulpería. Ella tiene 11 años de tener este medio de vida ya que siempre está al pendiente de lo que necesita. Epifania comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo solamente golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otros productos que son necesearios. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia necesaria para sus clientes.
texts.en: Epifana is 54 years old. She is a single mother. Her business is a convenience store. She has had this way of life for 11 years, since it always provides what she needs. Epifania began with her own efforts, selling only candies, sodas, bread, basic grains, among other necessary products. She is asking for this financing for working capital, with which she will be able to buy necessary materials for her customers.

loans.use: Money for work

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa S. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is a 41-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. To make a living, Rufa owns and operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income comes from buying and selling vegetables like onions and spices within the local community. Rufa has been involved in this business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rufa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rufa successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rufa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Rufa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She runs her small business selling retail household items in the central market of her hometown of Melitopol. Nadezhda has been working in this sphere of business for over 12 years. Her venture has benefited greatly from lending assistance. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 25,000 Grivnyas. Her profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and generate additional income as a result. She is hoping to invest a portion of the increased income in improving her living conditions and purchasing necessary domestic appliances.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas 4 Group

texts.en:
Marisol is one of the members of the group "Mujeres Capacitadas" 4 (Capable Women), which is comprised of five micro-business people and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. All the members sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Marisol's family is formed by her long-term partner and three children. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town whose economy is dependent on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. The town also has a large Dominican and Haitian immigrant population who live with very limited resources.

Marisol is very excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza Internacional. She plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells silver jewelry. She will use her business income to save. She is dreaming of having an improved business with high income. Marisol enjoys doing business and sharing with friends. Thank you so much for supporting this loan.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: Napoleón tiene 45 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de música. El es muy conocido en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. Tiene más de 12 años en su negocio. Su mayor desafío es lograr que su grupo lleguen a ser reconocidos de manera internacional. Su negocio inicio como un pasatiempo, pues su profesión  es maestro pero al no encontrar trabajo decide dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pianos, trompetas, guitarras y otros instrumentos que necesita.
texts.en: Napoleón is 45 years old and is a musician. He is well known in his community, and in high demand with his customers. He has been in business for over 12 years. His biggest challenge is getting his band to be recognized internationally. This job started as a passtime, as he is trained as a teacher, but when he was unable to find work, he decided to devote himself to this activity. The funds being requested are for the purchase of pianos, trumpets, guitars and other necessary instrucments.

loans.use: Purchase pianos, trumpets, guitars and other necessary instruments

loans.name: Bakhtigul

texts.ru: Норматова Бахтигул проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 24 года. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее брат находится заграницей на заработках. Сама Бахтигул занимается торговлей, она в основном продает разные ткани. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки тканей. То есть для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Bakhtigul N. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 24 years old. She is not married. She has secondary education and lives with her parents. Her brother is now working abroad. Bakhtigul is in retail, she mainly sells different kinds of fabrics. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and to increase the variety.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.es:
La señora Bernadina Valencia vaquerizo, vive en la ribera Morelia lugar que esta a una hora de copainala, ella vive en unión libre con el señor  florentino Gómez Pérez y tiene tres hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Griselda de diesi seis años, Antonia de once años y la más pequeña  es Opdulia de tres años de edad.
    Ella  se dedica a la compra  Va de ropas y solicito el préstamo para surtirse con mas  mercancía de mejor calidad, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y cuatro meses, en donde nos comenta que le va bien.
    Inicio su actividad hace dos años y cuatro meses ya que decidió trabajar por la mucha necesidad que hay en estos tiempos a un que también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo también trabaja en el campo  los dos trabajan para que juntos tengan su hogar. 
    Su sueño es que con esta actividad y el préstamo  pueda aumentar día con día  su trabajo así su solvencia económica sea mejor  para poder apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bernadina Valencia Vaquerizo lives in a common law union with Mr. Florentino Gómez Pérez in a place called Ribera Morelia that’s an hour from Copainala.  They have three children in their care:  Griselda, 16, Antonia, 11 and the youngest, Obdulia, 3.

She is clothing merchant and requested the loan to stock up with more, better quality merchandise.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and four months and she comments that she does well in it.

She started the business two years and four months ago because she decided to go to work due to the great need that’s current these days. Even though she has her husband’s support, who works in the fields, they both have to work so that they can have a home together.

Her dream is that with the business and the loan she can grow daily in her work so that her economic solvency will be better and she can support her children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Amandine

texts.fr: Jeune revendeuse de34 ans, Amandine est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Depuis le voyage de son mari en Allemagne, elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants. Elle vend des produits de beauté dans une boutique qu’elle a  louée. Elle à commencée depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne souvent à Lagos(NIGERIA) et sur place.
texts.en: A young 34-year-old reseller, Amandine is married with two children.  Since her husband left for Germany, she is taking care of her children alone.  She sells beauty products in a rented boutique.  She began her business in 2003 and often buys her supplies in Lagos (Nigeria) or locally.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, wigs, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Despertar Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Despertar” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se desempeñan en diferentes negocios, los cuales son venta de ropa interior, venta de miel y legumbres, producción y venta de mermeladas, confección de cortinaje, fabricación de estructuras metálicas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. 
Erika quien en la foto aparece sentada en primera fila y ocupa el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha, viste una casaca color blanco y un pañuelo color lila en el cuello, ella se dedica a vender ropa de segunda mano en su casa durante todo el día y los fines de semana, vende ropa en una feria libre. Sus clientes son frecuentes por lo tanto ya los conoce y les brinda facilidades de pago. Ella compra su mercadería, específicamente dos fardos de ropa, cada tres meses en la ciudad de Santiago.
Erika en los próximos meses comenzará otro negocio y será la venta de confites, bebidas y sándwich, para ello está esperando que le entreguen un kiosco que ubicará afuera de un colegio, por lo que invertirá el dinero del crédito en mercadería para abastecer su nuevo negocio. Si éste no llegase a funcionar comprará más fardos de ropa para abastecer su primer negocio.
Sus metas son  concretar finalmente éste anhelo del nuevo negocio y darle trabajo a su nuera, así Erika tendrá la posibilidad de distribuir su tiempo de acuerdo a sus dos negocios. Además desearía que su negocio de venta de ropa se expandiera y poder fabricar un galpón en el patio de su casa para habilitarlo como tienda de ropa, con probadores y exhibidores incluidos.
Erika vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 18 años y su nieta de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son tener un negocio independiente que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza. Le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que aprende con las capacitaciones, además ha podido integrar estos conocimientos a su negocio, por lo que ahora distribuye sus gastos y se encuentra más organizado.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Despertar” (To Awaken) and is composed of 18 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of businesses such as: underwear sales, honey and vegetable sales, marmalade making and selling, drape and curtain making, metallic structure manufacturing.  All are from the city of Talca.

Erika, who in the photo appears seated in the first row on the first spot from left to right and is wearing a white jacket with a lilac kerchief around her neck, sells used clothes at home all day and on weekends at a farmers market.  Her customers are recurring so she knows them and gives them easy payment terms.  She buys her merchandise, specifically bundles of clothes, every three months in the city of Santiago.

In the next few months, Erika will start a new business selling snacks, beverages and sandwiches.  To do so, she’s awaiting delivery of a sales kiosk that she’ll set up outside a school.  She will, therefore, invest the loan money in merchandise to stock her new business.  If it doesn’t work out for her though, she’ll buy more bundles of clothes to stock her original business.

Her goals are to finally be able to make the new business a reality and to provide work for her daughter-in-law while Erika will be able to split her time among both businesses.  Besides, she’d like her clothing sales business to expand and to build a shed in her yard to set it up as a clothing store with dressing rooms and display cases included.

Erika lives with her husband, her 18-year-old daughter and 9-year-old granddaughter.  Her dream on a personal level is to have an independent business that will allow her to have a better quality of life for her family.

She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza.  She likes taking part in the meetings very much because she learns from the trainers.  Besides, she’s managed to apply what she’s learned to her business; she now spreads out her expenses and is more organized.

Talca is part of the Maule region located in the center of our country.  It is the region’s administrative, economic and cultural center being the most important city in Chile’s Central Valley.  There is a curious reference to Talca in Chile, the phrase: “Talca, Paris and London.”  Among the myths relating to it, some say it derives from what an Englishman once said: “Talca parece Londres,” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and clothes.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 33 years old. He is married and has three children who are school-aged. He is a farmer from Narok, Kenya, where he has been farming for 10 years. 

His farm produces wheat and maize, which he sells through middlemen. He has applied for his second loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD., to prepare land and buy maize seeds. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's living. 

He plans to acquire more acres of land to expand his farming in the near future.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting maize and to buy seeds

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 32 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a live-in and mother of three school-aged dependents.

Rovelyn operates a retail shop at home to earn a living. She has been engaged in selling food in pouches, biscuits, candies, coffee, milk in sachets and detergent soap for five years. She earns PHP 7,000 per month in this type of business. Rovelyn requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase stocks to sell.

Rovelyn is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Rovelyn hopes to expand her retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys es una persona muy trabajadora, D. 50 años D. edad,esta casada.Ella posee una pequeña despensa en la Ciudad D. Itá, esto la ha ayudado a generar una buena cantidad D. ingresos.
La cliente comenta que por medio D. la despensa pueD. mantener lo gastos D. la casa, ademas D. eso, su marido la ayuda con los gastos, por medio D. su trabajo D. agricultor. Ella se define como una mujer muy sacrificada y esta muy contenta D. trabajar, ya que sabe que el trabajo es la única forma D. salir adelante.
Solicita el credito para la compra D. carne, legumbres, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para ofrecerlos en su negocio. Esta esperanzada en el credito ya que sabe que le sera D. grana ayuda.
texts.en: Mrs. Gladys is a very hard working person.  She is 50 years old and married.  She has a small shop in the city of Itá, and this has helped her earn a good living.  She shares that the store allows her to proviD. for many expenses of the home.  Her husband also helps with the expenses with his work as a farmer.  She describes herself as a very sacrificial woman and she is very happy to work, as she knows that work is the only way to get ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy meat, legumes, beverages, vegetables, and other products to offer for sale in her business.  She is hopeful for the loan because she knows it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: buy meat, legumes, drinks, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 31ans et le moins âgé a 19ans.03 vont a l’école et elle a 05 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du dolo depuis 10ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les marchés des villages environnants. Ses clients sont ses voisins, amis et tous ceux qui fréquentent le marché ou elle vend.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de mil rouge et une demi-camionnette de bois.

Mme économise ses bénéfices pour entretenir ses enfants et construire sa maison. Elle ambitionne ouvrir plusieurs lieu de vente du dolo, vendre aussi du bois par camionnette et s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. Mariam is a widow and the mother of six children. The eldest is 31 years old, and the youngest is 19. Three of them go to school. Mariam has five persons to support. She has been selling dolo (a kind of beer) for ten years. She gets her supplies from the markets of surrounding villages. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and anyone who comes to the market where she sells. She wants to buy 10 sacks of red millet and a half truckload of wood. Mariam is saving her profits to care for her children and to build a house. Her ambition is to open several dolo outlets and also to sell truckloads of wood and to cover the cost of schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of red millet and a half truckload of wood

loans.name: Rosario Consuelo

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Rosario es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos ha podido poder su negocio y salir adelante. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, la menor de ellos aun vive en su casa y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es mecánico.

Es una gran ama de casa que para generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos del hogar hace 10 años instalo un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual vende golosinas, dulces, sodas, agua, energizantes, entre otras bebidas. Empezó con muy poco y poco a poco ha ido aumentando su negocio y esto gracias a los créditos. Cerca de su casa hay unas canchas donde muchas personas hacen deporte y son sus clientes. Nos dice que a más de ganarse algo ella se entretiene en su negocio. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar golosinas, energizantes, sodas, aguas, entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primero de Abril", meaning "April the First", meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for the handicrafts recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place of origin of the famous straw Panama hats..

Rosario is the founding member of the communal bank and she appreciates it for the loan that she has been able to have for her business, which helped her move forward. She is 50 years old, married, and from her relationship she has five grown children. The youngest of them still lives at home and attends high school. Her husband is a mechanic.

She is a happy housewife who 10 years ago set up a small pub in her house in order to have her own money and to help with the household expenses. She sells snacks, sweets, sodas, water, energy drinks, and other types of drinks. She started out very gradually but she has been increasing her business and this has been possible thanks to these loans. Near her home there is a sports facility where many individuals participate and they are her clients. She tells us that in addition to earning some money she also feels occupied.

She will use this loan to purchase snacks, energy drinks, soft drinks, water, and other products.

Her dream is to see her daughter enjoy a great career.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, energy drinks, soft drinks, water, etc.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 35-year-old man. He is married and has three children aged between nine and two years old to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He runs a general store at Kimongo in Kitengela in which he sells such items as plates, cups and thermos flasks. He has been running this business for three years now and has managed to give employment to one person. 

Lawrence says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 24,500 to buy more household items to grow his business to wholesale and to meet the demands of his customers. He describes himself as a visionary person.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old and married to Mary. They have four school-going children. 

He has been operating his quarry business alongside his motorbike transport business for the past 19 years, making a monthly profit of KES 12,000.

This is his first loan. He has been loaned KES 10,000, with which he plans to buy an extra quarrying site.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to add an extra motorbike and purchase another quarry. In the near future, he plans to buy himself a canter that will enhance transport to and from the quarrying site.

loans.use: to buy an extra quarrying site.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and married with one child. 

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & reselling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for seven years and also earns an income from her motorcycle transport business. 

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Liria

texts.es:
Liria tiene 67 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es casada y madre D. un hijo, ya mayor e independiente, viven juntos, y él ya asume gastos del hogar.
Su trabajo consiste en la elaboración y venta D. tamales y humitas, empanadas y papa rellena, platillos que tienen mucha demanda en su región.  Es así que su labor empieza desD. muy temprano, yendo al mercado a comprar los insumos necesarios como maíz molido, harina, carne D. pollo y chancho; especias. Estos platillos lo aprendió D. su madre, tanto en el proceso D. la preparación como en la sazón, y eso le ha generado muchos seguidores que siempren consume lo que venD.. 
La mayoría D. sus clientes son aquellos que son atendidos en la vulcanozadora D. su hijo, cuy taller se encuentra cerca D. su casa. Le gusta su trabajo, además D. que le genera ganancias la hace una mujer independiente. Mas adelante desearía tener una fuente D. soda en su casa, para que pueda tener un servicio más completo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración D. sus productos.
texts.en:
Liria is 67 years old. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is married and the mother of one son, who is already grown and independent. They live together, and he covers some household expenses. 

Her work consists of preparing and selling tamales and humitas [corn cakes], as well as empanadas and stuffed potatoes. These are dishes in great demand in her region. Her work starts very early in the morning, when she goes to the market to buy the necessary ingredients such as ground corn, flour, chicken, pork and spices. She learned to make these dishes from her mother, who taught her both the preparation process and the seasoning, and they have earned her a great following of customers who regularly eat what she sells. 

Most of her customers are people who are getting service at her son's tire repair business; the workshop is located near their home. She likes her work, because in addition to generating income, it makes her an independent woman. In the future, she would like to have a soda fountain in her home, so that she can offer more complete service. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for support from each one of you. With the amount she is requesting, she will buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is from the village of Lalog 1. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. His wife manages her rolling store where she sells different kinds of food. 

Samuel has been engaged in corn production for almost 18 years. He earned approximately 79,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from his last crop. They worked hard to provide for their needs and give their children a good quality of life and to be able to send them to school. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production

loans.name: Bhelrey

texts.en:
Bhelrey is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Bhelrey has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas. Bhelrey has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

In the future, Bhelrey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy commercial fertilizer for his rice crops

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en: Cornelius lives in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya, where he has worked as a farmer for the last four years, producing mostly milk and eggs for the local market. He is 28 years old, single, and also runs a money-transfer business with a local mobile telecommunication firm. He is applying for a loan for 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help expand his poultry-farming business by buying more chickens. He believes there is potential for growth here and hopes to become a large-scale provider of poultry products in the near future. He plans to repay this loan with the increased money he earns from his business. His  main challenges are the high cost of feed and the prevention of animal disease.

loans.use: to increase egg production by buying more chickens.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, engaged and lives with three family members, two of whom work.

Mohamad has been an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to add more foodstuffs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 57-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store for 8 years. Lorna sells items like canned goods, softdrinks, shampoo and soap. Lorna works hard to improve her business and her family's living situation.

Lorna requested this loan to pay for school fees and to buy more items to sell like canned goods. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business. Lorna also hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy more items to sell like canned goods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old and she is a single mother of two children. She has been running a beauty and cosmetic shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Josephine will use the loan to expand into livestock farming through buying pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to have a pig farm which will help her cater for her children’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is fifty-two years old and is married with two children.

Talosaga owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has many years of experience in this business. Talosaga needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Talosaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Talosaga's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodrigo de 33 años, soltero trabajando siempre como guarda de seguridad, sus hijos creciendo cada vez más todavía van a la escuela ya que su propósito es ser personas de bien por eso el los apoya incondicionalmente al igual que a su anciana madre con quien él vive, que no tiene quien la proteja y cuide, ahora con este octavo crédito desea terminar de construir un cuarto y parte de las paredes de su casa para lo cual necesita comprar bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, alambre y una puerta de madera, para que su madre e hijos vivan en un ambiente cómodo y acogedor, es por eso que cada vez que puede solicita crédito para el mismo objetivo de mejora, porque le preocupa el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, alambre y una puerta de madera.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is from Sis village, where she lives with her husband and son. She is an agronomist with many years of experience running a farm. The farm currently includes livestock as well as an orchard with different fruit trees.

Ramela's husband sells the harvest in nearby local markets and gathers income for the family. This hard-working family is now in need of financial support to increase the farm operation that they are currently running. The loan of USD 2,500 will assist Ramela to purchase pigs, chickens, cows and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a huge support for Ramela and she will be very grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, chickens, cows and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ivy is 33 years old and has one child in school.

Ivy has a buy and sell food supplement business in the Philippines. Ivy requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of food supplement to sell.

Ivy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ivy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food supplement to sell

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito sells crab meat to the local community. He has been working with seafood for over 15 year. He gets up at 4 every morning to buy crabs from fishermen. He and his wife then spend the next couple of hours cooking the crab and removing the crab meat. He puts the meat in plastic containers and then sells it to the public. He and his wefe have 3 kids who are all in school and often help out in the business. His wife is a housekeeper who works in the city. Their short term goal is to fix their home before the rainy season gets bad. Currently their roof leaks and it is very vulnerable to heavy rains.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy crab at wholesale prices

loans.name: Titin

texts.en: Titin is a 28 year old mother of three children aged 10, 6 and 3. The first two are girls and the youngest is a boy. She makes and sells Indonesian salad called “gado-gado”. She used to sell gado-gado using a table but now she has a small bamboo stall of her own. Her husband passed away 4 years ago, therefore she is the only one who fights for her and her children’s living. She very much wants to earn more income for her children’s education and to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano is 39 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He learned the shoe making trade as an assistant in a shoe shop when he was very young. After working and saving for several years in the shoe shop, he had enough to open his own shop. Today he works in his shop with two of his sons, whom he has trained in the business. His 6 children are in school. The oldest, a daughter, is beginning her studies in Forest Engineering at the National University of Asuncion. His wife also contributes to the family income, as she has worked in lottery sales for more than 15 years.

He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials. He needs to increase his sales because he has a large family and now his daughter needs more support because she has begun university studies.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Sinforiano tiene 39 años y es casado con 6 hijos. Aprendió el Oficio de zapatero trabajando como ayudante de zapatería cuando era muy joven. Despues de trabajar varios años en una zapatería como empleado y ahorrar lo suficiente pudo montar su propia zapatería. Hoy día trabaja en la misma ayudado por dos de sus hijos, a quienes ha enseñado el oficio. Sus 6 hijos están estudiando. La mayor esta iniciando la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción. La esposa tambien aporta al presupuesto de la familia. Es corredora de Quinielas (loteria) desde hace mas de 15 años.

Planea utilizar el crédito en la compra de materia prima. Necesita aumentar sus ventas ya que tiene una familia numerosa y particularmente ahora que su hija mayor demanda mas gastos porque empezó la universidad.

loans.use: To buy leather and soles for shoes.

loans.name: "tina" Cristina

texts.en: Cristina G. is the proud mother of 3 children. However, her children have left their home, leaving Cristina to take care of her grandchildren, her husband and herself. For this purpose she’s taking a loan. It is her second loan, and a larger loan than her last. She plans to buy cooking oil, rice, beans, some refreshments and the general components of the typical Dominican diet (typical foods are referred to as the “banner” of colors: white rice topped with red beans and the dark color of some kind of meat, which represents the blue on the Dominican flag) to stock her little “colmado” or general food store. She says she won't sell otherwise very lucrative alcoholic beverages as her religion doesn’t allow for it! This is only one example that illustrates that she’s a responsible person.

loans.use: Tina wants to restock her store.

location.town: Santa Rosa Community of Villas Lindas

loans.name: Yuanita

texts.en:
Yuanita H. is a 45-year-old practitioner who runs her own private facility at Ahero Kisumu, Kenya. The image shows her examining a patient.

Yuanita H., a widow, lives with her five children, who all attend school and college. Since she trained and qualified in clinical medicine in 1990, she has worked at a government hospital.

She also runs a private clinic in the middle of a market. The clinic serves the mostly very poor community in the area. She is also an HIV AIDS coordinator in the Nyando district in Kenya. Her facility offers a wide range of services, including family planning, curative and preventive medicine, counseling, and includes a laboratory and pharmacy. The clinic also links paediatric ARVs to health facilities.

The community appreciates her work, which she can provide with the financial support she receives from K-MET. To further expand her clinic, she requests a loan of US $1200.

loans.use: Establish a more spacious and comprehensive clinic

loans.name: Suos

texts.en: Mrs. Suos S. O., 30, is married with one little kid and lives with her husband and her younger sister in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. In order to supplement their household income she and her husband work raising small rubber trees and selling them after one to two months. They can typically earn about $4 each day. This couple would like to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike to assist in their family and business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to assist in their family and business transportation.

loans.name: Oae

texts.en: Creativity and artistic talent have allowed Oae S. to establish a successful elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) printing company, and her business skills have allowed her to establish a second company that sells chips and ice cakes (or popsickles). Age is not a problem for this 61-year-old mother, whose dedication and energy keep her very happy selling products to people not just in her town, but in nearby towns as well.  She earns about $60 a week, and is very grateful for the financial assistance extended to her in pervious loans. She plans to use this new loan to buy more supplies for her printing and food businesses.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei printing business and her food stall

loans.name: Cintia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Cintia Elizabeth C. H. is a native of the city of Bluefields, of African-Caribbean descent and is 44 years old. She is married to Mr. Armin Monroe, who is not currently working due to illness. They have a 4-year-old daughter and 2 sons, 18 and 19 years old, who are studying at university and whose tuition is paid with income from the sale of baked goods and coconut bread. She has more than 30 years of experience. Her potential customers are the students, office workers and other people who pass by, and who prefer her because she has a home-delivery service. Mrs. C. needs to buy 3 short hundredweights of flour at $32.00 per short hundredweight, 2 short hundredweights of sugar at $34.00 per short hundredweight, 2 cans of oil at $27.00 each, 10 pounds of butter at $1.00 a pound, 2 boxes of lard at $16.00 each, and 8 bags of charcoal at $5.00 each. With this investment she will be able to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Cintia Elizabeth C. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, descendiente afrocaribeña, tiene 44 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Armin Monroe que en estos no esta trabando por estar enfermo, ambos tienen 1 niña de 4 años de edad y 2 hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad que están cursando los estudios universitarios que son pagados con el ingreso de la venta de repostería y pan de coco, tiene mas de 30 años de experiencia, teniendo como clientes potenciales los estudiantes de los colegios, trabajadores de las oficinas y personan que transitan en las calles que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio. La Sra. C. necesita comprar 3 quintales de harina a $ 32.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 34.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 27.00 dólares cada bidón, 10 libras de mantequilla a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 2 cajas de manteca a $ 16.00 dólares cada caja, 8 sacos de carbón a $ 5.00 dólares cada saco, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, oil, butter, lard and charcoal.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en: Huseyn is 33 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. This man is married, has one child. He run this business 5 years ago. Now this man needs a loan of $850 to buy a calf for improving his cattle breeding.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Nery Marlith

texts.en:
Nery Marlith R. A. owns a business where she distributes beer and soda in the jungle city of Tarapoto in the State of San Martin. She runs the business from her house where she has plenty of space. Nery supplies bars and large parties with their favorite beverages, including Coke, Pepsi, Cuscana, and Pilsen.  

Nery is 36 years old and has two children. She is happy that she can work from home where she can look after her young children and help them study. Nery is hard-working and receives little help. She loves finding new clients and building relationships with them. Her business is her family’s only source of income.

A member of the community bank Las Orquidias, Nery is requesting a loan of s/ 1000 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the money to buy more soda and beer to respond to the excess demand.

loans.use: Purchase of soda and beer for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
E. is twenty three years old and unmarried young woman. She sells fresh vegetables like garden eggs (eggplant), tomatoes, peppers, and onions, and spices, for the past four years in Cape Coast.

She wants to use proceeds of her operation to expand her store. She wants to use her loan to buy more products.

E. is member of the group called "Our Helper." Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more garden eggs, tomatoes, ginger, onions, etc

loans.name: Putu

texts.id:
Putu S., 46 year old, is a mother of two. Her husband works as a fish seller. They live in Mertasari street in Denpasar, Bali.

Her husband's income is low and therefore she needs to work to help with the family's finance. She opens a store at her house, selling basic daily necessities such as food, cooking ingredients etc.

The recent gas price increase drove the increase of the price of other goods, including the prices of daily necessities. Therefore she needs more capital to be able to buy goods for her store's inventory. She hopes she can get loan money to add her working capital.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Putu S. , seorang ibu 46 tahun dengan 2 orang anak, saat ini tinggal di Jl. Mertasari Denpasar. Usaha suaminya sebagai pedagang ikan tidak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Oleh karena itu dia harus ikut bekerja untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Usahanya saat ini adalah sebagai penjual sembako untuk kebutuhan rumaha tangga. Saat ini Putu S. sangat membutuhkan bantuan dana untuk menambah barang jualannya. Kenaikan BBM sangat mempengaruhi naiknya harga barang dan sembako sehingga klien perlu bantuan modal untuk tetap bisa menjalankan usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Elda Maria

texts.es:
Elda is married and is the mother of two children who are 17 and 7 years of age. Two years ago, she began to sell refreshments to help and contribute towards expenses. Because of this situation and so not to neglect her home, she began to sell refreshments in her own home. Currently, her sales are greater but she lacks capital to invest in more merchandise. And, since the distance to the distributor is far, and she needs to buy more, she doesn't want to pay for freight service so that her business is more profitable.

She is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase merchandise. With your help, Elda C. move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elda, es casada y madre de 2 hijos de 17 y 7 años. Comenzó hace 2 años a vender refrescos para ayudarse con sus gastos y contribuir con los gastos , por tal situación y para no descuidar su casa comenzó a vender refrescos en su propio hogar, en la actualidad sus ventas ya son mayores, y le hace falta capital para invertir en mas mercancía, ya que la distancia a la distribuidora es lejana y necesita comprar mas para no estar pagando servicio de flete tan seguido y que su negocio sea mas rentable.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. con tu ayuda Elda saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Because she wanted to work in the textile arts ever since she was a little girl, Josefina is an excellent seamstress. She has sewing machines which she uses to do her daily work. She makes all manner of clothing which she sells from home, sometimes on credit. At 60 years old, Josefina still has the desire to keep working. She has 4 children, and, having separated from her husband some time ago, she lives with a son who is very supportive. Josefina would like to rent a location for her tailoring shop, and she is asking to borrow the money that she needs to do that, from you. Lets help Josefina, a talented mother who works hard to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Sus aspiraciones desD. muy joven han sido el arte textil, es por eso que la señora Josefina es una excelente costurera, ella cuenta con máquinas D. coser, que son D. mucha utilidad para la realización D. su trabajo diario, ella confecciona ropa para todos los gustos y la venD. a domicilio, dejándola a veces a crédito.La señora Josefina a sus 60 años, aún tiene deseos D. seguir trabajando, tiene 4 hijos, se separó tiempo atrás D. su esposo y ahora vive con uno D. sus hijos quien la apoya en todo.La señora Josefina desea alquilar un local para su taller textil, para ello estima una cantidad D. dinero con la que no cuenta y es el motivo por el que acuD. a ustedes. Apoyemos a la señora Josefina, madre talentosa que se esfuerza arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Rental of a location for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine U. is 47-years old and married with four children. He lives at Ubiaja, Edo state, Nigeria. Augustine runs a rental business. People in his community come to rent chairs and canopies for their social activities. He has been in this business since 2002. Augustine is requesting a loan for $1025 to buy more chairs and canopies for his rental business. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and canopies for his business

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi L., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband, Hira Lal L., and two sons. They are studying in grade 9 and BBS 1 year respectively. Her husband has no work and is also not educated.

She opened her vegetable shop 3 years ago. Both of them work in her small vegetable shop. Her condition is miserable and she is unable to run her house smoothly. She seeks a loan of RS.20000/- to invest in her vegetable shop. She wants to earn money to provide a quality education for their sons and fulfill their basic needs.

loans.use: To invest in her vegetable shop

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla A. est une jeune femme de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est couturière dynamique qui excelle dans son métier manuel installée dans une banlieue célèbre de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Quand ses concurrents se recourent aux nouvelles machines modernes de couture pour bien servir les clients, tout en faisant un bénéfice raisonnable, elle ne veut pas rester indifférente. Elle souhaite par ce nouveau crédit contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire par de nouveaux équipements permettant de prendre rapidement en  compte les attentes de sa clientèle et gagner plus leur confiance. Après encore un peu de travail, elle espère que tout va changer  et qu’elle tirera rapidement profit de cet investissement
texts.en:
Abla A. is a young woman of 28, married and the mother of two children. She is an energetic seamstress, who works in a famous suburb of Lomé, the capital of Togo, and excels in her handicraft. She cannot remain indifferent to the fact that her competitors have resorted to using new, modern sewing machines to better serve their customers, while still making a handsome profit. With this new loan, Alba hopes to give her business an edge by purchasing new equipment that would allow her to quickly meet her customers’ expectations and further gain their confidence. After a bit of work, she hopes that everything will change and she will take in a quick profit from this investment.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and fabric to sell

loans.name: Luch

texts.en: Mrs. Luch S. is a villager in Krous village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice. Because her rice field has become infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers to support her field to produce higher yields. This will improve her income and her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Phoung Mao, pulls water lillies from the lake. Mrs. Luch S. is 37 years old and is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers to support her field to make crop more productive.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo”  desD. hace 8 años, que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno.
Tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre D. 8 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen D. ella y continúan estudiando, es casada, su esposo trabaja en construcción. Ella estudio el sexto grado D. Primaria. Lucia con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la compra D. animales menores como chanchos, ovejas y vacas para engorD..

Actualmente continua con el negocio D. crianza D. animales  que venD. en la Feria D. Acora y Chacachaca, contando siempre con el  apoyo D. su esposo y así pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas  comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD..
La señora Lucia manifiesta que los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos son un apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia has been a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit) for the past 8 years. It is located at Centro Pobaldo D. Chimbo within the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno.

She is 50 years old and she is mother of 8 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her and are still in school. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. She has a graD. 6 education. With the first loan Lucia received of S/.300 she decided to invest the funds in the purchase of small livestock such as pigs, lambs and calves.
