She is currently still with the same business raising livestock, selling them in the fairs of Acora and Chacachaca. She can always count on the support of her husband and therefore always manage to make her loan payments on time.

With this loan of S/.2000 nuevos sles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will purchase 1 head of cattle.

Lucia says that the loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is a great support for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle.

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Chu Thị L. 40 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị L. là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Với việc chăn nuôi 100 con gà, 10 con lợn và 4 con bò, thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.800.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị L. mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Chu Thi L. is 40 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, the major source of income of Mrs. L.'s family is from raising poultry/livestock and farming. With 100 chickens, 10 pigs and 4 cows, the income of her family reaches VND3,800,000 per month. In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to invest in poultry/livestock raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry/livestock

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
D. Ayawa est âgée de 39 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame tient une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis des années.
Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage d’approvisionnement de ses stocks de marchandises et autres comme les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés en vue de revente et augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayawa D. is 39 years old and the mother of three. She lives in Lomé, the Togolese capital, and has had a grocery store for years now. With this second loan, she would like to stock more merchandise, such as beverages, flip-flops, canned food, and various other items for resale and for expanding her commerce. The profits from her work will enable her to do better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: He

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hệ năm nay 54 tuổi. Chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị đang sống cùng hai con tại xã Quảng Khê huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại gia đình chị  làm công việc dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi và  mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi He is 54 yrs old. Her husband unfortunately died early; she currently lives with her 2 children in the village of Quang Khe, the district of Quang Xuong in the town of Thanh Hoa. In 2003 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the family business of weaving sedge mats. Presently she has the business of weaving sedge mats as well as raising pigs. These are the main sources of income for her family averaging 178 USD per month. For her next loan she wishes to borrow 475 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise, and to buy additional supplies for her mat-weaving business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mat-weaving business, raising pigs

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
La familia del señor Isidro E. está compuesta por sus tres pequeños hijos y su cónyuge los cuales son mantenidos por el señor Isidro ya que él trabaja arduamente todos los días para el sustento de su hogar. El señor Isidro como todo padre responsable al ver la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda por el hecho de que ha estado en malas condiciones, ha decidido reconstruirla para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos y cónyuge en el municipio de Somotillo.
Para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar en su obra de reconstrucción comprando los materiales de construcción para beneficiar a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo y así tener un techo y pared digna donde habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro E.’s family is comprised of his 3 young children and his wife, for whom he works arduously on a daily basis to cover the household expenses. Mr. E., like any responsible father, has decided to repair his house because it is in pretty bad shape and he wants to improve her family’s living conditions in the municipality of Somotillo. For this, he is turning to Ceprodel hoping to obtain a loan so that he can continue his home improvement work and purchase the building materials he needs. Thus, his family can benefit from having a decent dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Азимов Джуманазар житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Уже 25 лет обеспечивает семью ,занимаясь сельским хозяйством. Арендует землю , которую засеивает пшеницей. Сейчас необходимо удобрять засеинную пшеницу , поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует использовать для покупки удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Jumanazar A. is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 52 years old, is married and has six children. For 25 years now he has provided for his family by doing agriculture work. He rents land on which he plants wheat. Right now it is necessary to fertilize the planted wheat and this is why he turned to us for a loan. He plans to use the money to purchase fertilizer. Jumanazar will be able to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertizlizer for wheat

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo, su hija y sus nietos. Tiene una chacra donde siembra plátanos para luego venderlos en el mercado de su localidad, como esta fruta no se produce cada mes, sino que tiene su temporada (cada 6 meses), se ve obligada a comprar plátanos en otras chacras para mantener activo su negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 8 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es el encargado de cosechar o comprar los plátanos para que luego Teofila los lleve a vender al mercado. Lo que  le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse activa, además que le es rentable, ya que es una fruta de gran demanda, y se vende muy bien y a diario. Ya son 6 préstamos que Teofila tiene con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son personas buenas y puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad es para la compra de 1000 soles en plátanos, lo demás lo invertirá en su chacra, para el adecuado mantenimiento de sus platanales.
texts.en:
Teofila is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her husband, daughter, and grandchildren. She has a small farm in which she grows plantains that she sells in her local market. Because this fruit is seasonal (it is produced every 6 months), she is forced to purchase plantains from other farms so that she can keep her business afloat. She has been in business for 8 years, and counts on her husband, who is in charge of picking the fruit or buying it from other farms, for support. Teofila then sells the plantains at the market. What she likes about her job is that it allows her to stay active. Furthermore, it is lucrative because this fruit is in high demand and sells well everyday. Teofila has obtained 6 loans with MFP, and what she likes about her microfinance institute is that all of its members are good people who are punctual with their repayments. The money that she is requesting at this time will be used to purchase 1,000.00 PEN worth of plantains. The rest will be invested in her farm, so that she can properly maintain her plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm investment and purchase plantains

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad has been working as a mason for 25 years. He also owns a school van. Mouhamad does his work well. His clients can be anybody from his region. He has not had any difficulties since he first started his work. Mouhamad decided on this work because he wanted to improve his family’s income. He is a 43-year old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children.

Mouhamad has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans on expanding both his businesses.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Sohelah Group

texts.en: Sohelah is the group leader of the four-member Sohelah group. All of the group members are requesting money for their businesses. Sakoko and Anesa want to take a loan for their tailoring business in order to buy three machines. Sohelah wants to take a loan for her husband’s car parts business so that he can buy materials for his shop. Hafeza wants to take a loan for her brother’s general store business so that he can enlarge his shop. With this loan, the group members can improve their businesses and support their families, thus making a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy materials for car parts shop

loans.name: Walter Danilo

texts.es: Don Walter es Licenciado en Administracion de Empresas, casado, de 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (2 estudian la primaria, 1 universidad y una niña de 14 meses de nacida).  Trabaja en el Super San Antonio como Gerente Comercial con 19 años de servicio con un horario de 8 a 5 de la tarde todos los dias de la semana, ya que es socio del negocio que es familiar, ademas tiene transporte selectivo de servicio de taxi donde obtiene una utilidad cada mes, su esposa trabaja en el INTA desde hace 8 años y aporta a los gastos del hogar.Esta solicitando su credito para la compra de materiales y pago de mano de obra para la construccion del techo del porhce de su casa de habitacion, el costo total de la obra es mucho mayor que el credito solicitado, pero el asumira la diferencia.  Es conocido en la ciudad como una persona honesta, resposnable y cumplido con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Walter studied business administration. He is married and 41 years old, and has 4 children (two in elementary school, one in the university, and one 14-month-old daughter). He works as a manager in the Super San Antonio grocery store. He has been working there for 19 years from 8 to 5 every day, since he's a partner in the business, which is owned by his family. He also has a taxi service from which he earns some income each month. His wife has worked for INTA for 8 years and contributes to domestic expenses. He is requesting a loan to pay for materials and labor in order to build a roof for the porch of his house. The total cost of the project is much more than the loan requested, but he will cover the difference. He is known in the city to be an honest, responsible, and conscientious person.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a porch

loans.name: Agblemassa

texts.fr: Agblemassa A. est un homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il fait des pépinières de jeunes plants qu’il revend à la population. Ce secteur est très prometteur à cause de la forte demande. il désire avec ce crédit élargir son espace d’exploitation et acheter des intrants pour accroître la capacité de son activité. Il compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Agblemassa A. is a 35-year-old man, married, and the father of two. He has a nursery for young plants, which he sells to people. This sector is very promising due to the strong demand. He would like to use this loan to enlarge his growing area and to buy fertilizers and the like to expand his business capacity. He is counting on this great opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inputs and to expand his area

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela D. Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y es madre D. 06 hijos (2 a su cargo).  No tiene estudios, vive en la Parcialidad D. Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado mayor, comprará ganado vacuno para engorD..

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos, y luego comprarse su casita en Ilave.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, los encuentros y las charlas que se dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Manuela D. Hoy” Community Bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 53-year-old married mother of six, two of whom she still cares for. She doesn't have a formal education and lives in the village of Camicachi. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past five years, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase small livestock. Currently she is requesting a loan of 2,500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase cattle to fatten and sell. Her wish is to keep working and to proviD. for her children's education and then buy herself a home in Ilave. Elsa enjoys the savings, interactions and talks she receives from her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle to fatten and sell

loans.name: Laadi

texts.en: Laadi A. is married and has four dependents. She has a primary school education. Laadi sells groundnut and maize at the new market Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a driver. Laadi uses her income to pay for school fees. Laadi will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Laadi plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 49 year-old father of four who supplies fruits in Eastlands in Nairobi. Samuel has been in this business for the past 27 years. Samuel is requesting his second loan of Ksh. 50,000 after successful completion of his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to increase his stock of fruits. He hopes to one day own a wholesale shop and have rental units. In the future, Samuel would like to buy a home for his family. He describes himself as good, social, jovial and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of fruits

loans.name: Povalu

texts.en:
Povalu L.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. She is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela. She is married and has a baby. Povalu has been engaged in this business for less than one year and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2008, Povalu (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD, which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, Povalu is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be Povalu's second loan from SPBD. Povalu plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment
